Sentence: Je vais laisser la clé sous le tapis.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ lɛ.se la kle su lə ta.pi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh less-SAY lah klay soo luh tah-PEE
Sentence_Translation: I am going to leave the key under the mat.

Sentence: Je pense qu'il est temps de partir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pɑ̃s k‿il ɛ tɑ̃ də paʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh pahns keel eh tahn duh par-TEER
Sentence_Translation: I think that it is time to leave.

Sentence: L'enfant joue tranquillement dans le jardin.
Sentence_IPA: /lɑ̃.fɑ̃ ʒu tʁɑ̃.kil.mɑ̃ dɑ̃ lə ʒaʁ.dɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lahn-FAHN zhoo trahn-KEEL-mahn dahn luh zhar-DAHN
Sentence_Translation: The child plays quietly in the garden.

Sentence: C'est un jeune homme très intelligent.
Sentence_IPA: /s‿ɛ tœ̃ ʒœn ɔm tʁɛ z‿ɛ̃.tɛ.li.ʒɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: seh tun zhuhn ohm treh zahn-tel-ee-ZHAHN
Sentence_Translation: He is a very intelligent young man.

Sentence: Le train va arriver dans cinq minutes.
Sentence_IPA: /lə tʁɛ̃ va a.ʁi.ve dɑ̃ sɛ̃k mi.nyt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh trehn vah ah-ree-VAY dahn sank mee-NOOT
Sentence_Translation: The train is going to arrive in five minutes.

Sentence: Tu peux mettre ton manteau sur le lit.
Sentence_IPA: /ty pø mɛtʁ tɔ̃ mɑ̃.to syʁ lə li/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew puh meh-truh tohn mahn-TOE syur luh lee
Sentence_Translation: You can put your coat on the bed.

Sentence: Ils ont une vie heureuse à la campagne.
Sentence_IPA: /il z‿ɔ̃ tyn vi ø.ʁøz a la kɑ̃.paɲ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel zohn t(y)ewn vee uh-RUHZ ah lah kahn-PAN-yuh
Sentence_Translation: They have a happy life in the countryside.

Sentence: Il faut marcher vite pour ne pas être en retard.
Sentence_IPA: /il fo maʁ.ʃe vit puʁ nə pa ɛtʁ ɑ̃ ʁə.taʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel foe mar-SHAY veet poor nuh pah eh-truh ahn ruh-TAR
Sentence_Translation: We must walk fast to not be late.

Sentence: Est-ce que tu entends ce bruit bizarre ?
Sentence_IPA: /ɛs kə ty ɑ̃.tɑ̃ sə bʁɥi bi.zaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ess-kuh tew ahn-TAHN suh brwee bee-ZAR
Sentence_Translation: Do you hear that weird noise?

Sentence: J'aime écouter de la musique le soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒɛm e.ku.te də la my.zik lə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhem ay-koo-TAY duh lah mew-ZEEK luh swar
Sentence_Translation: I like listening to music in the evening.

Sentence: J'ai besoin d'un peu d'aide s'il te plaît.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe bə.zwɛ̃ dœ̃ pø d‿ɛd sil tə plɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay buh-ZWEHN d(y)uhn puh d’ed seel tuh pleh
Sentence_Translation: I need a little help please.

Sentence: Attends un petit moment, j'arrive tout de suite.
Sentence_IPA: /a.tɑ̃ z‿œ̃ pə.ti mɔ.mɑ̃ ʒa.ʁiv tu də sɥit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah-TAHN z(y)uhn puh-TEE mo-MAHN
Sentence_Translation: zhar-REEV toot suh sweet,Wait a small moment, I am coming right away.

Sentence: Je ne veux pas rester seule ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə nə vø pa ʁɛs.te sœl sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nuh vuh pah res-TAY suhl suh swar
Sentence_Translation: I do not want to stay alone tonight.

Sentence: Il semble être très fatigué après le travail.
Sentence_IPA: /il sɑ̃bl ɛtʁ tʁɛ fa.ti.ɡe a.pʁɛ lə tʁa.vaj/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel sahmbl eh-truh treh fah-tee-GAY ah-PREH luh trah-VYE
Sentence_Translation: He seems to be very tired after work.

Sentence: C'est la meilleure année de ma vie.
Sentence_IPA: /s‿ɛ la mɛ.jœʁ a.ne də ma vi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: seh lah meh-YUR ah-NAY duh mah vee
Sentence_Translation: It is the best year of my life.

Sentence: Tout le monde aime le chocolat ici.
Sentence_IPA: /tu lə mɔ̃d ɛm lə ʃɔ.kɔ.la i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: too luh mohnd em luh sho-ko-LAH ee-SEE
Sentence_Translation: Everyone likes chocolate here.

Sentence: Bonjour Monsieur, comment allez-vous aujourd'hui ?
Sentence_IPA: /bɔ̃.ʒuʁ mə.sjø kɔ.mɑ̃ ta.le vu o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: bohn-ZHOOR muh-SYUH
Sentence_Translation: koh-mahn tah-LAY voo oh-zhoor-DWEE,Hello Sir, how are you today?

Sentence: Ma fille va à l'école le matin.
Sentence_IPA: /ma fij va a le.kɔl lə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah fee-yuh vah ah lay-KOL luh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: My daughter goes to school in the morning.

Sentence: Je voudrais un grand verre d'eau.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vu.dʁɛ œ̃ ɡʁɑ̃ vɛʁ d‿o/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh voo-DREH uhn grahn vair doh
Sentence_Translation: I would like a big glass of water.

Sentence: Je vais appeler ma mère ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ za.pə.le ma mɛʁ sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh zah-puh-LAY mah mair suh swar
Sentence_Translation: I am going to call my mother tonight.

Sentence: Il faut arrêter de fumer pour ta santé.
Sentence_IPA: /il fo a.ʁɛ.te də fy.me puʁ ta sɑ̃.te/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel foe ah-reh-TAY duh fyu-MAY poor tah sahn-TAY
Sentence_Translation: You must stop smoking for your health.

Sentence: Je dors bien toute la nuit.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dɔʁ bjɛ̃ tut la nɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh dor byehn toot lah nwee
Sentence_Translation: I sleep well all night.

Sentence: Les enfants rangent leur chambre le samedi.
Sentence_IPA: /le z‿ɑ̃.fɑ̃ ʁɑ̃ʒ lœʁ ʃɑ̃bʁ lə sam.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay zahn-FAHN rahnzh lur shahn-bruh luh sam-DEE
Sentence_Translation: The children clean their room on Saturdays.

Sentence: Ma voiture est garée devant la maison.
Sentence_IPA: /ma vwa.tyʁ ɛ ɡa.ʁe də.vɑ̃ la mɛ.zɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah vwah-TEWR eh gah-RAY duh-VAHN lah meh-ZOHN
Sentence_Translation: My car is parked in front of the house.

Sentence: Quel est le nom de ton chien ?
Sentence_IPA: /kɛ l‿ɛ lə nɔ̃ də tɔ̃ ʃjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: kel eh luh nohn duh tohn shyehn
Sentence_Translation: What is the name of your dog?

Sentence: Il a beaucoup de travail cette semaine.
Sentence_IPA: /il a bo.ku də tʁa.vaj sɛt sə.mɛn/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel ah boh-KOO duh trah-VYE set suh-MEN
Sentence_Translation: He has a lot of work this week.

Sentence: Mon père aime cuisiner le dimanche.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ pɛʁ ɛm kɥi.zi.ne lə di.mɑ̃ʃ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn pair em kwee-zee-NAY luh dee-MAHNSH
Sentence_Translation: My father likes to cook on Sundays.

Sentence: Ma mère prépare un bon gâteau.
Sentence_IPA: /ma mɛʁ pʁe.paʁ œ̃ bɔ̃ ɡa.to/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah mair pray-PAR uhn bohn gah-TOE
Sentence_Translation: My mother is preparing a good cake.

Sentence: Les gens sont très gentils dans ce village.
Sentence_IPA: /le ʒɑ̃ sɔ̃ tʁɛ ʒɑ̃.ti dɑ̃ sə vi.laʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay zhahn sohn treh zhan-TEE dahn suh vee-LAZH
Sentence_Translation: The people are very nice in this village.

Sentence: Est-ce que tu connais mon frère ?
Sentence_IPA: /ɛs kə ty kɔ.nɛ mɔ̃ fʁɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ess-kuh tew ko-NEH mohn frair
Sentence_Translation: Do you know my brother?

Sentence: Nous partons en vacances le mois prochain.
Sentence_IPA: /nu paʁ.tɔ̃ z‿ɑ̃ va.kɑ̃s lə mwa pʁɔ.ʃɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo par-TOHN zahn vah-KAHNS luh mwah pro-SHEHN
Sentence_Translation: We are going on vacation next month.

Sentence: Je travaille cinq jours par semaine.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə tʁa.vaj sɛ̃k ʒuʁ paʁ sə.mɛn/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh trah-VYE sank zhoor par suh-MEN
Sentence_Translation: I work five days per week.

Sentence: J'habite dans une grande ville en France.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒa.bit dɑ̃ z‿yn ɡʁɑ̃d vil ɑ̃ fʁɑ̃s/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhah-BEET dahn z(y)ewn grahnd veel ahn frahns
Sentence_Translation: I live in a big city in France.

Sentence: Le Canada est un très beau pays.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ka.na.da ɛ tœ̃ tʁɛ bo pe.i/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh kah-nah-DAH eh tun treh boh pay-EE
Sentence_Translation: Canada is a very beautiful country.

Sentence: J'ai trois chats et un chien.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe tʁwa ʃa e t‿œ̃ ʃjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay trwah shah ay t(y)uhn shyehn
Sentence_Translation: I have three cats and one dog.

Sentence: Il y a quatre saisons dans une année.
Sentence_IPA: /il j a katʁ sɛ.zɔ̃ dɑ̃ z‿yn a.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel y ah kat-ruh seh-ZOHN dahn z(y)ewn ah-NAY
Sentence_Translation: There are four seasons in a year.

Sentence: Les enfants sont à l'école maintenant.
Sentence_IPA: /le z‿ɑ̃.fɑ̃ sɔ̃ ta le.kɔl mɛ̃.t(ə).nɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay zahn-FAHN sohn tah lay-KOL mehn-tuh-NAHN
Sentence_Translation: The children are at school now.

Sentence: As-tu un morceau de papier pour écrire ?
Sentence_IPA: /a ty œ̃ mɔʁ.so də pa.pje puʁ e.kʁiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah tew uhn mor-SOH duh pah-PYAY poor ay-KREER
Sentence_Translation: Do you have a piece of paper to write?

Sentence: Je vais envoyer une lettre à ma grand-mère.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ z‿ɑ̃.vwa.je yn lɛtʁ a ma ɡʁɑ̃.mɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh zahn-vwah-YAY een let-ruh ah mah grahn-MAIR
Sentence_Translation: I am going to send a letter to my grandmother.

Sentence: Ils aiment jouer au football le samedi.
Sentence_IPA: /il z‿ɛm ʒwe o fut.bal lə sam.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel zem zhway oh foot-BAL luh sam-DEE
Sentence_Translation: They like to play soccer on Saturdays.

Sentence: Je ne comprends pas ce mot difficile.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə nə kɔ̃.pʁɑ̃ pa sə mo di.fi.sil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nuh kohn-PRAHN pah suh moh dee-fee-SEEL
Sentence_Translation: I do not understand this difficult word.

Sentence: Mon grand-père est un peu vieux maintenant.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ ɡʁɑ̃.pɛʁ ɛ tœ̃ pø vjø mɛ̃.t(ə).nɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn grahn-pair eh tun puh vyuh mehn-tuh-NAHN
Sentence_Translation: My grandfather is a little old now.

Sentence: Il espère vivre cent ans.
Sentence_IPA: /il ɛs.pɛʁ vivʁ sɑ̃ t‿ɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel es-PAIR veev-ruh sahn tahn
Sentence_Translation: He hopes to live one hundred years.

Sentence: Ferme la porte s'il te plaît, il fait froid.
Sentence_IPA: /fɛʁm la pɔʁt sil tə plɛ il fɛ fʁwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: fairm lah port seel tuh pleh eel feh frwah
Sentence_Translation: Close the door please, it is cold.

Sentence: Le bus va partir dans dix minutes.
Sentence_IPA: /lə bys va paʁ.tiʁ dɑ̃ dis mi.nyt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh bewss vah par-TEER dahn dees mee-NOOT
Sentence_Translation: The bus is going to leave in ten minutes.

Sentence: J'ai acheté cinq pommes rouges au marché.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe aʃ.te sɛ̃k pɔm ʁuʒ o maʁ.ʃe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay ash-TAY sank pom roozh oh mar-SHAY
Sentence_Translation: I bought five red apples at the market.

Sentence: Il est trop tard pour aller au cinéma.
Sentence_IPA: /il ɛ tʁo taʁ puʁ a.le o si.ne.ma/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel eh tro tar poor ah-LAY oh see-nay-MAH
Sentence_Translation: It is too late to go to the movies.

Sentence: Nous allons manger, puis nous allons dormir.
Sentence_IPA: /nu za.lɔ̃ mɑ̃.ʒe pɥi nu za.lɔ̃ dɔʁ.miʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo zah-LOHN mahn-ZHAY pwee noo zah-LOHN dor-MEER
Sentence_Translation: We are going to eat, then we are going to sleep.

Sentence: Il n'y a personne dans la salle.
Sentence_IPA: /il nj‿a pɛʁ.sɔn dɑ̃ la sal/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel nyah pair-SON dahn lah sal
Sentence_Translation: There is nobody in the room.

Sentence: La musique est trop forte pour mes oreilles.
Sentence_IPA: /la my.zik ɛ tʁo fɔʁt puʁ me z‿ɔ.ʁɛj/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah mew-ZEEK eh tro fort poor may zoh-RAY
Sentence_Translation: The music is too loud for my ears.

Sentence: Je bois du café chaque matin avant de travailler.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə bwa dy ka.fe ʃak ma.tɛ̃ a.vɑ̃ də tʁa.va.je/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh bwah dew kah-FAY shak mah-TEHN ah-VAHN duh trah-vah-YAY
Sentence_Translation: I drink coffee every morning before working.

Sentence: C'est la première fois que je viens ici.
Sentence_IPA: /s‿ɛ la pʁə.mjɛʁ fwa kə ʒə vjɛ̃ i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: seh lah pruh-myair fwah kuh zhuh vyehn ee-SEE
Sentence_Translation: It is the first time that I come here.

Sentence: Elle a un grand cœur et aide tout le monde.
Sentence_IPA: /ɛl a œ̃ ɡʁɑ̃ kœʁ e ɛd tu lə mɔ̃d/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: el ah uhn grahn kur ay ed too luh mohnd
Sentence_Translation: She has a big heart and helps everyone.

Sentence: Combien de pommes veux-tu acheter ?
Sentence_IPA: /kɔ̃.bjɛ̃ də pɔm vø ty aʃ.te/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: kohn-byehn duh pom vuh-tew ash-TAY
Sentence_Translation: How many apples do you want to buy?

Sentence: Le ciel est bleu et sans nuages.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sjɛl ɛ blø e sɑ̃ nɥaʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh syel eh bluh ay sahn nwee-AZH
Sentence_Translation: The sky is blue and without clouds.

Sentence: Je te donne la main pour traverser la rue.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə tə dɔn la mɛ̃ puʁ tʁa.vɛʁ.se la ʁy/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh tuh don lah mehn poor trah-vair-SAY lah rue
Sentence_Translation: I’m giving you my hand to cross the street.

Sentence: J'ai mal à la tête depuis ce matin.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe mal a la tɛt də.pɥi sə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay mal ah lah tet duh-pwee suh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: I’ve had a headache since this morning.

Sentence: Je vais prendre un café avec toi maintenant.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ pʁɑ̃dʁ œ̃ ka.fe a.vɛk twa mɛ̃.t(ə).nɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh prahn-druh uhn kah-FAY ah-vek twah mehn-tuh-NAHN
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to have a coffee with you now.

Sentence: Peux-tu me donner une minute,s'il te plaît ?
Sentence_IPA: /pø ty mə dɔ.ne yn mi.nyt sil tə plɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: puh-tew muh doh-NAY een mee-NOOT seel tuh pleh
Sentence_Translation: Can you give me a minute, please?

Sentence: Je dois te dire quelque chose d'important ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dwa tə diʁ kɛlk ʃoz d‿ɛ̃.pɔʁ.tɑ̃ sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh dwah tuh deer kelk shoz dahn-por-TAHN suh swar
Sentence_Translation: I have to tell you something important tonight.

Sentence: On va voir un film après le dîner ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ va vwaʁ œ̃ film a.pʁɛ lə di.ne sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn vah vwahr uhn feelm ah-PREH luh dee-NAY suh swar
Sentence_Translation: We’re going to watch a film after dinner tonight.

Sentence: Tu peux venir chez moi après ton travail aujourd'hui.
Sentence_IPA: /ty pø və.niʁ ʃe mwa a.pʁɛ tɔ̃ tʁa.vaj o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew puh vuh-NEER shay mwah ah-PREH tohn trah-VYE oh-zhoor-DWEE
Sentence_Translation: You can come to my place after work today.

Sentence: Je veux savoir pourquoi tu es en retard encore.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vø sa.vwaʁ puʁ.kwa ty ɛ ɑ̃ ʁə.taʁ ɑ̃.kɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh vuh sah-vwahr poor-kwah tew eh ahn ruh-TAR ahn-kor
Sentence_Translation: I want to know why you’re late again.

Sentence: Je ne peux pas sortir,je suis trop fatigué.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə nə pø pa sɔʁ.tiʁ ʒə sɥi tʁo fa.ti.ɡe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nuh puh pah sor-TEER zhuh swee troh fah-tee-GAY
Sentence_Translation: I can’t go out, I’m too tired.

Sentence: Je dois finir ce travail avant demain matin.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dwa fi.niʁ sə tʁa.vaj a.vɑ̃ də.mɛ̃ ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh dwah fee-NEER suh trah-VYE ah-VAHN duh-mehn mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: I have to finish this work before tomorrow morning.

Sentence: Tu veux vraiment manger ici,ou ailleurs ?
Sentence_IPA: /ty vø vʁɛ.mɑ̃ mɑ̃.ʒe i.si u a.jœʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew vuh vreh-mahn mahn-ZHAY ee-SEE oo ah-YUR
Sentence_Translation: Do you really want to eat here, or elsewhere?

Sentence: On va faire les courses après le travail aujourd'hui.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ va fɛʁ le kuʁs a.pʁɛ lə tʁa.vaj o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn vah fair lay koors ah-PREH luh trah-VYE oh-zhoor-DWEE
Sentence_Translation: We’re going to do the shopping after work today.

Sentence: Je vais aller au bureau même s'il pleut.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ a.le o by.ʁo mɛm sil plø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ah-LAY oh bew-ROH mem seel pluh
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to the office even if it rains.

Sentence: Nous aimons sortir ensemble le samedi soir en ville.
Sentence_IPA: /nu zɛm sɔʁ.tiʁ ɑ̃.sɑ̃bl lə sam.di swaʁ ɑ̃ vil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo zem sor-TEER ahn-sahmbl luh sam-DEE swar ahn veel
Sentence_Translation: We like going out together on Saturday nights in town.

Sentence: Je préfère rester à la maison ce week-end.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁe.fɛʁ ʁɛs.te a la mɛ.zɔ̃ sə wik.ɛnd/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh pray-FAIR res-TAY ah lah meh-ZOHN suh week-end
Sentence_Translation: I prefer to stay at home this weekend.

Sentence: Tu dois entrer par la porte de gauche aujourd'hui.
Sentence_IPA: /ty dwa ɑ̃.tʁe paʁ la pɔʁt də ɡoʃ o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew dwah ahn-TRAY par lah port duh gosh oh-zhoor-DWEE
Sentence_Translation: You have to enter through the left door today.

Sentence: Je n'ai pas compris cette partie du film hier.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə n‿e pa kɔ̃.pʁi sɛt paʁ.ti dy film jɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nay pah kohn-PREE set par-TEE dew feelm yair
Sentence_Translation: I didn’t understand that part of the film yesterday.

Sentence: Avec ce temps,je préfère rester à l'intérieur.
Sentence_IPA: /a.vɛk sə tɑ̃ ʒə pʁe.fɛʁ ʁɛs.te a l‿ɛ̃.te.ʁjœʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah-vek suh tahn zhuh pray-FAIR res-TAY ah lan-tay-RYUR
Sentence_Translation: With this weather, I’d rather stay indoors.

Sentence: Je te verrai un jour,mais pas aujourd'hui.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə tə vɛ.ʁe œ̃ ʒuʁ mɛ pa o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh tuh veh-RAY uhn zhoor meh pah oh-zhoor-DWEE
Sentence_Translation: I’ll see you one day, but not today.

Sentence: Un ami m'a téléphoné très tard hier soir.
Sentence_IPA: /œ̃ n‿a.mi m‿a te.le.fɔ.ne tʁɛ taʁ jɛʁ swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: uhn nah-MEE mah tay-lay-foh-NAY treh tar yair swar
Sentence_Translation: A friend rang me very late last night.

Sentence: Ma famille habite assez loin,mais on se voit.
Sentence_IPA: /ma fa.mij a.bit a.se lwɛ̃ mɛ ɔ̃ sə vwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah fah-mee-yuh ah-BEET ah-say lwehn meh ohn suh vwah
Sentence_Translation: My family lives quite far away, but we see each other.

Sentence: Je n'ai pas assez d'argent pour ce voyage.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə n‿e pa a.se d‿aʁ.ʒɑ̃ puʁ sə vwa.jaʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nay pah ah-say dar-ZHAHN poor suh vwah-YAHZH
Sentence_Translation: I don’t have enough money for this trip.

Sentence: J'ai une question simple,mais je n'ose pas.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe yn kɛs.tjɔ̃ sɛ̃pl mɛ ʒə n‿oz pa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay een kes-TYOHN sehmpl meh zhuh nohz pah
Sentence_Translation: I have a simple question, but I don’t dare.

Sentence: Je cherche la réponse depuis plusieurs jours déjà.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ la ʁe.pɔ̃s də.pɥi ply.zjœʁ ʒuʁ de.ʒa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh lah ray-PONSS duh-pwee plew-ZYUR zhoor day-ZHAH
Sentence_Translation: I’ve been looking for the answer for several days already.

Sentence: On a un problème sérieux,mais on va gérer.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ n‿a œ̃ pʁɔ.blɛm se.ʁjø mɛ ɔ̃ va ʒe.ʁe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn nah uhn pro-BLEM say-RYUH meh ohn vah zhay-RAY
Sentence_Translation: We’ve got a serious problem, but we’ll handle it.

Sentence: Il y a une chose que je ne comprends pas.
Sentence_IPA: /il j a yn ʃoz kə ʒə nə kɔ̃.pʁɑ̃ pa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel y ah een shoz kuh zhuh nuh kohn-PRAHN pah
Sentence_Translation: There’s one thing I don’t understand.

Sentence: On a besoin de repos après cette semaine difficile.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ n‿a bə.zwɛ̃ də ʁə.po a.pʁɛ sɛt sə.mɛn di.fi.sil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn nah buh-ZWEHN duh ruh-POH ah-PREH set suh-MEN dee-fee-SEEL
Sentence_Translation: We need rest after this difficult week.

Sentence: J'ai une idée pour améliorer ton français rapidement.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe yn i.de puʁ a.me.ljɔ.ʁe tɔ̃ fʁɑ̃.sɛ ʁa.pid.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay een ee-DAY poor ah-may-lyor-RAY tohn frahn-SEH rah-peed-MAHN
Sentence_Translation: I’ve an idea to improve your French quickly.

Sentence: Il raconte une histoire drôle à chaque dîner de famille.
Sentence_IPA: /il ʁa.kɔ̃t yn is.twaʁ dʁol a ʃak di.ne də fa.mij/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel rah-kohnt een ees-TWAHR drol ah shak dee-NAY duh fah-mee-yuh
Sentence_Translation: He tells a funny story at every family dinner.

Sentence: Je lis un livre intéressant dans le train chaque jour.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə li z‿œ̃ livʁ ɛ̃.te.ʁɛ.sɑ̃ dɑ̃ lə tʁɛ̃ ʃak ʒuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh lee zuhn leev-ruh ehn-tay-ray-SAHN dahn luh trehn shak zhoor
Sentence_Translation: I read an interesting book on the train every day.

Sentence: Tu peux ouvrir la fenêtre,il fait trop chaud.
Sentence_IPA: /ty pø u.vʁiʁ la f(ə).nɛtʁ il fɛ tʁo ʃo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew puh oo-vreer lah fuh-NETR eel feh troh sho
Sentence_Translation: Can you open the window, it’s too hot.

Sentence: Merci de fermer la porte avant de partir.
Sentence_IPA: /mɛʁ.si də fɛʁ.me la pɔʁt a.vɑ̃ də paʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mehr-SEE duh fair-MAY lah port ah-VAHN duh par-TEER
Sentence_Translation: Thanks for closing the door before leaving.

Sentence: La fenêtre de la cuisine est toujours ouverte le matin.
Sentence_IPA: /la f(ə).nɛtʁ də la kɥi.zin ɛ tu.ʒuʁ u.vɛʁt lə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah fuh-NETR duh lah kwee-ZEEN eh too-ZHOOR oo-VERT luh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: The kitchen window is always open in the morning.

Sentence: Sa voix est calme,même quand il est fâché.
Sentence_IPA: /sa vwa ɛ kalm mɛm kɑ̃d il ɛ fa.ʃe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: sah vwah eh calm mem kahn-deel eh fah-SHAY
Sentence_Translation: His voice is calm, even when he’s angry.

Sentence: On peut parler plus tard,je suis en réunion.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ pø paʁ.le ply taʁ ʒə sɥi ɑ̃ ʁe.y.njɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn puh par-LAY plew tar zhuh swee ahn ray-ew-NYOHN
Sentence_Translation: We can talk later; I’m in a meeting.

Sentence: Écoute bien les instructions avant de commencer l'exercice.
Sentence_IPA: /e.kut bjɛ̃ le z‿ɛ̃stʁyk.sjɔ̃ a.vɑ̃ də kɔ.mɑ̃.se l‿ɛɡ.zɛʁ.sis/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ay-KOOT byehn lay zehn-struk-SYOHN ah-VAHN duh koh-mahn-SAY lekg-zair-SEESS
Sentence_Translation: Listen carefully to the instructions before starting the exercise.

Sentence: Je comprends mieux maintenant,mais c'est encore difficile.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə kɔ̃.pʁɑ̃ mjø mɛ̃.t(ə).nɑ̃ mɛ s‿ɛ ɑ̃.kɔʁ di.fi.sil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh kohn-PRAHN myuh mehn-tuh-NAHN meh sehn-KOR dee-fee-SEEL
Sentence_Translation: I understand better now, but it’s still difficult.

Sentence: J'essaie d'apprendre dix mots nouveaux chaque semaine.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe.sɛj d‿a.pʁɑ̃dʁ dis mo nu.vo ʃak sə.mɛn/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhes-AY dah-PRAHN-druh dees moh noo-VOH shak suh-MEN
Sentence_Translation: I try to learn ten new words each week.

Sentence: Il faut répondre rapidement,sinon c'est trop tard.
Sentence_IPA: /il fo ʁe.pɔ̃dʁ ʁa.pid.mɑ̃ si.nɔ̃ s‿ɛ tʁo taʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel foe ray-POND-ruh rah-peed-MAHN see-nohn se tro tar
Sentence_Translation: You must answer quickly, otherwise it’s too late.

Sentence: Je viens souvent ici,surtout quand il fait beau.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vjɛ̃ su.vɑ̃ i.si syʁ.tu kɑ̃d il fɛ bo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh vyehn soo-VAHN ee-SEE seer-TOO kahn-deel feh boh
Sentence_Translation: I come here often, especially when the weather’s nice.

Sentence: Je suis toujours prêt quand tu arrives tôt.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə sɥi tu.ʒuʁ pʁɛ kɑ̃ ty a.ʁiv to/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh swee too-ZHOOR preh kahn tew ah-REEV toh
Sentence_Translation: I’m always ready when you arrive early.

Sentence: Je ne mange jamais de viande le lundi.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə nə mɑ̃ʒ ʒa.mɛ də vjɑ̃d lə lœ̃.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nuh mahnzh zhah-MEH duh vyahnd luh lehn-DEE
Sentence_Translation: I never eat meat on Mondays.

Sentence: Il est encore au bureau à cette heure.
Sentence_IPA: /il ɛ t‿ɑ̃.kɔʁ o by.ʁo a sɛt œʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel eh tahn-KOR oh bew-ROH ah set ur
Sentence_Translation: He’s still at the office at this hour.

Sentence: On se reverra bientôt,j'en suis certain.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ sə ʁə.vɛʁ.ʁa bjɛ̃.to ʒɑ̃ sɥi sɛʁ.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn suh ruh-vair-RAH byehn-TOH zhahn swee sair-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: We’ll see each other again soon; I’m sure of it.

Sentence: Parfois je prends le bus au lieu de marcher.
Sentence_IPA: /paʁ.fwa ʒə pʁɑ̃ lə bys o ljø də maʁ.ʃe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: par-FWAH zhuh prahn luh bewss oh lyuh duh mar-SHAY
Sentence_Translation: Sometimes I take the bus instead of walking.

Sentence: D'abord on mange,ensuite on range la cuisine.
Sentence_IPA: /da.bɔʁ ɔ̃ mɑ̃ʒ ɑ̃.sɥit ɔ̃ ʁɑ̃ʒ la kɥi.zin/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: dah-BOR ohn mahnzh ahn-SWEET ohn rahnzh lah kwee-ZEEN
Sentence_Translation: First we eat, then we tidy the kitchen.

Sentence: Je me lave les mains avant de cuisiner.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə mə lav le mɛ̃ a.vɑ̃ də kɥi.zi.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh muh lav lay mehn ah-VAHN duh kwee-zee-NAY
Sentence_Translation: I wash my hands before cooking.

Sentence: Après le travail,nous allons boire un verre.
Sentence_IPA: /a.pʁɛ lə tʁa.vaj nu za.lɔ̃ bwaʁ œ̃ vɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah-PREH luh trah-VYE noo zah-LOHN bwahr uhn vair
Sentence_Translation: After work, we’re going to have a drink.

Sentence: Je prends mon déjeuner vers midi avec mes collègues.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ mɔ̃ de.ʒø.ne vɛʁ mi.di a.vɛk me kɔ.lɛɡ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn mohn day-zhuh-NAY vair mee-DEE ah-vek may koh-LEG
Sentence_Translation: I have my lunch around midday with my colleagues.

Sentence: Nous préparons le dîner ensemble dans la petite cuisine.
Sentence_IPA: /nu pʁe.pa.ʁɔ̃ lə di.ne ɑ̃.sɑ̃bl dɑ̃ la pə.tit kɥi.zin/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo pray-pah-ROHN luh dee-NAY ahn-sahmbl dahn lah puh-TEE kwee-ZEEN
Sentence_Translation: We’re making dinner together in the small kitchen.

Sentence: Le petit déjeuner est prêt sur la table ce matin.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pə.ti de.ʒø.ne ɛ t‿pʁɛ syʁ la tabl sə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh puh-TEE day-zhuh-NAY eh preh sewr lah tabl suh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: Breakfast is ready on the table this morning.

Sentence: J'ai faim,mais je peux attendre encore un peu.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe fɛ̃ mɛ ʒə pø a.tɑ̃dʁ ɑ̃.kɔʁ œ̃ pø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay fehn meh zhuh puh ah-TAHN-druh ahn-KOR uhn puh
Sentence_Translation: I’m hungry, but I can wait a bit longer.

Sentence: J'ai soif,alors je bois un grand verre d'eau.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe swaf a.lɔʁ ʒə bwa z‿œ̃ ɡʁɑ̃ vɛʁ d‿o/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay swaf ah-LOR zhuh bwah zuhn grahn vair doh
Sentence_Translation: I’m thirsty, so I drink a big glass of water.

Sentence: Il veut vendre sa voiture avant l'hiver prochain.
Sentence_IPA: /il vø vɑ̃dʁ sa vwa.tyʁ a.vɑ̃ li.vɛʁ pʁɔ.ʃɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel vuh vahn-druh sah vwah-TYUR ah-VAHN lee-VAIR pro-SHEHN
Sentence_Translation: He wants to sell his car before next winter.

Sentence: Tu dois choisir une option claire pour demain matin.
Sentence_IPA: /ty dwa ʃwa.ziʁ yn ɔp.sjɔ̃ klɛʁ puʁ də.mɛ̃ ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew dwah shwah-ZEER een op-SYOHN klair poor duh-mehn mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: You must choose a clear option for tomorrow morning.

Sentence: Nous devons décider rapidement avant la réunion de lundi.
Sentence_IPA: /nu də.vɔ̃ de.si.de ʁa.pid.mɑ̃ a.vɑ̃ la ʁe.y.njɔ̃ də lœ̃.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo duh-VOHN day-see-DAY rah-peed-MAHN ah-VAHN lah ray-ew-NYOHN duh lehn-DEE
Sentence_Translation: We have to decide quickly before Monday’s meeting.

Sentence: Peux-tu m'expliquer cette règle avec un exemple simple ?
Sentence_IPA: /pø ty m‿ɛk.spli.ke sɛt ʁɛɡl a.vɛk œ̃ n‿ɛɡ.zɑ̃pl sɛ̃pl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: puh-tew meks-plee-KAY set regl ah-vek uhn neg-ZAHMPL sehmpl
Sentence_Translation: Can you explain this rule to me with a simple example?

Sentence: Elle répond toujours poliment quand on lui écrit.
Sentence_IPA: /ɛl ʁe.pɔ̃ tu.ʒuʁ pɔ.li.mɑ̃ kɑ̃ t‿ɔ̃ lɥi e.kʁi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: el ray-PON too-ZHOOR poh-lee-MAHN kahn tohn lwee ay-KREE
Sentence_Translation: She always answers politely when people write to her.

Sentence: Nous attendons le train depuis plus de vingt minutes.
Sentence_IPA: /nu za.tɑ̃.dɔ̃ lə tʁɛ̃ də.pɥi ply də vɛ̃ mi.nyt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo zah-TAHN-dohn luh trehn duh-pwee plew duh vehn mee-NOOT
Sentence_Translation: We’ve been waiting for the train for more than twenty minutes.

Sentence: Le cours commence à neuf heures précises aujourd'hui.
Sentence_IPA: /lə kuʁ kɔ.mɑ̃s a nœv œʁ pʁe.siz o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh koor koh-MAHNS ah nuhv ur pray-ZEEZ oh-zhoor-DWEE
Sentence_Translation: The class starts at exactly nine o’clock today.

Sentence: Je vais finir ce dossier avant la fin de journée.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ fi.niʁ sə dɔ.sje a.vɑ̃ la fɛ̃ də ʒuʁ.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh fee-NEER suh doh-SYAY ah-VAHN lah fehn duh zhoor-NAY
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to finish this file before the end of the day.

Sentence: Peux-tu allumer la lumière dans le couloir,s'il te plaît ?
Sentence_IPA: /pø ty a.ly.me la ly.mjɛʁ dɑ̃ lə ku.lwaʁ sil tə plɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: puh-tew ah-lew-MAY lah lew-MYAIR dahn luh koo-LWAR seel tuh pleh
Sentence_Translation: Can you switch on the light in the corridor, please?

Sentence: N'oublie pas d'éteindre l'ordinateur avant de partir.
Sentence_IPA: /n‿u.bli pa d‿e.tɛ̃dʁ l‿ɔʁ.di.na.tœʁ a.vɑ̃ də paʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo-BLEE pah day-TEHN-druh lor-dee-nah-TUR ah-VAHN duh par-TEER
Sentence_Translation: Don’t forget to switch off the computer before leaving.

Sentence: La salle de bain reste propre avec un peu d'effort.
Sentence_IPA: /la sal də bɛ̃ ʁɛst pʁɔpʁ a.vɛk œ̃ pø d‿ɛ.fɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah sal duh behn rest prohpr ah-vek uhn puh deh-FOR
Sentence_Translation: The bathroom stays clean with a bit of effort.

Sentence: Tes chaussures sont sales après la marche sous la pluie.
Sentence_IPA: /te ʃo.syʁ sɔ̃ sal a.pʁɛ la maʁʃ su la plɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tay shoh-SYUR sohn sal ah-PREH lah marsh soo lah plwee
Sentence_Translation: Your shoes are dirty after the walk in the rain.

Sentence: Ce devoir est facile si tu lis bien la consigne.
Sentence_IPA: /sə də.vwaʁ ɛ t‿fa.sil si ty li bjɛ̃ la kɔ̃.siɲ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh duh-VWAR eh fah-SEEL see tew lee byehn lah kon-SEEN-yuh
Sentence_Translation: This homework is easy if you read the instructions carefully.

Sentence: La situation devient compliquée quand personne ne parle.
Sentence_IPA: /la si.tɥa.sjɔ̃ də.vjɛ̃ kɔ̃.pli.ke kɑ̃ pɛʁ.sɔn nə paʁl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah see-twha-SYOHN duh-vyehn kohn-plee-KAY kahn pair-SON nuh parl
Sentence_Translation: The situation gets complicated when nobody speaks.

Sentence: J'ai envie de sortir,mais il fait froid dehors.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe ɑ̃.vi də sɔʁ.tiʁ mɛ il fɛ fʁwa də.ɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay ahn-VEE duh sor-TEER meh eel feh frwah duh-OR
Sentence_Translation: I feel like going out, but it’s cold outside.

Sentence: Elle a peur du noir quand la rue est vide.
Sentence_IPA: /ɛl a pœʁ dy nwaʁ kɑ̃ la ʁy ɛ vid/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: el ah pur dew nwahr kahn lah rue eh veed
Sentence_Translation: She’s afraid of the dark when the street is empty.

Sentence: On peut rire un peu pour oublier les soucis.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ pø ʁiʁ œ̃ pø puʁ u.bli.je le su.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn puh reer uhn puh poor oo-blee-YAY lay soo-SEE
Sentence_Translation: We can laugh a little to forget our worries.

Sentence: Il ne va pas pleurer pour ça.
Sentence_IPA: /il nə va pa plœ.ʁe puʁ sa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel nuh vah pah pluh-RAY poor sah
Sentence_Translation: He’s not going to cry about that.

Sentence: Elle sourit toujours quand elle entend ça.
Sentence_IPA: /ɛl su.ʁi tu.ʒuʁ kɑ̃ ɛl ɑ̃.tɑ̃ sa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: el soo-REE too-ZHOOR kahn el ahn-TAHN sah
Sentence_Translation: She always smiles when she hears that.

Sentence: Nous aimons chanter ensemble pendant le trajet.
Sentence_IPA: /nu z‿ɛm ʃɑ̃.te ɑ̃.sɑ̃bl pɑ̃.dɑ̃ lə tʁa.ʒɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo zem shahn-TAY ahn-sahmbl pahn-DAHN luh trah-ZHEH
Sentence_Translation: We like singing together during the journey.

Sentence: Ils vont danser toute la nuit ici.
Sentence_IPA: /il vɔ̃ dɑ̃.se tut la nɥi i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel vohn dahn-SAY toot lah nwee ee-SEE
Sentence_Translation: They’re going to dance all night here.

Sentence: Je marche vite pour attraper le bus.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə maʁʃ vit puʁ a.tʁa.pe lə bys/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh marsh veet poor ah-trah-PAY luh bewss
Sentence_Translation: I walk quickly to catch the bus.

Sentence: Tu peux courir sans te blesser aujourd'hui.
Sentence_IPA: /ty pø ku.ʁiʁ sɑ̃ tə blɛ.se o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew puh koo-REER sahn tuh bleh-SAY oh-zhoor-DWEE
Sentence_Translation: You can run without hurting yourself today.

Sentence: Je regarde les infos chaque soir à la télé.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʁə.ɡaʁd le z‿ɛ̃.fo ʃak swaʁ a la te.le/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh ruh-GARD lay zehn-FO shak swar ah lah tay-LAY
Sentence_Translation: I watch the news every evening on TV.

Sentence: Il préfère écrire une lettre plutôt que téléphoner.
Sentence_IPA: /il pʁe.fɛʁ e.kʁiʁ yn lɛtʁ ply.to kə te.le.fɔ.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel pray-FAIR ay-KREER een let-ruh plew-TOH kuh tay-lay-foh-NAY
Sentence_Translation: He prefers to write a letter rather than phone.

Sentence: Je lis ce journal dans le métro le matin.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə li sə ʒuʁ.nal dɑ̃ lə me.tʁo lə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh lee suh zhoor-NAL dahn luh may-TROH luh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: I read this paper on the metro in the morning.

Sentence: Nous apprenons le français avec des dialogues courts.
Sentence_IPA: /nu za.pʁə.nɔ̃ lə fʁɑ̃.sɛ a.vɛk de dja.lɔɡ kuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo zah-pruh-NOHN luh frahn-SEH ah-vek day dya-LOG koor
Sentence_Translation: We learn French with short dialogues.

Sentence: N'oublie pas d'oublier cette vieille histoire triste.
Sentence_IPA: /n‿u.bli pa d‿u.bli.je sɛt vjɛj is.twaʁ tʁist/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo-BLEE pah doo-blee-YAY set vyeh-yuh ees-TWAHR treest
Sentence_Translation: Don’t forget to forget that old sad story.

Sentence: Je me souviens encore de ton premier message.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə mə su.vjɛ̃ ɑ̃.kɔʁ də tɔ̃ pʁə.mje me.saʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh muh soo-VYEHN ahn-KOR duh tohn pruh-MYAY may-SAZH
Sentence_Translation: I still remember your first message.

Sentence: Elle cherche ses clés dans tous les sacs.
Sentence_IPA: /ɛl ʃɛʁʃ se kle dɑ̃ tus le sak/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: el shairsh say klay dahn too lay sak
Sentence_Translation: She’s looking for her keys in all the bags.

Sentence: On trouve souvent la réponse en travaillant calmement.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ tʁuv su.vɑ̃ la ʁe.pɔ̃s ɑ̃ tʁa.va.jɑ̃ kal.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn troov soo-VAHN lah ray-PONSS ahn trah-vah-YAHN calm-MAHN
Sentence_Translation: You often find the answer by working calmly.

Sentence: Je demande un conseil avant de décider seul.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə də.mɑ̃d œ̃ kɔ̃.sɛj a.vɑ̃ də de.si.de sœl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh duh-MAHND uhn kohn-SAY ah-VAHN duh day-see-DAY suhl
Sentence_Translation: I ask for advice before deciding alone.

Sentence: Il répond clairement à toutes les questions difficiles.
Sentence_IPA: /il ʁe.pɔ̃ klɛʁ.mɑ̃ a tut le kɛs.tjɔ̃ di.fi.sil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel ray-PON klair-MAHN ah toot lay kes-TYOHN dee-fee-SEEL
Sentence_Translation: He answers clearly to all the difficult questions.

Sentence: Merci de m'aider avec ce problème aujourd'hui.
Sentence_IPA: /mɛʁ.si də m‿ɛ.de a.vɛk sə pʁɔ.blɛm o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mehr-SEE duh may-DAY ah-vek suh pro-BLEM oh-zhoor-DWEE
Sentence_Translation: Thanks for helping me with this problem today.

Sentence: Elle travaille tard pour finir son projet.
Sentence_IPA: /ɛl tʁa.vaj taʁ puʁ fi.niʁ sɔ̃ pʁɔ.ʒɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: el trah-VYE tar poor fee-NEER sohn pro-ZHEH
Sentence_Translation: She works late to finish her project.

Sentence: Nous allons voyager en train la semaine prochaine.
Sentence_IPA: /nu za.lɔ̃ vwa.ja.ʒe ɑ̃ tʁɛ̃ la sə.mɛn pʁɔ.ʃɛn/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo zah-LOHN vwah-yah-ZHAY ahn trehn lah suh-MEN pro-SHEN
Sentence_Translation: We’re going to travel by train next week.

Sentence: Je veux visiter ce musée avec toi demain.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vø vi.zi.te sə my.ze a.vɛk twa də.mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh vuh vee-zee-TAY suh mew-ZAY ah-vek twah duh-MEHn
Sentence_Translation: I want to visit this museum with you tomorrow.

Sentence: La route est fermée à cause des travaux.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁut ɛ fɛʁ.me a koz de tʁa.vo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah root eh fair-MAY ah koze day trah-VOH
Sentence_Translation: The road is closed because of roadworks.

Sentence: Nous suivons ce chemin jusqu'au vieux pont.
Sentence_IPA: /nu sɥi.vɔ̃ sə ʃə.mɛ̃ ʒys.ko vjø pɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo swee-VOHN suh shuh-MEHN zhus-KOH vyuh poh(n)
Sentence_Translation: We follow this path as far as the old bridge.

Sentence: Le pont bouge un peu quand on marche.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pɔ̃ buʒ œ̃ pø kɑ̃ t‿ɔ̃ maʁʃ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh pohn boozh uhn puh kahn tohn marsh
Sentence_Translation: The bridge moves a little when you walk.

Sentence: La rivière est basse après l'été sec.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁi.vjɛʁ ɛ bas a.pʁɛ l‿e.te sɛk/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ree-vyair eh bahss ah-PREH lay-TAY sehk
Sentence_Translation: The river is low after the dry summer.

Sentence: La montagne paraît proche,mais c'est loin.
Sentence_IPA: /la mɔ̃.taɲ pa.ʁɛ pʁɔʃ mɛ s‿ɛ lwɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah mohn-TAN-yuh pah-REH prosh meh seh lwehn
Sentence_Translation: The mountain seems close,but it’s far.

Sentence: On entend la mer même depuis la maison.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ ɑ̃.tɑ̃ la mɛʁ mɛm də.pɥi la mɛ.zɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn ahn-TAHN lah mair mem duh-pwee lah meh-ZOHN
Sentence_Translation: You can hear the sea even from the house.

Sentence: La plage est presque vide en hiver.
Sentence_IPA: /la plaʒ ɛ pʁɛsk vid ɑ̃ ni.vɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah plazh eh presk veed ahn nee-VAIR
Sentence_Translation: The beach is almost empty in winter.

Sentence: Le soleil se couche tôt en décembre ici.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɔ.lɛj sə kuʃ to ɑ̃ de.sɑ̃bʁ i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh so-LAY suh koosh toh ahn day-SAHMBR ee-SEE
Sentence_Translation: The sun sets early here in December.

Sentence: La pluie tombe fort depuis ce matin.
Sentence_IPA: /la plɥi tɔ̃b fɔʁ də.pɥi sə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah plwee tohm for duh-pwee suh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: The rain has been falling heavily since this morning.

Sentence: La neige tient encore sur les toits ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /la nɛʒ tjɛ̃ ɑ̃.kɔʁ syʁ le twa sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah nezh tyehn ahn-KOR sewr lay twah suh swar
Sentence_Translation: The snow is still holding on the roofs tonight.

Sentence: Le vent fait du bruit contre les fenêtres.
Sentence_IPA: /lə vɑ̃ fɛ dy bʁɥi kɔ̃tʁ le f(ə).nɛtʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh vahn feh dew brwee kohn-truh lay fuh-NETR
Sentence_Translation: The wind makes noise against the windows.

Sentence: Il fait trop chaud dans cette petite pièce.
Sentence_IPA: /il fɛ tʁo ʃo dɑ̃ sɛt pə.tit pjɛs/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel feh tro sho dahn set puh-TEET pyess
Sentence_Translation: It’s too hot in this small room.

Sentence: Il fait froid dehors,prends ton manteau.
Sentence_IPA: /il fɛ fʁwa də.ɔʁ pʁɑ̃ tɔ̃ mɑ̃.to/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel feh frwah duh-OR prahn tohn mahn-TOE
Sentence_Translation: It’s cold outside, take your coat.

Sentence: En hiver, on rentre plus tôt le soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ɑ̃ ni.vɛʁ ɔ̃ ʁɑ̃tʁ ply to lə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ahn nee-VAIR ohn rahntr plew toh luh swar
Sentence_Translation: In winter, we come home earlier in the evening.

Sentence: En été, nous dînons souvent dehors tard.
Sentence_IPA: /ɑ̃ n‿e.te nu di.nɔ̃ su.vɑ̃ də.ɔʁ taʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ahn nay-TAY noo dee-NOHN soo-VAHN duh-OR tar
Sentence_Translation: In summer, we often eat outside late.

Sentence: Au printemps les fleurs reviennent dans le jardin.
Sentence_IPA: /o pʁɛ̃.tɑ̃ le flœʁ ʁə.vjɛn dɑ̃ lə ʒaʁ.dɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: oh prehn-TAHN lay flur ruh-VYEHN dahn luh zhar-DAHN
Sentence_Translation: In spring the flowers come back in the garden.

Sentence: En automne les feuilles tombent sur le chemin.
Sentence_IPA: /ɑ̃ n‿o.tɔn le fœj tɔ̃b syʁ lə ʃə.mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ahn noh-TON lay fuy tohm sewr luh shuh-MEHN
Sentence_Translation: In autumn the leaves fall on the path.

Sentence: Nous marchons dans la forêt avant le coucher du soleil.
Sentence_IPA: /nu maʁ.ʃɔ̃ dɑ̃ la fɔ.ʁɛ a.vɑ̃ lə ku.ʃe dy sɔ.lɛj/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo mar-SHON dahn lah fo-REH ah-VAHN luh koo-SHAY dew so-LAY
Sentence_Translation: We walk in the forest before sunset.

Sentence: Cet arbre ancien protège la maison du vent.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt aʁbʁ ɑ̃.sjɛ̃ pʁɔ.tɛʒ la mɛ.zɔ̃ dy vɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set ar-bruh ahn-SYEN pro-TEZH lah meh-ZOHN dew vahn
Sentence_Translation: This old tree protects the house from wind.

Sentence: Cette fleur sent bon dans la cuisine le matin.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt flœʁ sɑ̃ bɔ̃ dɑ̃ la kɥi.zin lə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set flur sahn bohn dahn lah kwee-ZEEN luh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: This flower smells nice in the kitchen in the morning.

Sentence: L'herbe est mouillée après la pluie de nuit.
Sentence_IPA: /l‿ɛʁb ɛ mu.je a.pʁɛ la plɥi də nɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lerb eh moo-YAY ah-PREH lah plwee duh nwee
Sentence_Translation: The grass is wet after the rain at night.

Sentence: Un oiseau chante près de ma fenêtre chaque matin.
Sentence_IPA: /œ̃ n‿wa.zo ʃɑ̃t pʁɛ də ma f(ə).nɛtʁ ʃak ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: uhn wah-ZOH shahnt preh duh mah fuh-NETR shak mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: A bird sings near my window every morning.

Sentence: Nous mangeons du poisson frais ce soir ensemble.
Sentence_IPA: /nu mɑ̃.ʒɔ̃ dy pwa.sɔ̃ fʁɛ sə swaʁ ɑ̃.sɑ̃bl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo mahn-ZHON dew pwah-SOHN freh suh swar ahn-SAHMBL
Sentence_Translation: We eat fresh fish tonight together.

Sentence: Je prends du pain chaud avec mon café.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ dy pɛ̃ ʃo a.vɛk mɔ̃ ka.fe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn dew pehn sho ah-vek mohn kah-FAY
Sentence_Translation: I take warm bread with my coffee.

Sentence: Il achète du fromage français pour le dîner.
Sentence_IPA: /il a.ʃɛt dy fʁɔ.maʒ fʁɑ̃.sɛ puʁ lə di.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel ah-SHET dew fro-MAZH frahn-SEH poor luh dee-NAY
Sentence_Translation: He buys French cheese for dinner.

Sentence: Elle boit du lait froid avant de dormir.
Sentence_IPA: /ɛl bwa dy lɛ fʁwa a.vɑ̃ də dɔʁ.miʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: el bwah dew leh frwah ah-VAHN duh dor-MEER
Sentence_Translation: She drinks cold milk before sleeping.

Sentence: Tu mets du sucre dans ton thé vert.
Sentence_IPA: /ty mɛ dy sykʁ dɑ̃ tɔ̃ te vɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew meh dew suk-ruh dahn tohn tay vair
Sentence_Translation: You put sugar in your green tea.

Sentence: Il faut ajouter du sel avant de servir.
Sentence_IPA: /il fo a.ʒu.te dy sɛl a.vɑ̃ də sɛʁ.viʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel foe ah-zhoo-TAY dew sel ah-VAHN duh sair-VEER
Sentence_Translation: You must add salt before serving.

Sentence: Je préfère le poivre noir sur les légumes.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁe.fɛʁ lə pwavʁ nwaʁ syʁ le le.ɡym/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh pray-FAIR luh pwav-ruh nwahr sewr lay lay-GEWM
Sentence_Translation: I prefer black pepper on vegetables.

Sentence: J'aime cuisiner quelque chose de simple le dimanche.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒɛm kɥi.zi.ne kɛlk ʃoz də sɛ̃pl lə di.mɑ̃ʃ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhem kwee-zee-NAY kelk shoz duh sehmpl luh dee-MAHNSH
Sentence_Translation: I like to cook something simple on Sunday.

Sentence: Je vais acheter un cadeau pour ton anniversaire.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ aʃ.te œ̃ ka.do puʁ tɔ̃ na.ni.vɛʁ.sɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ash-TAY uhn kah-DOH poor tohn ah-nee-vair-SAIR
Sentence_Translation: I am going to buy a gift for your birthday.

Sentence: On doit payer la facture avant la fin.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ dwa pe.je la fak.tyʁ a.vɑ̃ la fɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn dwah pay-YAY lah fak-TYUR ah-VAHN lah fehn
Sentence_Translation: We have to pay the bill before the end.

Sentence: Ce billet va coûter plus cher demain matin.
Sentence_IPA: /sə bi.jɛ va ku.te ply ʃɛʁ də.mɛ̃ ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh bee-YEH vah koo-TAY plew shair duh-mehn mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: This ticket will cost more tomorrow morning.

Sentence: Je dois conduire jusqu'à la gare en ville.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dwa kɔ̃.dɥiʁ ʒys.ka la ɡaʁ ɑ̃ vil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh dwah kohn-DWEER zhus-KAH lah gar ahn veel
Sentence_Translation: I must drive as far as the station in town.

Sentence: Je vais au travail à vélo quand il fait beau.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ o tʁa.vaj a ve.lo kɑ̃ il fɛ bo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh oh trah-VYE ah vay-LOH kahn eel feh boh
Sentence_Translation: I go to work by bike when the weather is nice.

Sentence: Garde ton billet dans ta poche pendant le trajet.
Sentence_IPA: /ɡaʁd tɔ̃ bi.jɛ dɑ̃ ta pɔʃ pɑ̃.dɑ̃ lə tʁa.ʒɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: gard tohn bee-YEH dahn tah posh pahn-DAHN luh trah-ZHEH
Sentence_Translation: Keep your ticket in your pocket during the journey.

Sentence: La gare est pleine de monde ce matin.
Sentence_IPA: /la ɡaʁ ɛ plɛn də mɔ̃d sə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah gar eh plen duh mohnd suh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: The station is full of people this morning.

Sentence: L'avion décolle tôt mais je suis prêt.
Sentence_IPA: /l‿a.vjɔ̃ de.kɔl to mɛ ʒə sɥi pʁɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-vyohn day-KOL toh meh zhuh swee preh
Sentence_Translation: The plane takes off early but I am ready.

Sentence: Le bateau arrive au port après trois heures.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ba.to a.ʁiv o pɔʁ a.pʁɛ tʁwa z‿œʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh bah-TOH ah-REEV oh port ah-PREH trwah zur
Sentence_Translation: The boat arrives at the harbour after three hours.

Sentence: Nous dormons à l'hôtel près de la plage.
Sentence_IPA: /nu dɔʁ.mɔ̃ a l‿o.tɛl pʁɛ də la plaʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo dor-MON ah loh-TEL preh duh lah plazh
Sentence_Translation: We sleep at the hotel near the beach.

Sentence: Je dois réserver une chambre pour demain soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dwa ʁe.zɛʁ.ve yn ʃɑ̃bʁ puʁ də.mɛ̃ swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh dwah ray-zair-VAY een shahn-bruh poor duh-mehn swar
Sentence_Translation: I must book a room for tomorrow evening.

Sentence: Ma valise est trop lourde pour ce voyage.
Sentence_IPA: /ma va.liz ɛ tʁo luʁd puʁ sə vwa.jaʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah vah-LEEZ eh troh loord poor suh vwah-YAHZH
Sentence_Translation: My suitcase is too heavy for this trip.

Sentence: Je cherche mon passeport avant de sortir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ mɔ̃ pas.pɔʁ a.vɑ̃ də sɔʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh mohn pas-POR ah-VAHN duh sor-TEER
Sentence_Translation: I look for my passport before going out.

Sentence: La frontière est ouverte mais les contrôles continuent.
Sentence_IPA: /la fʁɔ̃.tjɛʁ ɛ u.vɛʁt mɛ le kɔ̃.tʁol kɔ̃.ti.ny/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah frohn-TYAIR eh oo-VERT meh lay kon-TROL kon-tee-NEW
Sentence_Translation: The border is open but checks continue.

Sentence: Nous allons explorer la vieille ville après le déjeuner.
Sentence_IPA: /nu za.lɔ̃ ɛk.splɔ.ʁe la vjɛj vil a.pʁɛ lə de.ʒø.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo zah-LOHN eks-ploh-RAY lah vyeh veel ah-PREH luh day-zhuh-NAY
Sentence_Translation: We are going to explore the old town after lunch.

Sentence: Cette promenade calme traverse un parc très grand.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt pʁɔ.mə.nad kalm tʁa.vɛʁs œ̃ paʁk tʁɛ ɡʁɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set proh-muh-nad calm trah-VAIRS uhn park treh grahn
Sentence_Translation: This calm walk crosses a very large park.

Sentence: Il y a une exposition intéressante dans la grande salle.
Sentence_IPA: /il j a yn ɛk.spɔ.zi.sjɔ̃ ɛ̃.te.ʁɛ.sɑ̃t dɑ̃ la ɡʁɑ̃d sal/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel y ah een eks-poh-zee-SYOHN ehn-tay-ray-SAHNT dahn lah grahnd sal
Sentence_Translation: There is an interesting exhibition in the large hall.
Sentence_Breakdown: Il y a|there is|Expr|/il j a/|eel y ah;une(Art)|a|Art|/yn/|een;exposition(une)|exhibition|Noun|/ɛk.spɔ.zi.sjɔ̃/|eks-poh-zee-syohn;intéressante|interesting|Adj|/ɛ̃.te.ʁɛ.sɑ̃t/|ehn-tay-ray-sahnt;dans|in|Prep|/dɑ̃/|dahn;la(Art)|the|Art|/la/|lah;grande|big|Adj|/ɡʁɑ̃d/|grahnd;salle(la)|hall|Noun|/sal/|sal

Sentence: La photographie ancienne raconte une histoire sans mots.
Sentence_IPA: /la fɔ.tɔ.ɡʁa.fi ɑ̃.sjɛn ʁa.kɔ̃t yn is.twaʁ sɑ̃ mo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah foh-toh-grah-FEE ahn-SYEN rah-KOHNT een ees-TWAHR sahn moh
Sentence_Translation: Old photography tells a story without words.

Sentence: Selon la légende le château cache un passage secret.
Sentence_IPA: /sə.lɔ̃ la le.ʒɑ̃d lə ʃa.to kaʃ œ̃ pa.saʒ sə.kʁɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh-lohn lah lay-ZHAHND luh shah-TOH kash uhn pah-SAZH suh-KRAY
Sentence_Translation: According to the legend the castle hides a secret passage.

Sentence: Je garde un souvenir précis de ce moment.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ɡaʁd œ̃ su.və.niʁ pʁe.si də sə mɔ.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh gard uhn soo-vuh-NEER pray-SEE duh suh moh-MAHN
Sentence_Translation: I keep a clear memory of this moment.

Sentence: Elle ouvre un cadeau et sourit tout de suite.

Sentence_Translation: She opens a gift and smiles right away.

Sentence: Mon anniversaire tombe un lundi cette année.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ na.ni.vɛʁ.sɛʁ tɔ̃b œ̃ lœ̃.di sɛt a.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn ah-nee-vair-SAIR tohm uhn lehn-DEE set ah-NAY
Sentence_Translation: My birthday falls on a Monday this year.

Sentence: La fête finit tard mais tout le monde reste.

Sentence_Translation: The party ends late but everyone stays.

Sentence: Je vais inviter des amis pour dîner samedi soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ ɛ̃.vi.te de za.mi puʁ di.ne sam.di swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ehn-vee-TAY day zah-MEE poor dee-NAY sam-DEE swar
Sentence_Translation: I am going to invite friends for dinner on Saturday night.

Sentence: Il refuse gentiment mais il propose une autre date.
Sentence_IPA: /il ʁə.fy.z ʒɑ̃.ti.mɑ̃ mɛ il pʁɔ.poz yn otʁ dat/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel ruh-FEWZ zhahn-tee-MAHN meh eel pro-POZ een ohtr daht
Sentence_Translation: He refuses politely but he suggests another date.

Sentence: J'accepte ton idée car elle semble utile.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒa.k.sɛpt tɔ̃ ni.de kaʁ ɛl sɑ̃bl y.til/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhak-SEPT tohn ee-DAY kar el sahmbl ew-TEEL
Sentence_Translation: I accept your idea because it seems useful.

Sentence: Je te promets de revenir avant la nuit.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə tə pʁɔ.mɛ də ʁə.və.niʁ a.vɑ̃ la nɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh tuh proh-MEH duh ruh-vuh-NEER ah-VAHN lah nwee
Sentence_Translation: I promise you to come back before night.

Sentence: Rappelle-moi ce détail demain avant la réunion.
Sentence_IPA: /ʁa.pɛl mwa sə de.taj də.mɛ̃ a.vɑ̃ la ʁe.y.njɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: rah-PELL mwah suh day-TYE duh-mehn ah-VAHN lah ray-ew-NYOHN
Sentence_Translation: Remind me of that detail tomorrow before the meeting.

Sentence: Je crois que cette solution peut marcher.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə kʁwa kə sɛt sɔ.ly.sjɔ̃ pø maʁ.ʃe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh krwahr kuh set so-lew-SYOHN puh mar-SHAY
Sentence_Translation: I believe that this solution can work.

Sentence: Nous espérons réussir cet examen sans trop de stress.
Sentence_IPA: /nu z‿ɛs.pe.ʁɔ̃ ʁe.y.siʁ sɛt ɛɡ.za.mɛ̃ sɑ̃ tʁo də stʁɛs/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo zes-pay-RON ray-ew-SEER set eg-zah-MEHN sahn troh duh stress
Sentence_Translation: We hope to pass this exam without too much stress.

Sentence: Tu préfères rester ici plutôt que partir maintenant.
Sentence_IPA: /ty pʁe.fɛʁ ʁɛs.te i.si ply.to kə paʁ.tiʁ mɛ̃.t(ə).nɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew pray-FAIR res-TAY ee-SEE plew-TOH kuh par-TEER mehn-tuh-NAHN
Sentence_Translation: You prefer to stay here rather than leave now.

Sentence: J'essaie de parler français pendant le repas.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe.sɛj də paʁ.le fʁɑ̃.sɛ pɑ̃.dɑ̃ lə ʁə.pa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhes-AY duh par-LAY frahn-SEH pahn-DAHN luh ruh-PAH
Sentence_Translation: I try to speak French during the meal.

Sentence: Elle veut réussir et travailler plus régulièrement.
Sentence_IPA: /ɛl vø ʁe.y.siʁ e tʁa.va.je ply ʁe.ɡy.ljɛʁ.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: el vuh ray-ew-SEER ay trah-vah-YAY plew ray-gew-LYAIR-mahn
Sentence_Translation: She wants to succeed and work more regularly.

Sentence: On peut échouer une fois et recommencer demain.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ pø e.ʃwe yn fwa e ʁə.kɔ.mɑ̃.se də.mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn puh ay-SHWEH een fwah ay ruh-koh-mahn-SAY duh-mehn
Sentence_Translation: We can fail once and start again tomorrow.

Sentence: Nous discutons longtemps pour trouver un accord clair.
Sentence_IPA: /nu dis.ky.tɔ̃ lɔ̃.tɑ̃ puʁ tʁu.ve œ̃ na.kɔʁ klɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo dees-kew-TON lohn-TAHN poor troo-VAY uhn nah-KOR klair
Sentence_Translation: We discuss for a long time to find a clear agreement.

Sentence: La solution arrive quand on pose la bonne question.
Sentence_IPA: /la sɔ.ly.sjɔ̃ a.ʁiv kɑ̃ ɔ̃ poz la bɔn kɛs.tjɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah so-lew-SYOHN ah-REEV kahn ohn pohz lah bon kes-TYOHN
Sentence_Translation: The solution comes when you ask the right question.

Sentence: J'ai fait une erreur et j'apprends vite.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe fɛt yn e.ʁœʁ e ʒa.pʁɑ̃ vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay feht een ay-RUR ay zhah-PRAHN veet
Sentence_Translation: I made an error and I learn quickly.

Sentence: Fais attention aux voitures quand tu traverses ici.
Sentence_IPA: /fɛ a.tɑ̃.sjɔ̃ o vwa.tyʁ kɑ̃ ty tʁa.vɛʁs i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: feh ah-tahn-SYOHN oh vwah-TYUR kahn tew trah-VAIRS ee-SEE
Sentence_Translation: Be careful of cars when you cross here.

Sentence: C'est important de dormir assez avant un long voyage.
Sentence_IPA: /s‿ɛ ɛ̃.pɔʁ.tɑ̃ də dɔʁ.miʁ a.se a.vɑ̃ œ̃ lɔ̃ vwa.jaʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: seh ehn-por-TAHN duh dor-MEER ah-say ah-VAHN uhn lohn vwah-YAHZH
Sentence_Translation: It is important to sleep enough before a long trip.

Sentence: Il est possible de finir ce travail ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /il ɛ pɔ.sibl də fi.niʁ sə tʁa.vaj sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel eh po-SEE-bl duh fee-NEER suh trah-VYE suh swar
Sentence_Translation: It is possible to finish this work tonight.

Sentence: C'est impossible sans aide et sans informations claires.
Sentence_IPA: /s‿ɛ ɛ̃.pɔ.sibl sɑ̃ n‿ɛd e sɑ̃ n‿ɛ̃.fɔʁ.ma.sjɔ̃ klɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: seh ehn-po-SEE-bl sahn ned ay sahn nehn-for-ma-SYOHN klair
Sentence_Translation: It is impossible without help and without clear information.

Sentence: Ce dictionnaire est utile pour apprendre des expressions.
Sentence_IPA: /sə dik.sjɔ.nɛʁ ɛ y.til puʁ a.pʁɑ̃dʁ de z‿ɛk.spʁe.sjɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh deek-syoh-NAIR eh ew-TEEL poor ah-PRAHN-druh day zeks-pray-SYOHN
Sentence_Translation: This dictionary is useful for learning expressions.

Sentence: Il est dangereux de courir près de la route.
Sentence_IPA: /il ɛ dɑ̃.ʒə.ʁø də ku.ʁiʁ pʁɛ də la ʁut/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel eh dahn-zhuh-RUH duh koo-REER preh duh lah root
Sentence_Translation: It is dangerous to run near the road.

Sentence: Je suis sûr que tu peux y arriver.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə sɥi syʁ kə ty pø zi a.ʁi.ve/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh swee sur kuh tew puh zee ah-ree-VAY
Sentence_Translation: I am sure that you can do it.

Sentence: Le bonheur vient parfois quand on s'y attend.
Sentence_IPA: /lə bɔ.nœʁ vjɛ̃ paʁ.fwa kɑ̃ ɔ̃ s‿i a.tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh boh-NUR vyehn par-FWAH kahn ohn see ah-TAHN
Sentence_Translation: Happiness comes sometimes when you expect it.

Sentence: Ta santé compte plus que le reste.
Sentence_IPA: /ta sɑ̃.te kɔ̃t ply kə lə ʁɛst/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tah sahn-TAY kont plew kuh luh rest
Sentence_Translation: Your health matters more than the rest.

Sentence: Le médecin arrive bientôt pour te voir.
Sentence_IPA: /lə med.sɛ̃ a.ʁiv bjɛ̃.to puʁ tə vwaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh med-SEHN ah-REEV byehn-TOH poor tuh vwahr
Sentence_Translation: The doctor is arriving soon to see you.

Sentence: Je prends ce médicament après le petit déjeuner.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ sə me.di.ka.mɑ̃ a.pʁɛ lə pə.ti de.ʒø.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn suh may-dee-kah-MAHN ah-PREH luh puh-TEE day-zhuh-NAY
Sentence_Translation: I take this medicine after breakfast.

Sentence: La douleur diminue quand je reste calme.
Sentence_IPA: /la du.lœʁ di.mi.ny kɑ̃ ʒə ʁɛst kalm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah doo-LUR dee-mee-NEW kahn zhuh rest calm
Sentence_Translation: The pain decreases when I stay calm.

Sentence: Un peu de repos aide beaucoup le corps.
Sentence_IPA: /œ̃ pø də ʁə.po ɛd bo.ku lə kɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: uhn puh duh ruh-POH ed boh-KOO luh kor
Sentence_Translation: A bit of rest helps the body a lot.

Sentence: Je veux dormir tôt pour être en forme.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vø dɔʁ.miʁ to puʁ ɛtʁ ɑ̃ fɔʁm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh vuh dor-MEER toh poor eh-truh ahn form
Sentence_Translation: I want to sleep early to be in shape.

Sentence: Je me réveille vite quand le soleil paraît.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə mə ʁe.vɛj vit kɑ̃ lə sɔ.lɛj pa.ʁɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh muh ray-VAY veet kahn luh so-LAY pah-REH
Sentence_Translation: I wake up quickly when the sun appears.

Sentence: La fatigue disparaît après une bonne nuit.
Sentence_IPA: /la fa.tiɡ dis.pa.ʁɛ a.pʁɛ yn bɔn nɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah fah-TEEG dee-spah-REH ah-PREH een bon nwee
Sentence_Translation: Tiredness disappears after a good night.

Sentence: Cet exercice semble simple,mais il demande du temps.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt ɛɡ.zɛʁ.sis sɑ̃bl sɛ̃pl mɛ il də.mɑ̃d dy tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set eg-ZAIR-seess sahmbl sehmpl meh eel duh-MAHND dew tahn
Sentence_Translation: This exercise seems simple,but it takes time.

Sentence: J'aime nager doucement quand l'eau est chaude.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒɛm na.ʒe dus.mɑ̃ kɑ̃ l‿o ɛ ʃod/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhem nah-ZHAY doos-MAHN kahn loh eh shod
Sentence_Translation: I like to swim gently when the water is warm.

Sentence: Il faut bouger un peu chaque heure au bureau.
Sentence_IPA: /il fo bu.ʒe œ̃ pø ʃak œʁ o by.ʁo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel foe boo-ZHAY uhn puh shak ur oh bew-ROH
Sentence_Translation: You have to move a bit every hour at the office.

Sentence: On doit manger lentement pour mieux sentir le goût.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ dwa mɑ̃.ʒe lɑ̃t.mɑ̃ puʁ mjø sɑ̃.tiʁ lə ɡu/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn dwah mahn-ZHAY lahn-MAHN poor myuh sahn-TEER luh goo
Sentence_Translation: You should eat slowly to taste better.

Sentence: Un légume vert accompagne souvent le plat du jour.
Sentence_IPA: /œ̃ le.ɡym vɛʁ a.kɔ̃.paɲ su.vɑ̃ lə pla dy ʒuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: uhn lay-GEWM vair ah-kon-PAN-yuh soo-VAHN luh plah dew zhoor
Sentence_Translation: A green vegetable often goes with the dish of the day.

Sentence: Je prends un fruit frais après le déjeuner.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ œ̃ fʁɥi fʁɛ a.pʁɛ lə de.ʒø.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn uhn frwee freh ah-PREH luh day-zhuh-NAY
Sentence_Translation: I have a fresh fruit after lunch.

Sentence: ,La bouteille d'eau reste sur la table ici.
Sentence_IPA: /la bu.tɛj d‿o ʁɛst syʁ la tabl i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah boo-TAY-yuh doh rest sewr lah tabl ee-SEE
Sentence_Translation: The water bottle stays on the table here.

Sentence: Je voudrais un verre de jus,s'il vous plaît.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vu.dʁɛ œ̃ vɛʁ də ʒy sil vu plɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh voo-DREH uhn vair duh zhew seel voo pleh
Sentence_Translation: I would like a glass of juice,please.

Sentence: Cette recette marche bien si tu suis tout.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt ʁə.sɛt maʁʃ bjɛ̃ si ty sɥi tu/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set ruh-SET marsh byehn see tew swee too
Sentence_Translation: This recipe works well if you follow everything.

Sentence: Le four chauffe déjà pour le gâteau du dimanche.
Sentence_IPA: /lə fuʁ ʃof de.ʒa puʁ lə ɡa.to dy di.mɑ̃ʃ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh foor shof day-ZHAH poor luh gah-TOH dew dee-MAHNSH
Sentence_Translation: The oven is already heating for Sunday’s cake.

Sentence: L'assiette est prête,mais il manque une fourchette.
Sentence_IPA: /la.sjɛt ɛ pʁɛt mɛ il mɑ̃k yn fuʁ.ʃɛt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-SYET eh pret meh eel mah(n)k een foor-SHET
Sentence_Translation: The plate is ready,but a fork is missing.

Sentence: Prends le couteau propre et coupe le pain.
Sentence_IPA: /pʁɑ̃ lə ku.to pʁɔpʁ e kup lə pɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: prahn luh koo-TOH prohpr ay koop luh pehn
Sentence_Translation: Take the clean knife and cut the bread.

Sentence: Je cherche une cuillère pour la soupe chaude.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ yn kɥi.jɛʁ puʁ la sup ʃod/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh een kwee-YAIR poor lah soop shod
Sentence_Translation: I’m looking for a spoon for the hot soup.

Sentence: N'oublie pas la serviette avant de t'asseoir.
Sentence_IPA: /n‿u.bli pa la sɛʁ.vjɛt a.vɑ̃ də t‿a.swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo-BLEE pah lah sair-VYET ah-VAHN duh tah-SWAR
Sentence_Translation: Don’t forget the napkin before sitting down.

Sentence: La table est prête pour six personnes ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /la tabl ɛ pʁɛt puʁ sis pɛʁ.sɔn sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah tabl eh pret poor sees pair-SON suh swar
Sentence_Translation: The table is ready for six people tonight.

Sentence: Cette chaise grince quand je m'assois dessus.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt ʃɛz ɡʁɛ̃s kɑ̃ ʒə m‿a.swa d(ə).sy/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set shez grenhss kahn zhuh mah-SWA duh-SU
Sentence_Translation: This chair squeaks when I sit on it.

Sentence: La fenêtre est ouverte,mais l'air est froid.
Sentence_IPA: /la f(ə).nɛtʁ ɛ u.vɛʁt mɛ l‿ɛʁ ɛ fʁwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah fuh-NETR eh oo-VERT meh lair eh frwah
Sentence_Translation: The window is open,but the air is cold.

Sentence: Je ferme le rideau pour plus d'intimité.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛʁm lə ʁi.do puʁ ply d‿ɛ̃.ti.mi.te/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh fairm luh ree-DOH poor plew dehn-tee-mee-TAY
Sentence_Translation: I close the curtain for more privacy.

Sentence: Le mur est blanc,avec quelques traces anciennes.
Sentence_IPA: /lə myʁ ɛ blɑ̃ a.vɛk kɛlk tʁas ɑ̃.sjɛn/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh mewr eh blahn ah-vek kelk trahs ahn-SYEN
Sentence_Translation: The wall is white,with a few old marks.

Sentence: Le sol est glissant près de l'entrée.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɔl ɛ ɡli.sɑ̃ pʁɛ də l‿ɑ̃.tʁe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sol eh glee-SAHN preh duh lahn-TRAY
Sentence_Translation: The floor is slippery near the entrance.

Sentence: Le toit fuit un peu quand il pleut fort.
Sentence_IPA: /lə twa fɥi œ̃ pø kɑ̃ il plø fɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh twah fwee uhn puh kahn eel pluh for
Sentence_Translation: The roof leaks a bit when it rains hard.

Sentence: L'escalier est raide,prends ton temps ici.
Sentence_IPA: /l‿ɛs.ka.lje ɛ ʁɛd pʁɑ̃ tɔ̃ tɑ̃ i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: les-kah-LYAY eh red prahn tohn tahn ee-SEE
Sentence_Translation: The stairs are steep; take your time here.

Sentence: La porte claque souvent quand il y a du vent.
Sentence_IPA: /la pɔʁt klak su.vɑ̃ kɑ̃ il j a dy vɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah port klak soo-VAHN kahn eel y ah dew vahn
Sentence_Translation: The door often slams when it’s windy.

Sentence: J'ai perdu la clé,mais j'en ai une autre.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe pɛʁ.dy la kle mɛ ʒɑ̃ ne yn otʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay pair-DEW lah klay meh zhahn ay een ohtr
Sentence_Translation: I lost the key,but I have another one.

Sentence: L'entrée est sombre,alors j'allume la lumière.
Sentence_IPA: /l‿ɑ̃.tʁe ɛ sɔ̃bʁ a.lɔʁ ʒa.lym la ly.mjɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lahn-TRAY eh sohmbr ah-LOR zhah-LEWM lah lew-MYAIR
Sentence_Translation: The entrance is dark,so I switch on the light.

Sentence: La sortie est là,suis les panneaux bleus.
Sentence_IPA: /la sɔʁ.ti ɛ la sɥi le pa.no blø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah sor-TEE eh lah swee lay pah-NOH bluh
Sentence_Translation: The exit is there; follow the blue signs.

Sentence: Cette pièce est trop petite pour nous trois.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt pjɛs ɛ tʁo pə.tit puʁ nu tʁwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set pyess eh tro puh-TEET poor noo trwah
Sentence_Translation: This room is too small for the three of us.

Sentence: Le salon est calme quand les enfants dorment.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sa.lɔ̃ ɛ kalm kɑ̃ le zɑ̃.fɑ̃ dɔʁm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sah-LOHN eh calm kahn lay zah(n)-FAHN dorm
Sentence_Translation: The living room is quiet when the children sleep.

Sentence: La cuisine sent bon quand le pain cuit.
Sentence_IPA: /la kɥi.zin sɑ̃ bɔ̃ kɑ̃ lə pɛ̃ kɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah kwee-ZEEN sahn bohn kahn luh pehn kwee
Sentence_Translation: The kitchen smells nice when the bread bakes.

Sentence: La salle de bains est libre après huit heures.
Sentence_IPA: /la sal də bɛ̃ ɛ libʁ a.pʁɛ ɥit œʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah sal duh behn eh leebr ah-PREH weet ur
Sentence_Translation: The bathroom is free after eight o’clock.

Sentence: Le lit est trop petit pour deux adultes.
Sentence_IPA: /lə li ɛ tʁo pə.ti puʁ dø a.dylt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh lee eh tro puh-TEE poor duh ah-DULT
Sentence_Translation: The bed is too small for two adults.

Sentence: L'oreiller est trop mou,j'en veux un autre.
Sentence_IPA: /l‿ɔ.ʁɛ.je ɛ tʁo mu ʒɑ̃ vø œ̃ notʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lo-reh-YAY eh tro moo zhahn vuh uhn notr
Sentence_Translation: The pillow is too soft; I want another.,je + en -> j'en

Sentence: Le réseau est lent,alors la vidéo bloque.

Sentence: Je vais envoyer le message après la réunion.

Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ahn-vwah-YAY luh meh-SAZH ah-PREH lah ray-ew-NYOHN
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to send the message after the meeting.

Sentence: Je vais recevoir un colis demain matin tôt.

Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ruh-suh-VWAR uhn koh-LEE duh-mehn mah-TEHN toh
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to receive a parcel early tomorrow morning.

Sentence: Le colis est arrivé,mais la boîte est abîmée.
Sentence_IPA: /lə kɔ.li ɛ ta.ʁi.ve mɛ la bwat ɛ a.bi.me/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh koh-LEE eh tah-ree-VAY meh lah bwat eh ah-bee-MAY

Sentence: Je range la boîte vide derrière la porte.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʁɑ̃ʒ la bwat vid dɛ.ʁjɛʁ la pɔʁt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh rahnzh lah bwat veed deh-RYEHR lah port

Sentence: J'écris une lettre courte à mon ami ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe.kʁi yn lɛtʁ kuʁt a mɔ̃ na.mi sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay-KREE een let-ruh koort ah mohn nah-MEE suh swar
Sentence_Translation: I’m writing a short letter to my friend tonight.

Sentence: L'enveloppe est déjà fermée,mais j'ai oublié le timbre.

Sentence_Translation: The envelope is already sealed,but I forgot the stamp.,le + enveloppe -> l'enveloppe,;je + ai -> j'ai

Sentence: Le timbre coûte cher maintenant dans ce pays.
Sentence_IPA: /lə tɛ̃bʁ kut ʃɛʁ mɛ̃.t(ə).nɑ̃ dɑ̃ sə pe.i/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh tehmbr koot shair mehn-tuh-NAHN dahn suh pay-EE
Sentence_Translation: Stamps are expensive now in this country.

Sentence: La poste est fermée,alors je reviens demain.
Sentence_IPA: /la pɔst ɛ fɛʁ.me a.lɔʁ ʒə ʁə.vjɛ̃ də.mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah post eh fair-MAY ah-LOR zhuh ruh-VYEHN duh-mehn
Sentence_Translation: The post office is closed,so I’ll come back tomorrow.

Sentence: L'adresse est fausse,donc le colis revient.
Sentence_IPA: /la.dʁɛs ɛ fos dɔ̃k lə kɔ.li ʁə.vjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-DRESS eh foss donk luh koh-LEE ruh-VYEHN
Sentence_Translation: The address is wrong,so the parcel comes back.

Sentence: Mon téléphone sonne,mais je n'entends rien.

Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn tay-lay-FON son meh zhuh nahn-TAHN ryehn
Sentence_Translation: My phone rings,but I can’t hear anything.

Sentence: Je vais appeler le garage après le déjeuner.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ a.pə.le lə ɡa.ʁaʒ a.pʁɛ lə de.ʒø.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ah-puh-LAY luh gah-RAHZH ah-PREH luh day-zhuh-NAY
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to call the garage after lunch.

Sentence: Je ne peux pas répondre pendant la réunion.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə nə pø pa ʁe.pɔ̃dʁ pɑ̃.dɑ̃ la ʁe.y.njɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nuh puh pah ray-pond-ruh pahn-DAHN lah ray-ew-NYOHN

Sentence: Ton message est clair,je te rappelle ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /tɔ̃ me.saʒ ɛ klɛʁ ʒə tə ʁa.pɛl sə swaʁ/

Sentence: Je prends une photo quand la lumière baisse.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ yn fo.to kɑ̃ la ly.mjɛʁ bɛs/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn een foh-TOH kahn lah lew-MYAIR bess
Sentence_Translation: I take a photo when the light fades.

Sentence: La caméra tremble si je marche trop vite.

Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah kah-may-RAH trahnbl see zhuh marsh tro veet
Sentence_Translation: The camera shakes if I walk too fast.

Sentence: Je vais filmer la rue après la pluie.
