Sentence_Translation: I’m going to film the street after the rain.

Sentence: La vidéo commence bien,puis le son disparaît.
Sentence_IPA: /la vi.de.o kɔ.mɑ̃s bjɛ̃ pɥi lə sɔ̃ dis.pa.ʁɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah vee-day-OH koh-MAHNSS byehn pwee luh sohn dees-pah-REH
Sentence_Translation: The video starts well,then the sound disappears.

Sentence: Le son est trop bas,monte un peu.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɔ̃ ɛ tʁo ba mɔ̃t œ̃ pø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sohn eh troh bah mohnt uhn puh
Sentence_Translation: The sound is too low; turn it up a bit.

Sentence: L'image est floue parce que la lentille est sale.
Sentence_IPA: /li.maʒ ɛ flu paʁs kə la lɑ̃.tij ɛ sal/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lee-MAZH eh floo pars kuh lah lahn-TEE-yuh eh sal
Sentence_Translation: The image is blurry because the lens is dirty.,le + image -> l'image,;parce que -> pars kə

Sentence: La lumière change vite quand les nuages passent.
Sentence_IPA: /la ly.mjɛʁ ʃɑ̃ʒ vit kɑ̃ le nɥaʒ pas/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah lew-MYAIR shah(n)zh veet kahn lay nwee-AZH pahss
Sentence_Translation: The light changes quickly when clouds pass.

Sentence: L'ombre s'allonge quand le soleil descend lentement.
Sentence_IPA: /l‿ɔ̃bʁ sa.lɔ̃ʒ kɑ̃ lə sɔ.lɛj de.sɑ̃ lɑ̃t.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lohmb(r) sah-LOHNZH kahn luh so-LAY duh-SAHN lahn-MAHN
Sentence_Translation: The shadow grows longer when the sun slowly sets.,le + ombre -> l'ombre

Sentence: La route est longue,mais le paysage aide.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁut ɛ lɔ̃ɡ mɛ lə pɛi.zaʒ ɛd/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah root eh lohng meh luh pay-ZAZH ed
Sentence_Translation: The road is long,but the scenery helps.

Sentence: Dans cette rue,les voitures passent trop vite.
Sentence_IPA: /dɑ̃ sɛt ʁy le vwa.tyʁ pas tʁo vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: dahn set rue lay vwah-TYUR pahss tro veet
Sentence_Translation: In this street,cars go by too fast.

Sentence: Le chemin devient boueux après plusieurs jours de pluie.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʃə.mɛ̃ də.vjɛ̃ bu.ø a.pʁɛ ply.zjœʁ ʒuʁ də plɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh shuh-MEHn duh-VYEHN boo-UH ah-PREH plew-ZYUR zhoor duh plwee
Sentence_Translation: The path gets muddy after several days of rain.

Sentence: Le pont est étroit,fais attention en passant.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pɔ̃ ɛ e.tʁwa fɛ za.tɑ̃.sjɔ̃ ɑ̃ pa.sɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh pohn eh ay-TWAH feh zah-tahn-SYOHN ahn pah-SAHN
Sentence_Translation: The bridge is narrow; be careful when crossing.

Sentence: Mon voisin parle fort tard le soir.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ vwa.zɛ̃ paʁl fɔʁ taʁ lə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn vwah-ZEHn parl for tar luh swar
Sentence_Translation: My neighbour speaks loudly late in the evening.

Sentence: Ce quartier est sûr,même la nuit.
Sentence_IPA: /sə kaʁ.tje ɛ syʁ mɛm la nɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh kar-TYAY eh sewr mem lah nwee
Sentence_Translation: This neighbourhood is safe,even at night.

Sentence: La place se remplit vite après le marché.
Sentence_IPA: /la plas sə ʁɑ̃.pli vit a.pʁɛ lə maʁ.ʃe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah plass suh rahn-PLEE veet ah-PREH luh mar-SHAY
Sentence_Translation: The square fills up quickly after the market.

Sentence: Le parc est tranquille quand la ville dort encore.
Sentence_IPA: /lə paʁk ɛ tʁɑ̃.kil kɑ̃ la vil dɔʁ ɑ̃.kɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh park eh trahn-KEEL kahn lah veel dor ahn-KOR
Sentence_Translation: The park is quiet when the city is still asleep.

Sentence: Le jardin a besoin d'eau après cette chaleur.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʒaʁ.dɛ̃ a bə.zwɛ̃ d‿o a.pʁɛ sɛt ʃa.lœʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh zhar-DEHn ah buh-ZWEHN doh ah-PREH set shah-LUR
Sentence_Translation: The garden needs water after this heat.

Sentence: Cette fleur pousse mieux près de la fenêtre.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt flœʁ pus mjø pʁɛ də la f(ə).nɛtʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set flur pooss myuh preh duh lah fuh-NETR
Sentence_Translation: This flower grows better near the window.

Sentence: L'arbre perd ses feuilles quand l'automne arrive.
Sentence_IPA: /laʁbʁ pɛʁ se fœj kɑ̃ lo.tɔn a.ʁiv/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: larbr pair say fuhy kahn loh-TOHN ah-REEV
Sentence_Translation: The tree loses its leaves when autumn arrives.

Sentence: Je ramasse une feuille sèche près du banc.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʁa.mas yn fœj sɛʃ pʁɛ dy bɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh rah-MASS een fuhy sesh preh dew bahn
Sentence_Translation: I pick up a dry leaf near the bench.

Sentence: Le banc est mouillé depuis la pluie de ce matin.
Sentence_IPA: /lə bɑ̃ ɛ mu.je də.pɥi la plɥi də sə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh bahn eh moo-YAY duh-PWEE lah plwee duh suh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: The bench has been wet since this morning’s rain.

Sentence: Le lac est calme,sauf quand le vent souffle.
Sentence_IPA: /lə lak ɛ kalm sof kɑ̃ lə vɑ̃ sufl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh lak eh calm soff kahn luh vahn soofl
Sentence_Translation: The lake is calm except when the wind blows.

Sentence: La rivière déborde parfois après de fortes pluies.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁi.vjɛʁ de.bɔʁd paʁ.fwa a.pʁɛ də fɔʁt plɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ree-VYAIR day-BORD par-FWAH ah-PREH duh fort plwee
Sentence_Translation: The river sometimes overflows after heavy rain.

Sentence: La mer est froide,mais l'air est doux.
Sentence_IPA: /la mɛʁ ɛ fʁwad mɛ l‿ɛʁ ɛ du/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah mair eh frwad meh lair eh doo
Sentence_Translation: The sea is cold,but the air is mild.

Sentence: La plage est vide tôt le matin en hiver.
Sentence_IPA: /la plaʒ ɛ vid to lə ma.tɛ̃ ɑ̃ ni.vɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah plazh eh veed toh luh mah-TEHN ahn nee-VAIR
Sentence_Translation: The beach is empty early in the morning in winter.

Sentence: La montagne est belle,mais la route est difficile.
Sentence_IPA: /la mɔ̃.taɲ ɛ bɛl mɛ la ʁut ɛ di.fi.sil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah mohn-TAN-yuh eh bell meh lah root eh dee-fee-SEEL
Sentence_Translation: The mountain is beautiful,but the road is difficult.

Sentence: La neige tombe doucement depuis la fin d'après-midi.
Sentence_IPA: /la nɛʒ tɔ̃b dus.mɑ̃ də.pɥi la fɛ̃ da.pʁɛ.mi.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah nezh tohmb doos-MAHN duh-PWEE lah fehn dah-preh-mee-DEE
Sentence_Translation: Snow has been falling gently since late afternoon.

Sentence: La pluie s'arrête enfin,mais le ciel reste gris.
Sentence_IPA: /la plɥi sa.ʁɛt ɑ̃.fɛ̃ mɛ lə sjɛl ʁɛst ɡʁi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah plwee sah-RET ahn-FEHn meh luh syel rest gree
Sentence_Translation: Rain finally stops,but the sky stays grey.

Sentence: La température baisse vite après le coucher du soleil.
Sentence_IPA: /la tɑ̃.pe.ʁa.tyʁ bɛs vit a.pʁɛ lə ku.ʃe dy sɔ.lɛj/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah tahn-peh-rah-TYUR bess veet ah-PREH luh koo-SHAY dew so-LAY
Sentence_Translation: The temperature drops quickly after sunset.

Sentence: Chaque saison apporte des couleurs différentes au jardin.
Sentence_IPA: /ʃak sɛ.zɔ̃ a.pɔʁt de ku.lœʁ di.fe.ʁɑ̃t o ʒaʁ.dɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: shak seh-ZOHN ah-por day koo-LUR dee-fay-RAHN(t) oh zhar-DEHN
Sentence_Translation: Each season brings different colours to the garden.

Sentence: Le printemps arrive et les oiseaux chantent tôt.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pʁɛ̃.tɑ̃ a.ʁiv e le zwa.zo ʃɑ̃t to/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh prehn-TAHN ah-REEV ay lay zwah-ZOH shah(n)t toh
Sentence_Translation: Spring arrives and the birds sing early.

Sentence: En été,je bois plus d'eau chaque jour.
Sentence_IPA: /ɑ̃ n‿e.te ʒə bwa ply d‿o ʃak ʒuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ahn nay-TAY zhuh bwah plew doh shak zhoor
Sentence_Translation: In summer,I drink more water every day.

Sentence: En automne,les feuilles tombent près du lac.
Sentence_IPA: /ɑ̃ n‿o.tɔn le fœj tɔ̃b pʁɛ dy lak/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ahn noh-TOHN lay fuhy tohmb preh dew lak
Sentence_Translation: In autumn,the leaves fall near the lake.

Sentence: En hiver,on marche vite pour rester chaud.
Sentence_IPA: /ɑ̃ ni.vɛʁ ɔ̃ maʁʃ vit puʁ ʁɛs.te ʃo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ahn nee-VAIR ohn marsh veet poor res-TAY shoh
Sentence_Translation: In winter,we walk fast to stay warm.

Sentence: Le matin,je prépare du café pour nous deux.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ma.tɛ̃ ʒə pʁe.paʁ dy ka.fe puʁ nu dø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh mah-TEHN zhuh pray-PAR dew kah-FAY poor noo duh
Sentence_Translation: In the morning,I make coffee for the two of us.

Sentence: À midi,nous mangeons dehors si le temps permet.
Sentence_IPA: /a mi.di nu mɑ̃.ʒɔ̃ də.ɔʁ si lə tɑ̃ pɛʁ.mɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah mee-DEE noo mahn-ZHOHN duh-OR see luh tahn pair-MEH
Sentence_Translation: At noon,we eat outside if the weather allows.

Sentence: Le soir,je lis un chapitre avant de dormir.
Sentence_IPA: /lə swaʁ ʒə li œ̃ ʃa.pitʁ a.vɑ̃ də dɔʁ.miʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh swar zhuh lee uhn sha-PEETR ah-VAHN duh dor-MEER
Sentence_Translation: In the evening,I read a chapter before sleeping.

Sentence: Aujourd'hui,je travaille tard,puis je rentre.
Sentence_IPA: /o.ʒuʁ.dɥi ʒə tʁa.vaj taʁ pɥi ʒə ʁɑ̃tʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: oh-zhoor-DWEE zhuh trah-VYE tar pwee zhuh rahntr
Sentence_Translation: Today,I work late,then I go home.

Sentence: Demain,on se lève tôt pour partir.
Sentence_IPA: /də.mɛ̃ ɔ̃ sə lɛv to puʁ paʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: duh-MEHn ohn suh lev toh poor par-TEER
Sentence_Translation: Tomorrow,we get up early to leave.

Sentence: Hier,j'ai trouvé tes clés sous la chaise.
Sentence_IPA: /jɛʁ ʒe tʁu.ve te kle su la ʃɛz/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: yair zhay troo-VAY tay klay soo lah shez
Sentence_Translation: Yesterday,I found your keys under the chair.

Sentence: Il arrive toujours trop tôt pour le train.
Sentence_IPA: /il a.ʁiv tu.ʒuʁ tʁo to puʁ lə tʁɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel ah-REEV too-ZHOOR tro toh poor luh trehn
Sentence_Translation: He always arrives too early for the train.

Sentence: Parfois,je me trompe,mais je corrige vite.
Sentence_IPA: /paʁ.fwa ʒə mə tʁɔ̃p mɛ ʒə kɔ.ʁiʒ vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: par-FWAH zhuh muh troh(n)p meh zhuh koh-REEZH veet
Sentence_Translation: Sometimes I make mistakes,but I correct quickly.

Sentence: Nous allons souvent au marché le samedi matin.
Sentence_IPA: /nu a.lɔ̃ su.vɑ̃ o maʁ.ʃe lə sam.di ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: noo ah-LOHN soo-VAHN oh mar-SHAY luh sam-DEE mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: We often go to the market on Saturday morning.

Sentence: Je ne mange jamais ici sans réserver avant.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə nə mɑ̃ʒ ʒa.mɛ i.si sɑ̃ ʁe.zɛʁ.ve a.vɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nuh mahnzh zhah-MEH ee-SEE sahn ray-zair-VAY ah-VAHN
Sentence_Translation: I never eat here without booking beforehand.

Sentence: Il sera bientôt prêt,attends encore deux minutes.
Sentence_IPA: /il sə.ʁa bjɛ̃.to pʁɛ a.tɑ̃ ɑ̃.kɔʁ dø mi.nyt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel suh-RAH byehn-TOH preh ah-TAHN ahn-KOR duh mee-NEWT
Sentence_Translation: He’ll be ready soon; wait two more minutes.

Sentence: Je dois choisir un cadeau avant la fête.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dwa ʃwa.ziʁ œ̃ ka.do a.vɑ̃ la fɛt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh dwah shwah-ZEER uhn kah-DOH ah-VAHN lah fet
Sentence_Translation: I must choose a gift before the party.

Sentence: Tu peux essayer cette veste,elle taille bien.
Sentence_IPA: /ty pø e.sɛ.je sɛt vɛst ɛl taj bjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew puh ay-seh-YAY set vest el tie byehn
Sentence_Translation: You can try this jacket; it fits well.

Sentence: On doit décider vite pour réserver l'hôtel.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ dwa de.si.de vit puʁ ʁe.zɛʁ.ve lo.tɛl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn dwah day-see-DAY veet poor ray-zair-VAY loh-TEL
Sentence_Translation: We must decide quickly to book the hotel.

Sentence: Je vais voir le médecin pour ma toux.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ vwaʁ lə med.sɛ̃ puʁ ma tu/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh vwar luh mayd-sehn poor mah too
Sentence_Translation: I am going to see the doctor for my cough.

Sentence: La pharmacie est ouverte jusqu'à neuf heures.
Sentence_IPA: /la faʁ.ma.si ɛ u.vɛʁt ʒys.ka nœv œʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah far-mah-see eh oo-vert zhuus-kah nuv ur
Sentence_Translation: The pharmacy is open until nine o’clock.

Sentence: J'ai un rendez-vous demain chez le dentiste.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe œ̃ ʁɑ̃.de.vu də.mɛ̃ ʃe lə dɑ̃.tist/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay uhn rahn-day-voo duh-mehn shay luh dahn-teest
Sentence_Translation: I have an appointment tomorrow at the dentist.

Sentence: Le dentiste explique tout avant de commencer.
Sentence_IPA: /lə dɑ̃.tist ɛks.plik tu a.vɑ̃ də kɔ.mɑ̃.se/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh dahn-teest eks-pleek too ah-VAHN duh koh-mahn-SAY
Sentence_Translation: The dentist explains everything before starting.

Sentence: Garde ton ticket car on peut le vérifier.
Sentence_IPA: /ɡaʁd tɔ̃ ti.kɛ kaʁ ɔ̃ pø lə ve.ʁi.fje/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: gard tohn tee-kay kar ohn puh luh vay-ree-FYAY
Sentence_Translation: Keep your ticket because we can check it.

Sentence: J'achète un billet pour le métro maintenant.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒa.ʃɛt œ̃ bi.jɛ puʁ lə me.tʁo mɛ̃.t(ə).nɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhah-SHET uhn bee-yay poor luh may-troh mehn-tuh-NAHN
Sentence_Translation: I am buying a ticket for the metro now.

Sentence: La station est fermée à cause des travaux.
Sentence_IPA: /la sta.sjɔ̃ ɛ fɛʁ.me a koz de tʁa.vo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah stah-SYOHN eh fair-MAY ah kohz day trah-VOH
Sentence_Translation: The station is closed because of works.

Sentence: Les travaux durent longtemps sur cette route.
Sentence_IPA: /le tʁa.vo dyʁ lɔ̃.tɑ̃ syʁ sɛt ʁut/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay trah-VOH deur lohn-TAHN sewr set root
Sentence_Translation: The works last a long time on this road.

Sentence: Le centre du village est très animé ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɑ̃tʁ dy vi.laʒ ɛ tʁɛ a.ni.me sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sahntr dew vee-LAZH eh treh ah-nee-MAY suh swar
Sentence_Translation: The village centre is very lively tonight.

Sentence: La boulangerie ouvre tôt pour les clients pressés.
Sentence_IPA: /la bu.lɑ̃.ʒʁi uvʁ to puʁ le kljɑ̃ pʁe.se/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah boo-lahn-ZHREE oo-vr toh poor lay klyahn pray-SAY
Sentence_Translation: The bakery opens early for rushed customers.

Sentence: Je prends un croissant et un café au comptoir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ œ̃ kʁwa.sɑ̃ e œ̃ ka.fe o kɔ̃.twaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn uhn krwah-SAHN ay uhn kah-FAY oh kon-TWAR
Sentence_Translation: I take a croissant and a coffee at the counter.

Sentence: Le comptoir est plein et j'attends près de la porte.
Sentence_IPA: /lə kɔ̃.twaʁ ɛ plɛ̃ e ʒa.tɑ̃ pʁɛ də la pɔʁt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh kon-TWAR eh plehn ay zhah-TAHN preh duh lah port
Sentence_Translation: The counter is busy and I wait near the door.

Sentence: Ce fromage sent fort mais il est très bon.
Sentence_IPA: /sə fʁɔ.maʒ sɑ̃ fɔʁ mɛ il ɛ tʁɛ bɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh froh-MAZH sahn for meh eel eh treh bohn
Sentence_Translation: This cheese smells strong but it is very good.

Sentence: Je ne mange plus de viande le soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə nə mɑ̃ʒ ply də vjɑ̃d lə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nuh mahnzh plew duh vya(h)nd luh swar
Sentence_Translation: I no longer eat meat in the evening.

Sentence: Les légumes sont chers dans ce quartier aujourd'hui.
Sentence_IPA: /le le.ɡym sɔ̃ ʃɛʁ dɑ̃ sə kaʁ.tje o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay lay-GEWM sohn shair dahn suh kar-TYAY oh-zhoor-dwee
Sentence_Translation: Vegetables are expensive in this area today.

Sentence: Je coupe un fruit mûr pour le dessert.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə kup œ̃ fʁɥi myʁ puʁ lə de.sɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh koop uhn frwee myur poor luh day-sair
Sentence_Translation: I cut a ripe fruit for dessert.

Sentence: Le dessert arrive après le plat principal.
Sentence_IPA: /lə de.sɛʁ a.ʁiv a.pʁɛ lə pla pʁɛ̃.si.pal/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh day-sair ah-REEV ah-PREH luh plah prehn-see-PAL
Sentence_Translation: The dessert comes after the main course.

Sentence: Ce plat contient trop de sel pour moi.
Sentence_IPA: /sə pla kɔ̃.tjɛ̃ tʁo də sɛl puʁ mwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh plah kon-TYEHN tro duh sel poor mwah
Sentence_Translation: This dish has too much salt for me.

Sentence: Ajoute un peu de sel puis goûte encore.
Sentence_IPA: /a.ʒut œ̃ pø də sɛl pɥi ɡut ɑ̃.kɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah-zhoot uhn puh duh sel pwee goot ahn-KOR
Sentence_Translation: Add a bit of salt then taste again.

Sentence: Je vais goûter la soupe avant de servir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ ɡu.te la sup a.vɑ̃ də sɛʁ.viʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh goo-TAY lah soop ah-VAHN duh sair-VEER
Sentence_Translation: I am going to taste the soup before serving.

Sentence: J'ai oublié la cuillère dans le bol chaud.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe u.bli.je la kɥi.jɛʁ dɑ̃ lə bɔl ʃo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay oo-blee-YAY lah kwee-YAIR dahn luh bol shoh
Sentence_Translation: I forgot the spoon in the hot bowl.

Sentence: La fourchette tombe souvent quand je suis pressé.
Sentence_IPA: /la fuʁ.ʃɛt tɔ̃b su.vɑ̃ kɑ̃ ʒə sɥi pʁe.se/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah foor-SHET tohmb soo-VAHN kahn zhuh swee pray-SAY
Sentence_Translation: The fork often falls when I’m in a hurry.

Sentence: Ce couteau coupe mal,prends celui du tiroir.
Sentence_IPA: /sə ku.to kup mal pʁɑ̃ sə.lɥi dy ti.ʁwaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh koo-TOH koop mal prahn suh-LWEE dew tee-RWAR
Sentence_Translation: This knife cuts badly; take the one from the drawer.

Sentence: L'assiette est cassée,mais on peut manger.
Sentence_IPA: /la.sjɛt ɛ ka.se mɛ ɔ̃ pø mɑ̃.ʒe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-SYET eh kah-SAY meh ohn puh mahn-ZHAY
Sentence_Translation: The plate is broken,but we can eat.

Sentence: Le verre est plein,fais attention en marchant.
Sentence_IPA: /lə vɛʁ ɛ plɛ̃ fɛ za.tɑ̃.sjɔ̃ ɑ̃ maʁ.ʃɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh vair eh plehn feh zah-tahn-SYOHN ahn mar-SHAHN
Sentence_Translation: The glass is full; be careful while walking.

Sentence: La bouteille d'eau reste dans le sac bleu.
Sentence_IPA: /la bu.tɛj do ʁɛst dɑ̃ lə sak blø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah boo-TAYY doh rest dahn luh sak bluh
Sentence_Translation: The water bottle stays in the blue bag.

Sentence: Prends une serviette propre avant de t'asseoir.
Sentence_IPA: /pʁɑ̃ yn sɛʁ.vjɛt pʁɔp a.vɑ̃ də ta.swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: prahn een sair-VYET prop ah-VAHN duh tah-SWAR
Sentence_Translation: Take a clean towel before sitting down.

Sentence: Le savon mousse bien sous l'eau chaude du robinet.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sa.vɔ̃ mus bjɛ̃ su lo ʃod dy ʁɔ.bi.nɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sah-VOHN mooss byehn soo loh shohd dew roh-bee-NAY
Sentence_Translation: The soap lathers well under the hot tap water.
Elision_Note: sous + l'eau -> sous l'eau;de + le -> du

Sentence: Le robinet fuit encore,il faut le réparer.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʁɔ.bi.nɛ fɥi ɑ̃.kɔʁ il fo lə ʁe.pa.ʁe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh roh-bee-NAY fwee ahn-KOR eel foe luh ray-pah-RAY
Sentence_Translation: The tap is still leaking; it needs fixing.

Sentence: La douche est froide si on attend trop.
Sentence_IPA: /la duʃ ɛ fʁwad si ɔ̃ na.tɑ̃ tʁo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah doosh eh frwad see ohn ah-TAHN troh
Sentence_Translation: The shower is cold if we wait too long.

Sentence: Le mur est blanc,mais il se salit vite.
Sentence_IPA: /lə myʁ ɛ blɑ̃ mɛ il sə sa.li vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh myur eh blahn meh eel suh sah-LEE veet
Sentence_Translation: The wall is white,but it gets dirty quickly.

Sentence: Le plafond craque la nuit quand il y a du vent.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pla.fɔ̃ kʁak la nɥi kɑ̃ il j a dy vɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh plah-FOHN krak lah nwee kahn eel y ah dew vahn
Sentence_Translation: The ceiling creaks at night when it’s windy.

Sentence: Le sol est glissant après avoir tout lavé.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɔl ɛ ɡli.sɑ̃ a.pʁɛ a.vwaʁ tu la.ve/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sol eh glee-SAHN ah-PREH ah-VWAR too lah-VAY
Sentence_Translation: The floor is slippery after washing everything.

Sentence: L'escalier est sombre,allume la lumière en haut.
Sentence_IPA: /lɛs.ka.lje ɛ sɔ̃bʁ a.lym la ly.mjɛʁ ɑ̃ o/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: les-kah-LYAY eh sohmbr ah-LEWM lah lew-MYAIR ahn oh
Sentence_Translation: The stairs are dark; turn the light on upstairs.

Sentence: L'ascenseur est en panne,on monte à pied.
Sentence_IPA: /la.sɑ̃.sœʁ ɛ ɑ̃ pan ɔ̃ mɔ̃t a pje/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-sahn-SUR eh ahn pahn ohn mohnt ah pyeh
Sentence_Translation: The lift is broken; we go up on foot.

Sentence: Je suis au troisième étage,sans ascenseur aujourd'hui.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə sɥi o tʁwa.zjɛm e.taʒ sɑ̃ na.sɑ̃.sœʁ o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh swee oh trwah-ZYEM ay-TAZH sahn nah-sahn-SUR oh-zhoor-dwee
Sentence_Translation: I’m on the third floor,without a lift today.

Sentence: Le voisinage est calme,sauf le samedi soir.
Sentence_IPA: /lə vwa.zi.naʒ ɛ kalm sof lə sam.di swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh vwah-zee-NAZH eh calm soff luh sam-DEE swar
Sentence_Translation: The neighbourhood is quiet,except on Saturday night.

Sentence: La police passe parfois ici pour vérifier le quartier.
Sentence_IPA: /la pɔ.lis pas paʁ.fwa i.si puʁ ve.ʁi.fje lə kaʁ.tje/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah poh-LEESS pahss par-FWAH ee-SEE poor vay-ree-FYAY luh kar-TYAY
Sentence_Translation: The police sometimes come by to check the area.

Sentence: L'hôpital est loin,mais le bus y va.
Sentence_IPA: /lo.pi.tal ɛ lwɛ̃ mɛ lə bys i va/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: loh-pee-TAL eh lwehn meh luh bewss ee vah
Sentence_Translation: The hospital is far,but the bus goes there.

Sentence: C'est une urgence,appelle quelqu'un tout de suite.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛ tyn yʁ.ʒɑ̃s a.pɛl kɛl.kœ̃ tu də sɥit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: seh tuhn yur-ZHAHNS ah-PELL kel-kuhn too duh sweet
Sentence_Translation: It’s an emergency; call someone straight away.

Sentence: Mes chaussures sont mouillées après la marche dehors.
Sentence_IPA: /me ʃo.syʁ sɔ̃ mu.je a.pʁɛ la maʁʃ də.ɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: may shoh-SYUR sohn moo-YAY ah-PREH lah marsh duh-OR
Sentence_Translation: My shoes are wet after walking outside.

Sentence: Je cherche une chaussette propre dans le tiroir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ yn ʃo.sɛt pʁɔp dɑ̃ lə ti.ʁwaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh een shoh-SET prop dahn luh tee-RWAR
Sentence_Translation: I’m looking for a clean sock in the drawer.

Sentence: Mon pantalon est trop long,je le plie.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ pɑ̃.ta.lɔ̃ ɛ tʁo lɔ̃ ʒə lə pli/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn pahn-tah-LOHN eh tro lohn zhuh luh plee
Sentence_Translation: My trousers are too long,so I fold them.

Sentence: Cette chemise sèche vite près du radiateur.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt ʃə.miz sɛʃ vit pʁɛ dy ʁa.dja.tœʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set shuh-MEEZ sesh veet preh dew rah-dyah-TUR
Sentence_Translation: This shirt dries quickly near the radiator.

Sentence: Je prends ma veste car il fait frais.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ ma vɛst kaʁ il fɛ fʁɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn mah vest kar eel feh freh
Sentence_Translation: I take my jacket because it’s chilly.

Sentence: Ton manteau est lourd,laisse-le sur la chaise.
Sentence_IPA: /tɔ̃ mɑ̃.to ɛ luʁ lɛs lə syʁ la ʃɛz/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tohn mahn-TOH eh loor less luh sewr lah shez
Sentence_Translation: Your coat is heavy; leave it on the chair.

Sentence: Mon sac est lourd,j'ai trop de livres.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ sak ɛ luʁ ʒe tʁo də livʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn sak eh loor zhay tro duh leevr
Sentence_Translation: My bag is heavy; I have too many books.

Sentence: La clé tourne mal,la porte coince encore.
Sentence_IPA: /la kle tuʁn mal la pɔʁt kwɛ̃s ɑ̃.kɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah klay toorn mal lah port kwehns ahn-KOR
Sentence_Translation: The key turns badly; the door still sticks.

Sentence: La serrure grince quand je ferme la porte.
Sentence_IPA: /la sɛ.ʁyʁ ɡʁɛ̃s kɑ̃ ʒə fɛʁm la pɔʁt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah seh-RYUR grahns kahn zhuh fairm lah port
Sentence_Translation: The lock squeaks when I shut the door.

Sentence: La fenêtre reste ouverte,il fait trop chaud.
Sentence_IPA: /la f(ə).nɛtʁ ʁɛst u.vɛʁt il fɛ tʁo ʃo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah fuh-NETR rest oo-vert eel feh tro shoh
Sentence_Translation: The window stays open; it’s too hot.

Sentence: Je ferme les rideaux quand il fait noir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛʁm le ʁi.do kɑ̃ il fɛ nwaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh fairm lay ree-DOH kahn eel feh nwahr
Sentence_Translation: I close the curtains when it gets dark.

Sentence: La table est prête pour le repas du soir.
Sentence_IPA: /la tabl ɛ pʁɛt puʁ lə ʁə.pa dy swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah tabl eh pret poor luh ruh-PAH dew swar
Sentence_Translation: The table is ready for the evening meal.

Sentence: Cette chaise grince quand je m'assois dessus.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt ʃɛz ɡʁɛ̃s kɑ̃ ʒə ma.swa də.sy/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set shez grahns kahn zhuh mah-SWAH duh-SYOO
Sentence_Translation: This chair squeaks when I sit on it.
Elision_Note: je + me -> je m';je + assois -> m'assois

Sentence: Je prends une couverture parce que j'ai froid.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ yn ku.vɛʁ.tyʁ paʁs kə ʒe fʁwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn een koo-vair-TYUR pars kuh zhay frwah
Sentence_Translation: I take a blanket because I’m cold.
Elision_Note: parce que -> pars kə;je + ai -> j'ai

Sentence: Mon oreiller est trop plat pour dormir bien.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ n‿ɔ.ʁɛ.je ɛ tʁo pla puʁ dɔʁ.miʁ bjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn nor-ray-YAY eh tro plah poor dor-MEER byehn
Sentence_Translation: My pillow is too flat to sleep well.

Sentence: La cuisine sent bon quand le pain cuit.
Sentence_IPA: /la kɥi.zin sɑ̃ bɔ̃ kɑ̃ lə pɛ̃ kɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah kwee-ZEEN sahn bohn kahn luh pehn kwee
Sentence_Translation: The kitchen smells nice when the bread bakes.

Sentence: Le frigo est presque vide,il faut faire les courses.
Sentence_IPA: /lə fʁi.ɡo ɛ pʁɛsk vid il fo fɛʁ le kuʁs/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh free-GOH eh presk veed eel foe fair lay koors
Sentence_Translation: The fridge is almost empty; we need to do the shopping.

Sentence: Il n'y a plus de lait dans le frigo.
Sentence_IPA: /il nja ply də lɛ dɑ̃ lə fʁi.ɡo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel nyah plew duh leh dahn luh free-goh
Sentence_Translation: There is no more milk in the fridge.
Sentence_Breakdown: Il n'y a|there is not|Expr|/il nja/|eel nyah;plus|no more|Adv|/ply/|plew;de|of|Prep|/də/|duh;lait(le)|milk|Noun|/lɛ/|leh;dans|in|Prep|/dɑ̃/|dahn;le(Art)|the|Art|/lə/|luh;frigo(le)|fridge|Noun|/fʁi.ɡo/|free-goh

Sentence: Je coupe le pain et je mets du beurre.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə kup lə pɛ̃ e ʒə mɛ dy bœʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh koop luh pehn ay zhuh meh dew buhr
Sentence_Translation: I cut the bread and I put on butter.

Sentence: Le beurre est trop dur,je le laisse dehors.
Sentence_IPA: /lə bœʁ ɛ tʁo dyʁ ʒə lə lɛs də.ɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh buhr eh troh deur zhuh luh less duh-OR
Sentence_Translation: The butter is too hard; I leave it out.

Sentence: Tu veux du sucre dans ton thé ce matin ?
Sentence_IPA: /ty vø dy sykʁ dɑ̃ tɔ̃ te sə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew vuh dew sewkruh dahn tohn tay suh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: Do you want sugar in your tea this morning?

Sentence: Le thé refroidit vite si la tasse est vide.
Sentence_IPA: /lə te ʁə.fʁwa.di vit si la tas ɛ vid/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh tay ruh-frwah-DEE veet see lah tass eh veed
Sentence_Translation: Tea cools quickly if the cup is empty.

Sentence: Le magasin est fermé,on reviendra demain matin.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ma.ɡa.zɛ̃ ɛ fɛʁ.me ɔ̃ ʁə.vjɛ̃.dʁa də.mɛ̃ ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh mah-gah-ZEHn eh fair-MAY ohn ruh-vyehn-DRAH duh-mehn mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: The shop is closed; we’ll come back tomorrow morning.

Sentence: Le prix a augmenté,donc je n'achète pas.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pʁi a oɡ.mɑ̃.te dɔ̃k ʒə na.ʃɛt pa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh pree ah ohg-mahn-TAY donk zhuh nah-SHET pah
Sentence_Translation: The price went up,so I’m not buying.

Sentence: Je n'ai plus d'argent pour sortir ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ne ply daʁ.ʒɑ̃ puʁ sɔʁ.tiʁ sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nay plew dar-ZHAHN poor sor-TEER suh swar
Sentence_Translation: I don’t have any money left to go out tonight.

Sentence: La banque ouvre tard le lundi dans ma ville.
Sentence_IPA: /la bɑ̃k uvʁ taʁ lə lœ̃.di dɑ̃ ma vil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah bahnk oovr tar luh luhn-DEE dahn mah veel
Sentence_Translation: The bank opens late on Mondays in my town.

Sentence: Ma carte ne passe pas,je paie en espèces.
Sentence_IPA: /ma kaʁt nə pas pa ʒə pɛ ɑ̃ nɛs.pɛs/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah kart nuh pahss pah zhuh peh ahn ness-PESS
Sentence_Translation: My card won’t work,I pay in cash.

Sentence: Il garde des espèces au cas où.
Sentence_IPA: /il ɡaʁd de z‿ɛs.pɛs o ka u/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel gard day zess-PESS oh kah oo
Sentence_Translation: He keeps cash just in case.

Sentence: Je dois payer la facture avant la fin du mois.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dwa pe.je la fak.tyʁ a.vɑ̃ la fɛ̃ dy mwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh dwah pay-YAY lah fak-TYUR ah-VAHN lah fehn dew mwah
Sentence_Translation: I have to pay the bill before the end of the month.

Sentence: Je vais payer maintenant,sinon j'oublie demain.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ pe.je mɛ̃.t(ə).nɑ̃ si.nɔ̃ ʒu.bli də.mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh pay-YAY mehn-tuh-NAHN see-NOHN zhoo-BLEE duh-mehn
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to pay now,otherwise I’ll forget tomorrow.

Sentence: Notre rencontre commence à huit heures précises ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /nɔtʁ ʁɑ̃.kɔ̃tʁ kɔ.mɑ̃s a ɥit œʁ pʁe.siz sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: notr rahn-KONTR koh-MAHNS ah weet ur pray-SEEZ suh swar
Sentence_Translation: Our meeting starts at exactly eight o’clock tonight.

Sentence: La discussion devient difficile quand personne n'écoute.
Sentence_IPA: /la dis.ky.sjɔ̃ də.vjɛ̃ di.fi.sil kɑ̃ pɛʁ.sɔn ne.kut/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah dees-kew-SYOHN duh-VYEHN dee-fee-SEEL kahn pair-SONN nay-KOOT
Sentence_Translation: The discussion becomes difficult when nobody listens.

Sentence: Je pose une question simple pour vérifier le plan.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə poz yn kɛs.tjɔ̃ sɛ̃pl puʁ ve.ʁi.fje lə plɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh pohz een kess-TYOHN sehnpl poor vay-ree-FYAY luh plahn
Sentence_Translation: I ask a simple question to check the plan.

Sentence: La réponse arrive tard,mais elle est utile.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁe.pɔ̃s a.ʁiv taʁ mɛ ɛl ɛ y.til/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ray-PONSS ah-REEV tar meh ell eh ew-TEEL
Sentence_Translation: The answer arrives late,but it is useful.

Sentence: J'ai besoin d'un avis avant de signer.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe bə.zwɛ̃ dœ̃ na.vi a.vɑ̃ də si.ɲe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay buh-ZWEHN duh(n) nah-VEE ah-VAHN duh seen-YAY
Sentence_Translation: I need an opinion before signing.

Sentence: Donne-moi un conseil simple,je suis perdu.
Sentence_IPA: /dɔn mwa œ̃ kɔ̃.sɛj sɛ̃pl ʒə sɥi pɛʁ.dy/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: don mwah uhn kon-SAY sehnpl zhuh swee pair-DEW
Sentence_Translation: Give me a simple bit of advice; I’m lost.

Sentence: Ce problème revient souvent quand on manque de temps.
Sentence_IPA: /sə pʁɔ.blɛm ʁə.vjɛ̃ su.vɑ̃ kɑ̃ ɔ̃ mɑ̃k də tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh proh-BLEM ruh-VYEHN soo-VAHN kahn ohn mah(n)k duh tahn
Sentence_Translation: This problem often comes back when we lack time.

Sentence: La solution est simple si on reste calme.
Sentence_IPA: /la sɔ.ly.sjɔ̃ ɛ sɛ̃pl si ɔ̃ ʁɛst kalm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah soh-lew-SYOHN eh sehnpl see ohn rest calm
Sentence_Translation: The solution is simple if we stay calm.

Sentence: Il y a du danger si tu traverses ici.
Sentence_IPA: /il j a dy dɑ̃.ʒe si ty tʁa.vɛʁs i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel y ah dew dahn-ZHAY see tew trah-VAIRSS ee-SEE
Sentence_Translation: There’s danger if you cross here.

Sentence: Fais attention au vélo qui arrive derrière toi.
Sentence_IPA: /fɛ za.tɑ̃.sjɔ̃ o ve.lo ki a.ʁiv dɛ.ʁjɛʁ twa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: feh zah-tahn-SYOHN oh vay-LOH kee ah-REEV deh-RYEHR twah
Sentence_Translation: Watch out for the bike coming behind you.,à + le -> au

Sentence: J'ai perdu la clé USB avec mes notes.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe pɛʁ.dy la kle y.ɛs.be a.vɛk me nɔt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay pair-DEW lah klay ew-ess-bay ah-vek may not
Sentence_Translation: I lost the USB stick with my notes.

Sentence: Mon ordinateur rame quand j'ouvre trop d'onglets.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ n‿ɔʁ.di.na.tœʁ ʁam kɑ̃ ʒuvʁ tʁo d‿ɔ̃.ɡlɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn nor-dee-nah-TUR rahm kahn zhoovr tro dong-GLAY
Sentence_Translation: My computer lags when I open too many tabs.
Elision_Note: mon + ordinateur (liaison n);je + ouvre -> j'ouvre;de + onglets -> d'onglets

Sentence: La souris ne marche plus,je change les piles.
Sentence_IPA: /la su.ʁi nə maʁʃ ply ʒə ʃɑ̃ʒ le pil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah soo-REE nuh marsh plew zhuh shah(n)zh lay peel
Sentence_Translation: The mouse no longer works; I change the batteries.

Sentence: Le clavier est sale,je le nettoie doucement.
Sentence_IPA: /lə kla.vje ɛ sal ʒə lə ne.twa dus.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh klah-VYAY eh sal zhuh luh net-WAH doos-MAHN
Sentence_Translation: The keyboard is dirty; I clean it gently.

Sentence: L'écran devient sombre quand la batterie est faible.
Sentence_IPA: /le.kʁɑ̃ də.vjɛ̃ sɔ̃bʁ kɑ̃ la ba.tʁi ɛ fɛbl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay-krahn duh-VYEHN sohmbr kahn lah bah-TREE eh febl
Sentence_Translation: The screen goes dim when the battery is low.

Sentence: Ma batterie se vide trop vite en voyage.
Sentence_IPA: /ma ba.tʁi sə vid tʁo vit ɑ̃ vwa.jaʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah bah-TREE suh veed tro veet ahn vwah-YAZH
Sentence_Translation: My battery drains too quickly when travelling.

Sentence: J'ai oublié mon chargeur dans la chambre d'hôtel.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe u.bli.je mɔ̃ ʃaʁ.ʒœʁ dɑ̃ la ʃɑ̃bʁ do.tɛl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay oo-blee-YAY mohn shar-ZHUR dahn lah shahmbr doh-tel
Sentence_Translation: I forgot my charger in the hotel room.

Sentence: Le mot de passe est trop simple,change-le vite.
Sentence_IPA: /lə mo də pas ɛ tʁo sɛ̃pl ʃɑ̃ʒ lə vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh moh duh pahss eh tro sehnpl shah(n)zh luh veet
Sentence_Translation: The password is too simple; change it quickly.

Sentence: Le réseau est lent,je n'arrive pas à charger.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʁe.zo ɛ lɑ̃ ʒə na.ʁiv pa za ʃaʁ.ʒe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh ray-ZOH eh lahn zhuh nah-REEV pah zah shar-ZHAY
Sentence_Translation: The network is slow; I can’t load.

Sentence: Ce programme plante souvent après la dernière mise à jour.
Sentence_IPA: /sə pʁɔ.ɡʁam plɑ̃t su.vɑ̃ a.pʁɛ la dɛʁ.njɛʁ miz a ʒuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh proh-gram plahnt soo-VAHN ah-PREH lah dair-NYEHR meez ah zhoor
Sentence_Translation: This program often crashes after the latest update.

Sentence: Mon équipe travaille bien quand tout le monde aide.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ n‿e.kip tʁa.vaj bjɛ̃ kɑ̃ tu lə mɔ̃d ɛd/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn nay-KEEP trah-VYE byehn kahn too luh mohnd ed
Sentence_Translation: My team works well when everyone helps.

Sentence: Un collègue m'appelle souvent après le déjeuner.
Sentence_IPA: /œ̃ kɔ.lɛɡ ma.pɛl su.vɑ̃ a.pʁɛ lə de.ʒø.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: uhn koh-LEG mah-PELL soo-VAHN ah-PREH luh day-zhuh-NAY
Sentence_Translation: A colleague often calls me after lunch.

Sentence: Le chef veut un résultat clair avant vendredi.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʃɛf vø œ̃ ʁe.zyl.ta klɛʁ a.vɑ̃ vɑ̃.dʁə.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh shef vuh uhn ray-zewl-TAH klair ah-VAHN vahn-druh-DEE
Sentence_Translation: The boss wants a clear result before Friday.

Sentence: La réunion dure trop longtemps,je dois partir.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁe.y.njɔ̃ dyʁ tʁo lɔ̃.tɑ̃ ʒə dwa paʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ray-ew-NYOHN deur tro lohn-TAHN zhuh dwah par-TEER
Sentence_Translation: The meeting lasts too long; I must leave.

Sentence: Le plan change souvent,mais on s'adapte.
Sentence_IPA: /lə plɑ̃ ʃɑ̃ʒ su.vɑ̃ mɛ ɔ̃ sa.dapt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh plahn shah(n)zh soo-VAHN meh ohn sah-DAPT
Sentence_Translation: The plan changes often,but we adapt.

Sentence: Notre objectif reste simple: finir avant midi.
Sentence_IPA: /nɔtʁ ɔb.ʒɛk.tif ʁɛst sɛ̃pl fi.niʁ a.vɑ̃ mi.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: notr ob-zhek-TEEF rest sehnpl fee-NEER ah-VAHN mee-DEE
Sentence_Translation: Our goal stays simple: finish before noon.

Sentence: Je lis le rapport entier avant de répondre.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə li lə ʁa.pɔʁ ɑ̃.tje a.vɑ̃ də ʁe.pɔ̃dʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh lee luh rah-POR ahn-TYAY ah-VAHN duh ray-pond-ruh
Sentence_Translation: I read the whole report before replying.

Sentence: J'envoie un mail court pour confirmer l'heure.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒɑ̃.vwa.j œ̃ mɛl kuʁ puʁ kɔ̃.fiʁ.me lœʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhahn-vwah-y uhn mel koor poor kon-feer-MAY lur
Sentence_Translation: I send a short email to confirm the time.,je + envoie -> j'envoie

Sentence: Ce document manque d'une page,je le renvoie.
Sentence_IPA: /sə dɔ.ky.mɑ̃ mɑ̃k dœ̃ paʒ ʒə lə ʁɑ̃.vwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh dok-ew-MAHN mahnk duh(n) pazh zhuh luh rahn-VWAH
Sentence_Translation: This document is missing a page; I send it back.

Sentence: Je tourne la page,puis je note un détail.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə tuʁn la paʒ pɥi ʒə nɔt œ̃ de.taj/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh toorn lah pazh pwee zhuh not uhn day-TYE
Sentence_Translation: I turn the page,then I note a detail.

Sentence: Mon stylo ne marche plus,je prends un crayon.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ sti.lo nə maʁʃ ply ʒə pʁɑ̃ œ̃ kʁɛ.jɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn stee-LOH nuh marsh plew zhuh prahn uhn kray-YON
Sentence_Translation: My pen no longer works,so I take a pencil.

Sentence: Ce crayon est trop court pour écrire vite.
Sentence_IPA: /sə kʁɛ.jɔ̃ ɛ tʁo kuʁ puʁ e.kʁiʁ vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh kray-YON eh tro koor poor ay-KREER veet
Sentence_Translation: This pencil is too short to write quickly.

Sentence: Je cherche mon cahier dans le sac noir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ mɔ̃ ka.je dɑ̃ lə sak nwaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh mohn kah-YAY dahn luh sak nwahr
Sentence_Translation: I’m looking for my notebook in the black bag.

Sentence: La classe commence tôt,alors je pars vite.
Sentence_IPA: /la klas kɔ.mɑ̃s to a.lɔʁ ʒə paʁ vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah klass koh-MAHNS toh ah-LOR zhuh par veet
Sentence_Translation: Class starts early,so I leave quickly.

Sentence: Le professeur parle lentement pour que tout le monde suive.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pʁɔ.fɛ.sœʁ paʁl lɑ̃t.mɑ̃ puʁ kə tu lə mɔ̃d sɥiv/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh proh-feh-SUR parl lahnt-MAHN poor kuh too luh mohnd sweev
Sentence_Translation: The teacher speaks slowly so that everyone follows.

Sentence: L'élève écoute bien et prend des notes claires.
Sentence_IPA: /le.lɛv e.kut bjɛ̃ e pʁɑ̃ de nɔt klɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay-LEV ay-KOOT byehn ay prahn day not klair
Sentence_Translation: The student listens well and takes clear notes.

Sentence: J'ai un devoir à rendre avant lundi matin.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe œ̃ də.vwaʁ a ʁɑ̃dʁ a.vɑ̃ lœ̃.di ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay uhn duh-VWAR ah rahnd-ruh ah-VAHN luhn-dee mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: I have homework to hand in before Monday morning.

Sentence: L'examen est demain,donc je révise ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /lɛɡ.za.mɛ̃ ɛ də.mɛ̃ dɔ̃k ʒə ʁe.viz sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: leg-zah-MEHn eh duh-mehn donk zhuh ray-VEEZ suh swar
Sentence_Translation: The exam is tomorrow,so I revise tonight.,le + examen -> l'examen

Sentence: Je vais réviser une heure avant de sortir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ ʁe.vi.ze yn œʁ a.vɑ̃ də sɔʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ray-vee-ZAY een ur ah-VAHN duh sor-TEER
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to revise for an hour before going out.

Sentence: Il est une heure,on commence tout de suite.
Sentence_IPA: /il ɛ tyn œʁ ɔ̃ kɔ.mɑ̃s tu də sɥit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel eh tuhn ur ohn koh-MAHNS too duh sweet
Sentence_Translation: It’s one o’clock; we start right away.

Sentence: Attends une minute,je finis ce message d'abord.
Sentence_IPA: /a.tɑ̃d yn mi.nyt ʒə fi.ni sə me.saʒ da.bɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah-TAHND een mee-NEWT zhuh fee-NEE suh may-SAZH dah-BOR
Sentence_Translation: Wait a minute,I’ll finish this message first.

Sentence: Une seconde suffit,mais ne bouge pas.
Sentence_IPA: /yn sə.gɔ̃d sy.fi mɛ nə buʒ pa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: een suh-GOND sew-fee meh nuh boozh pah
Sentence_Translation: A second is enough,but don’t move.

Sentence: Chaque jour,je marche un peu après manger.
Sentence_IPA: /ʃak ʒuʁ ʒə maʁʃ œ̃ pø a.pʁɛ mɑ̃.ʒe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: shak zhoor zhuh marsh uhn puh ah-PREH mahn-ZHAY
Sentence_Translation: Every day,I walk a bit after eating.

Sentence: Le dimanche,nous restons à la maison longtemps.
Sentence_IPA: /lə di.mɑ̃ʃ nu ʁɛs.tɔ̃ a la mɛ.zɔ̃ lɔ̃.tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh dee-MAHNSH noo res-TOHN ah lah meh-ZOHN lohn-TAHN
Sentence_Translation: On Sundays,we stay at home for ages.

Sentence: Le lundi,je me lève plus tôt qu'hier.
Sentence_IPA: /lə lœ̃.di ʒə mə lɛv ply to kjɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh luhn-DEE zhuh muh lev plew toh kyair
Sentence_Translation: On Monday,I get up earlier than yesterday.
Elision_Note: que + hier (liaison k);je + me -> je m'

Sentence: Le mardi,on fait les courses après le travail.
Sentence_IPA: /lə maʁ.di ɔ̃ fɛ le kuʁs a.pʁɛ lə tʁa.vaj/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh mar-DEE ohn feh lay koors ah-PREH luh trah-VYE
Sentence_Translation: On Tuesday,we do the shopping after work.

Sentence: Le mercredi,les enfants rentrent plus tôt à la maison.
Sentence_IPA: /lə mɛʁ.kʁə.di le zɑ̃.fɑ̃ ʁɑ̃tʁ ply to a la mɛ.zɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh mehr-kruh-DEE lay zahn-FAHN rahntr plew toh ah lah meh-ZOHN
Sentence_Translation: On Wednesday,the children come home earlier.

Sentence: Le jeudi,je cuisine simple et je range.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʒø.di ʒə kɥi.zin sɛ̃pl e ʒə ʁɑ̃ʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh zhuh-DEE zhuh kwee-ZEEN sehnpl ay zhuh rahnzh
Sentence_Translation: On Thursday,I cook simply and tidy up.

Sentence: Le vendredi,on sort tard après le dîner.
Sentence_IPA: /lə vɑ̃.dʁə.di ɔ̃ sɔʁ taʁ a.pʁɛ lə di.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh vahn-druh-DEE ohn sor tar ah-PREH luh dee-NAY
Sentence_Translation: On Friday,we go out late after dinner.

Sentence: Le samedi,je fais le ménage avant midi.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sam.di ʒə fɛ lə me.naʒ a.vɑ̃ mi.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sam-DEE zhuh feh luh may-NAZH ah-VAHN mee-DEE
Sentence_Translation: On Saturday,I do the cleaning before noon.

Sentence: Je fais le ménage vite avant midi.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛ lə me.naʒ vit a.vɑ̃ mi.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh feh luh may-NAZH veet ah-VAHN mee-DEE
Sentence_Translation: I do the cleaning quickly before noon.

Sentence: L'aspirateur fait trop de bruit dans ce couloir.
Sentence_IPA: /la.spi.ʁa.tœʁ fɛ tʁo də bʁɥi dɑ̃ sə ku.lwaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-spee-rah-TUR feh tro duh brwee dahn suh koo-LWAR
Sentence_Translation: The hoover makes too much noise in this corridor.

Sentence: Je prends le balai pour nettoyer sous la table.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ lə ba.lɛ puʁ ne.twa.je su la tabl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn luh bah-LEH poor net-wah-YAY soo lah tabl
Sentence_Translation: I take the broom to clean under the table.

Sentence: La poussière revient vite près des fenêtres ouvertes.
Sentence_IPA: /la pu.sjɛʁ ʁə.vjɛ̃ vit pʁɛ de f(ə).nɛtʁ u.vɛʁt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah poo-SYAIR ruh-VYEHN veet preh day fuh-NETR oo-vert
Sentence_Translation: Dust comes back quickly near open windows.

Sentence: Je plie le linge propre dans la chambre.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pli lə lɛ̃ʒ pʁɔp dɑ̃ la ʃɑ̃bʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh plee luh lehnzh prop dahn lah shahmbr
Sentence_Translation: I fold the clean laundry in the bedroom.

Sentence: Il n'y a plus de lessive pour ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /il nja ply də lɛ.siv puʁ sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel nyah plew duh leh-SEEV poor suh swar
Sentence_Translation: There’s no detergent left for tonight.

Sentence: Le lavage dure longtemps avec ce programme lent.
Sentence_IPA: /lə la.vaʒ dyʁ lɔ̃.tɑ̃ a.vɛk sə pʁɔ.ɡʁam lɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh lah-VAZH deur lohn-TAHN ah-vek suh proh-gram lahn
Sentence_Translation: The wash takes a long time with this slow programme.

Sentence: Je laisse sécher les vêtements près du radiateur.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə lɛs se.ʃe le vɛt.mɑ̃ pʁɛ dy ʁa.dja.tœʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh less say-SHAY lay vet-MAHN preh dew rah-dyah-TUR
Sentence_Translation: I let the clothes dry near the radiator.

Sentence: Le repas est simple,mais tout le monde mange.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʁə.pa ɛ sɛ̃pl mɛ tu lə mɔ̃d mɑ̃ʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh ruh-PAH eh sehnpl meh too luh mohnd mahnzh
Sentence_Translation: The meal is simple,but everyone eats.

Sentence: Après le dîner,on fait une petite promenade.
Sentence_IPA: /a.pʁɛ lə di.ne ɔ̃ fɛ yn pə.tit pʁɔ.mə.nad/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah-PREH luh dee-NAY ohn feh een puh-TEET proh-muh-NAD
Sentence_Translation: After dinner,we take a short walk.

Sentence: Le soleil revient enfin après la pluie.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɔ.lɛj ʁə.vjɛ̃ ɑ̃.fɛ̃ a.pʁɛ la plɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh so-LAY ruh-VYEHN ahn-FEHN ah-PREH lah plwee
Sentence_Translation: The sun finally comes back after the rain.

Sentence: La pluie tombe fort sur le toit.
Sentence_IPA: /la plɥi tɔ̃b fɔʁ syʁ lə twa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah plwee tohmb for sewr luh twah
Sentence_Translation: The rain falls hard on the roof.

Sentence: La neige couvre la rue tôt ce matin.
Sentence_IPA: /la nɛʒ kuvʁ la ʁy to sə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah nezh koovr lah ry toh suh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: The snow covers the street early this morning.

Sentence: Prends ton parapluie il pleut depuis midi.
Sentence_IPA: /pʁɑ̃ tɔ̃ pa.ʁa.plɥi il plø də.pɥi mi.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: prahn tohn pah-rah-plwee eel pluh duh-pwee mee-DEE
Sentence_Translation: Take your umbrella it has been raining since noon.

Sentence: La météo annonce du soleil pour demain.
Sentence_IPA: /la me.te.o a.nɔ̃s dy sɔ.lɛj puʁ də.mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah may-tay-oh ah-NONSS dew so-LAY poor duh-MEHN
Sentence_Translation: The forecast says sun for tomorrow.

Sentence: La température baisse vite quand le soir arrive.
Sentence_IPA: /la tɑ̃.pe.ʁa.tyʁ bɛs vit kɑ̃ lə swaʁ a.ʁiv/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah tahn-peh-rah-TYUR bess veet kahn luh swar ah-REEV
Sentence_Translation: The temperature drops quickly when evening comes.

Sentence: L'hiver est long mais on s'habitue.
Sentence_IPA: /li.vɛʁ ɛ lɔ̃ mɛ ɔ̃ sa.bi.ty/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lee-VAIR eh lohn meh ohn sah-bee-TEW
Sentence_Translation: Winter is long but you get used to it.
Elision_Note: le + hiver -> l'hiver;on + s' -> liaison possible

Sentence: Au printemps les arbres bourgeonnent dans le parc.
Sentence_IPA: /o pʁɛ̃.tɑ̃ le zaʁbʁ buʁ.ʒɔn dɑ̃ lə paʁk/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: oh prehn-TAHN lay zarb boor-ZHON dahn luh park
Sentence_Translation: In spring the trees bud in the park.

Sentence: L'été on ouvre les fenêtres toute la journée.
Sentence_IPA: /le.te ɔ̃ nuvʁ le f(ə).nɛtʁ tut la ʒuʁ.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay-TAY ohn NOOVR lay fuh-NETR toot lah zhoor-NAY
Sentence_Translation: In summer we open the windows all day.

Sentence: En automne les feuilles tombent très vite ici.
Sentence_IPA: /ɑ̃ o.tɔn le fœj tɔ̃b tʁɛ vit i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ahn oh-TON lay fuhy tohmb treh veet ee-SEE
Sentence_Translation: In autumn the leaves fall very quickly here.

Sentence: Je ramasse une feuille sèche devant la porte.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʁa.mas yn fœj sɛʃ də.vɑ̃ la pɔʁt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh rah-MASS een fuhy sesh duh-VAHN lah port
Sentence_Translation: I pick up a dry leaf in front of the door.

Sentence: Cet arbre donne de l'ombre l'après-midi.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt aʁbʁ dɔn də lɔ̃bʁ la.pʁɛ mi.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set arb(r) don duh lommbr lah-preh mee-DEE
Sentence_Translation: This tree gives shade in the afternoon.

Sentence: Elle offre une fleur rouge à sa mère.
Sentence_IPA: /ɛl ɔfʁ yn flœʁ ʁuʒ a sa mɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: el off-r een flur roozh ah sah mair
Sentence_Translation: She offers a red flower to her mother.

Sentence: Le parc ferme tôt quand il fait froid.
Sentence_IPA: /lə paʁk fɛʁm to kɑ̃ il fɛ fʁwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh park fairm toh kahn eel feh frwah
Sentence_Translation: The park closes early when it’s cold.

Sentence: On traverse le pont pour aller au marché.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ tʁa.vɛʁs lə pɔ̃ puʁ a.le o maʁ.ʃe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn trah-VAIRSS luh pon poor ah-LAY oh mar-SHAY
Sentence_Translation: We cross the bridge to go to the market.

Sentence: Le chemin est boueux après la grosse pluie.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʃə.mɛ̃ ɛ bu.ø a.pʁɛ la ɡʁɔs plɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh shuh-MEHN eh boo-uh ah-PREH lah gross plwee
Sentence_Translation: The path is muddy after the heavy rain.

Sentence: Le trottoir est étroit près de cette école.
Sentence_IPA: /lə tʁɔ.twaʁ ɛ e.tʁwa pʁɛ də sɛt e.kɔl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh tro-TWAR eh ay-TRWAH preh duh set ay-KOL
Sentence_Translation: The pavement is narrow near this school.

Sentence: Le feu passe au rouge on s'arrête ici.
Sentence_IPA: /lə fø pas o ʁuʒ ɔ̃ sa.ʁɛt i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh fuh pahss oh roozh ohn sah-RET ee-SEE
Sentence_Translation: The light turns red and we stop here.
Elision_Note: à + le -> au;on + s' -> liaison possible

Sentence: Après le virage la route descend vers la rivière.
Sentence_IPA: /a.pʁɛ lə vi.ʁaʒ la ʁut de.sɑ̃ vɛʁ la ʁi.vjɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah-PREH luh vee-RAZH lah root duh-SAHN vair lah ree-VYEHR
Sentence_Translation: After the bend the road goes down towards the river.

Sentence: La rivière monte vite après de fortes pluies.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁi.vjɛʁ mɔ̃t vit a.pʁɛ də fɔʁt plɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ree-VYEHR mohnt veet ah-PREH duh fort plwee
Sentence_Translation: The river rises quickly after heavy rains.

Sentence: Le bois craque quand le feu chauffe trop.
Sentence_IPA: /lə bwa kʁak kɑ̃ lə fø ʃof tʁo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh bwah krak kahn luh fuh shoff tro
Sentence_Translation: The wood crackles when the fire gets too hot.

Sentence: La forêt est silencieuse tôt le matin.
Sentence_IPA: /la fɔ.ʁɛ ɛ si.lɑ̃.sjøz to lə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah foh-REH eh see-lahn-SYUHZ toh luh mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: The forest is quiet early in the morning.

Sentence: On voit la colline depuis la place du village.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ vwa la kɔ.lin də.pɥi la plas dy vi.laʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn vwah lah koh-LEEN duh-pwee lah plass dew vee-LAZH
Sentence_Translation: You can see the hill from the village square.

Sentence: La montagne est belle mais le chemin fatigue.
Sentence_IPA: /la mɔ̃.taɲ ɛ bɛl mɛ lə ʃə.mɛ̃ fa.tig/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah mohn-TAHN-yuh eh bell meh luh shuh-MEHN fah-teeg
Sentence_Translation: The mountain is beautiful but the path is tiring.

Sentence: La mer est calme quand le vent tombe.
Sentence_IPA: /la mɛʁ ɛ kalm kɑ̃ lə vɑ̃ tɔ̃b/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah mair eh calm kahn luh vahn tohmb
Sentence_Translation: The sea is calm when the wind drops.

Sentence: La plage est vide tôt un lundi matin.
Sentence_IPA: /la plaʒ ɛ vid to œ̃ lœ̃.di ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah plazh eh veed toh uhn luhn-dee mah-TEHN
Sentence_Translation: The beach is empty early on a Monday morning.

Sentence: Le sable entre partout quand il y a du vent.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sabl ɑ̃tʁ paʁ.tu kɑ̃ il j a dy vɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sahbl ahn-tr par-TOO kahn eel y ah dew vahn
Sentence_Translation: Sand gets everywhere when it’s windy.

Sentence: Une vague plus forte mouille mes chaussures vite.
Sentence_IPA: /yn vaɡ ply fɔʁt muj me ʃo.syʁ vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: een vahg plew fort moo-y may shoh-SYUR veet
Sentence_Translation: A stronger wave quickly soaks my shoes.

Sentence: Le lac est froid même pendant l'été.
Sentence_IPA: /lə lak ɛ fʁwa mɛm pɑ̃.dɑ̃ le.te/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh lak eh frwah mem pahn-dahn lay-TAY
Sentence_Translation: The lake is cold even during summer.

Sentence: L'île est petite mais très jolie à voir.
Sentence_IPA: /lil ɛ pə.tit mɛ tʁɛ ʒɔ.li a vwaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: leel eh puh-TEET meh treh zho-LEE ah vwar
Sentence_Translation: The island is small but very pretty to see.

Sentence: La vue est superbe depuis le haut du pont.
Sentence_IPA: /la vy ɛ sy.pɛʁb də.pɥi lə o dy pɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah vyew eh sew-PAIRB duh-pwee luh oh dew pon
Sentence_Translation: The view is superb from the top of the bridge.

Sentence: Je cherche l'ombre parce que le soleil tape.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ lɔ̃bʁ paʁs kə lə sɔ.lɛj tap/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh lombr pars kuh luh so-LAY tap
Sentence_Translation: I look for shade because the sun is beating down.
Elision_Note: le + ombre -> l'ombre;parce que -> pars kə

Sentence: Chaque matin je bois de l'eau avant de sortir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʃak ma.tɛ̃ ʒə bwa də lo a.vɑ̃ də sɔʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: shak mah-TEHN zhuh bwah duh loh ah-VAHN duh sor-TEER
Sentence_Translation: Every morning I drink water before going out.

Sentence: La soirée finit tard mais tout le monde rit.
Sentence_IPA: /la swa.ʁe fi.ni taʁ mɛ tu lə mɔ̃d ʁi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah swah-RAY fee-NEE tar meh too luh mohnd ree
Sentence_Translation: The evening ends late but everyone laughs.

Sentence: Aujourd'hui je reste calme malgré les problèmes.
Sentence_IPA: /o.ʒuʁ.dɥi ʒə ʁɛst kalm mal.ɡʁe le pʁɔ.blɛm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: oh-zhoor-dwee zhuh rest calm mal-GRAY lay proh-BLEM
Sentence_Translation: Today I stay calm despite the problems.

Sentence: Demain je me lève tôt pour voyager.
Sentence_IPA: /də.mɛ̃ ʒə mə lɛv to puʁ vwa.ja.ʒe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: duh-MEHN zhuh muh lev toh poor vwah-yah-ZHAY
Sentence_Translation: Tomorrow I get up early to travel.

Sentence: Hier j'ai marché longtemps et je suis rentré tard.
Sentence_IPA: /jɛʁ ʒe maʁ.ʃe lɔ̃.tɑ̃ e ʒə sɥi ʁɑ̃.tʁe taʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: yair zhay mar-SHAY lohn-TAHN ay zhuh swee rahn-TRAY tar
Sentence_Translation: Yesterday I walked a long time and I came back late.

Sentence: Le week-end je dors plus et je cuisine.
Sentence_IPA: /lə wi.kɛnd ʒə dɔʁ ply e ʒə kɥi.zin/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh wee-KEND zhuh dor plew ay zhuh kwee-ZEEN
Sentence_Translation: At the weekend I sleep more and I cook.

Sentence: Le temps passe vite quand on est occupé.
Sentence_IPA: /lə tɑ̃ pas vit kɑ̃ ɔ̃ n‿ɛ tɔ.ky.pe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh tahn pahss veet kahn ohn nay toh-kew-PAY
Sentence_Translation: Time flies when you’re busy.

Sentence: J'ai une idée simple pour gagner du temps.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe yn i.de sɛ̃pl puʁ ɡa.ɲe dy tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay een ee-DAY sehnpl poor gah-NYAY dew tahn
Sentence_Translation: I have a simple idea to save time.

Sentence: Pour quelle raison tu pars si tôt ?
Sentence_IPA: /puʁ kɛl ʁɛ.zɔ̃ ty paʁ si to/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: poor kel ray-ZOHN tew par see toh
Sentence_Translation: For what reason are you leaving so early?

Sentence: Le choix est difficile sans assez d'informations claires.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʃwa ɛ di.fi.sil sɑ̃ za.se dɛ̃.fɔʁ.ma.sjɔ̃ klɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh shwah eh dee-fee-SEEL sahn zah-say dehn-for-ma-SYOHN klair
Sentence_Translation: The choice is hard without enough clear information.

Sentence: J'ai fait une erreur,mais je corrige vite.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe fɛ yn e.ʁœʁ mɛ ʒə kɔ.ʁiʒ vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay feh een ay-RUHR meh zhuh koh-REEZH veet
Sentence_Translation: I made a mistake,but I fix it quickly.

Sentence: Je vois des progrès nets depuis le mois dernier.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vwa de pʁɔ.ɡʁɛ nɛ də.pɥi lə mwa dɛʁ.nje/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh vwah day proh-GRAY neh duh-pwee luh mwah dair-NYAY
Sentence_Translation: I see clear progress since last month.

Sentence: Un effort régulier donne de meilleurs résultats.
Sentence_IPA: /œ̃ n‿e.fɔʁ ʁe.ɡy.lje dɔn də mɛ.jœʁ ʁe.zyl.ta/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: uhn nay-FOR ray-gew-lyay don duh meh-YUR ray-zewl-TAH
Sentence_Translation: Regular effort gives better results.

Sentence: Le bruit continue dehors,je ferme la fenêtre.
Sentence_IPA: /lə bʁɥi kɔ̃.ti.ny də.ɔʁ ʒə fɛʁm la f(ə).nɛtʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh brwee kon-tee-NEW duh-OR zhuh fairm lah fuh-NETR
Sentence_Translation: The noise continues outside; I shut the window.

Sentence: Le silence revient enfin quand tout le monde dort.
Sentence_IPA: /lə si.lɑ̃s ʁə.vjɛ̃ ɑ̃.fɛ̃ kɑ̃ tu lə mɔ̃d dɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh see-LAHNS ruh-VYEHN ahn-FEHN kahn too luh mohnd dor
Sentence_Translation: Silence returns at last when everyone sleeps.

Sentence: Mon voisin parle fort tard le soir.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ vwa.zɛ̃ paʁl fɔʁ taʁ lə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn vwah-ZEHn parl for tar luh swar
Sentence_Translation: My neighbour speaks loudly late at night.

Sentence: La voisine apporte du pain quand je rentre.
Sentence_IPA: /la vwa.zin a.pɔʁt dy pɛ̃ kɑ̃ ʒə ʁɑ̃tʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah vwah-ZEEN ah-port dew pehn kahn zhuh rahntr
Sentence_Translation: The neighbour brings bread when I come home.

Sentence: Mon quartier est calme sauf près de la gare.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ kaʁ.tje ɛ kalm sof pʁɛ də la ɡaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn kar-TYAY eh calm soff preh duh lah gar
Sentence_Translation: My neighbourhood is quiet except near the station.

Sentence: La gare est loin,je prends le bus.
Sentence_IPA: /la ɡaʁ ɛ lwɛ̃ ʒə pʁɑ̃ lə bys/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah gar eh lwehn zhuh prahn luh bewss
Sentence_Translation: The station is far,so I take the bus.

Sentence: L'arrêt est juste après le grand pont.
Sentence_IPA: /la.ʁɛ ʒyst a.pʁɛ lə ɡʁɑ̃ pɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-REH zhyst ah-PREH luh grahn pon
Sentence_Translation: The stop is just after the big bridge.

Sentence: Je cherche mon billet avant de monter.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ mɔ̃ bi.jɛ a.vɑ̃ də mɔ̃.te/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh mohn bee-YAY ah-VAHN duh mohn-TAY
Sentence_Translation: I look for my ticket before getting on.

Sentence: Le retard s'accumule quand il pleut beaucoup.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʁə.taʁ sa.ky.myl kɑ̃ il plø bo.ku/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh ruh-TAR sah-kew-MEWL kahn eel pluh boh-KOO
Sentence_Translation: Delays build up when it rains a lot.

Sentence: Le train est complet,on attend le suivant.
Sentence_IPA: /lə tʁɛ̃ ɛ kɔ̃.plɛ ɔ̃ na.tɑ̃ lə sɥi.vɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh trehn eh kon-PLEH ohn nah-TAHN luh swee-VAHN
Sentence_Translation: The train is full; we wait for the next one.

Sentence: Je reste sur le quai malgré le froid.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʁɛst syʁ lə kɛ mal.ɡʁe lə fʁwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh rest sewr luh keh mal-GRAY luh frwah
Sentence_Translation: I stay on the platform despite the cold.

Sentence: Cette ligne est pratique pour aller en centre-ville.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt liɲ ɛ pʁa.tik puʁ a.le ɑ̃ sɑ̃tʁə.vil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set leen-yuh eh prah-TEEK poor ah-LAY ahn sahntr-veel
Sentence_Translation: This line is handy for going into town centre.

Sentence: Tu regardes le plan et tu choisis la route.
Sentence_IPA: /ty ʁə.ɡaʁd lə plɑ̃ e ty ʃwa.zi la ʁut/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew ruh-gard luh plahn ay tew shwah-ZEE lah root
Sentence_Translation: You look at the map and choose the route.

Sentence: Je note l'adresse sur un papier avant de partir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə nɔt la.dʁɛs syʁ œ̃ pa.pje a.vɑ̃ də paʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh not lah-DRESS sewr uhn pah-PYAY ah-VAHN duh par-TEER
Sentence_Translation: I write the address on paper before leaving.

Sentence: Quel est ton numéro pour te joindre ce soir ?
Sentence_IPA: /kɛl ɛ tɔ̃ ny.me.ʁo puʁ tə ʒwɑ̃dʁ sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: kel eh tohn new-may-ROH poor tuh zhwahn-druh suh swar
Sentence_Translation: What’s your number so I can reach you tonight?

Sentence: Je reçois un appel tard,puis je réponds.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʁə.swa œ̃ na.pɛl taʁ pɥi ʒə ʁe.pɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh ruh-SWAH uhn nah-PELL tar pwee zhuh ray-PON
Sentence_Translation: I get a late call,then I answer.

Sentence: Ton message est clair,je réponds rapidement.
Sentence_IPA: /tɔ̃ me.saʒ ɛ klɛʁ ʒə ʁe.pɔ̃ ʁa.pi.də.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tohn may-SAZH eh klair zhuh ray-PON rah-pee-duh-MAHN
Sentence_Translation: Your message is clear; I reply quickly.

Sentence: J'attends une réponse avant de réserver la table.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒa.tɑ̃d yn ʁe.pɔ̃s a.vɑ̃ də ʁe.zɛʁ.ve la tabl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhah-TAHN(d) een ray-PONSS ah-VAHN duh ray-zair-VAY lah tabl
Sentence_Translation: I’m waiting for a reply before booking the table.,je + attends -> j'attends

Sentence: Je prends une photo nette devant la gare.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ yn fo.to nɛt də.vɑ̃ la ɡaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn een foh-TOH net duh-VAHN lah gar
Sentence_Translation: I take a clear photo in front of the station.

Sentence: L'image est floue,je refais la photo.
Sentence_IPA: /li.maʒ ɛ flu ʒə ʁə.fɛ la fo.to/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lee-MAZH eh floo zhuh ruh-feh lah foh-toh
Sentence_Translation: The image is blurry; I retake the photo.,le + image -> l'image

Sentence: La vidéo commence bien,puis le son coupe.
Sentence_IPA: /la vi.de.o kɔ.mɑ̃s bjɛ̃ pɥi lə sɔ̃ kup/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah vee-day-OH koh-MAHNS byehn pwee luh sohn koop
Sentence_Translation: The video starts well,then the sound cuts out.

Sentence: Le son est trop bas,monte un peu.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɔ̃ ɛ tʁo ba mɔ̃t œ̃ pø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sohn eh tro bah mohnt uhn puh
Sentence_Translation: The sound is too low; turn it up a bit.

Sentence: La musique aide à travailler quand elle est douce.
Sentence_IPA: /la my.zik ɛd a tʁa.va.je kɑ̃ ɛl ɛ dus/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah mew-ZEEK ed ah trah-vah-YAY kahn ell eh doos
Sentence_Translation: Music helps with working when it’s gentle.

Sentence: Je lis un livre calme avant de dormir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə li œ̃ livʁ kalm a.vɑ̃ də dɔʁ.miʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh lee uhn leevr calm ah-VAHN duh dor-MEER
Sentence_Translation: I read a calming book before sleeping.

Sentence: L'histoire commence doucement,puis devient très drôle.
Sentence_IPA: /lis.twaʁ kɔ.mɑ̃s dus.mɑ̃ pɥi də.vjɛ̃ tʁɛ dʁol/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lees-TWAR koh-MAHNS doos-MAHN pwee duh-VYEHN treh drol
Sentence_Translation: The story starts gently,then becomes very funny.

Sentence: On regarde un film court après le repas.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ ʁə.ɡaʁd œ̃ film kuʁ a.pʁɛ lə ʁə.pa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ohn ruh-gard uhn feelm koor ah-PREH luh ruh-PAH
Sentence_Translation: We watch a short film after the meal.

Sentence: L'émission commence à neuf heures et demie.
Sentence_IPA: /le.mi.sjɔ̃ kɔ.mɑ̃s a nœv œʁ e də.mi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay-mee-SYOHN koh-MAHNS ah nuv ur ay duh-MEE
Sentence_Translation: The programme starts at half past nine.

Sentence: La chaîne change souvent selon le match.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʃɛn ʃɑ̃ʒ su.vɑ̃ sə.lɔ̃ lə matʃ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah shen shah(n)zh soo-VAHN suh-lohn luh match
Sentence_Translation: The channel changes often depending on the match.

Sentence: Cette série est longue,mais j'aime les personnages.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt se.ʁi ɛ lɔ̃ɡ mɛ ʒɛm le pɛʁ.sɔ.naʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set say-REE eh longg meh zhem lay pair-soh-NAZH
Sentence_Translation: This series is long,but I like the characters.

Sentence: Le match finit tard,on rentre en silence.
Sentence_IPA: /lə matʃ fi.ni taʁ ɔ̃ ʁɑ̃tʁ ɑ̃ si.lɑ̃s/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh match fee-NEE tar ohn rahntr ahn see-LAHNS
Sentence_Translation: The match ends late; we go home quietly.

Sentence: Il marque un but et tout le monde crie.
Sentence_IPA: /il maʁk œ̃ by e tu lə mɔ̃d kʁi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel mark uhn byew ay too luh mohnd kree
Sentence_Translation: He scores a goal and everyone shouts.
