Sentence_Translation: I lose the key then find it outside.

Sentence: La serrure est bloquée donc j'appelle le serrurier.
Sentence_IPA: /la sɛ.ʁyʁ ɛ blɔ.ke dɔ̃k ʒa.pɛl lə sɛ.ʁy.ʁje/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah seh-rewr eh bloh-kay donk zhah-pel luh seh-rew-ryay
Sentence_Translation: The lock is stuck so I call the locksmith.

Sentence: Le serrurier arrive vite et ouvre la porte.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɛ.ʁy.ʁje a.ʁiv vit e uvʁ la pɔʁt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh seh-rew-ryay ah-reev veet ay oovr lah port
Sentence_Translation: The locksmith arrives quickly and opens the door.

Sentence: Je ferme la fenêtre car le bruit entre.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛʁm la fə.nɛtʁ kaʁ lə bʁɥi ɑ̃tʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh fairm lah fuh-netr kar luh bwee ahntr
Sentence_Translation: I close the window because the noise comes in.

Sentence: Je tire le rideau pour avoir plus d'intimité.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə tiʁ lə ʁi.do puʁ a.vwaʁ ply dɛ̃.ti.mi.te/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh teer luh ree-doh poor ah-vwar plew den-tee-mee-tay
Sentence_Translation: I pull the curtain for more privacy.

Sentence: J'aime cette intimité et je coupe la musique.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒɛm sɛt ɛ̃.ti.mi.te e ʒə kup la my.zik/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhem set en-tee-mee-tay ay zhuh koop lah mew-zeek
Sentence_Translation: I like this privacy and I turn off the music.

Sentence: Dans le couloir il fait sombre ce soir.
Sentence_IPA: /dɑ̃ lə ku.lwaʁ il fɛ sɔ̃bʁ sə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: dahn luh koo-lwar eel feh somb-ruh suh swar
Sentence_Translation: In the hallway it is dark tonight.

Sentence: Je descends l'escalier lentement pour ne pas tomber.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə de.sɑ̃ lɛs.ka.lje lɑ̃t.mɑ̃ puʁ nə pa tɔ̃.be/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh day-sahn les-kah-lyay lahnt-mahn poor nuh pah tom-bay
Sentence_Translation: I go down the stairs slowly so I don’t fall.

Sentence: L'ascenseur est en panne donc je prends l'escalier.
Sentence_IPA: /la.sɑ̃.sœʁ ɛ ɑ̃ pan dɔ̃k ʒə pʁɑ̃ lɛs.ka.lje/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-sahn-sir eh ahn pahn donk zhuh prahn les-kah-lyay
Sentence_Translation: The lift is broken so I take the stairs.

Sentence: La panne dure longtemps et tout le monde attend.
Sentence_IPA: /la pan dyʁ lɔ̃.tɑ̃ e tu lə mɔ̃d a.tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah pahn dew(r) lon-tahn ay too luh mond ah-tahn
Sentence_Translation: The breakdown lasts a long time and everyone waits.
Sentence_Breakdown: La(Art)|the|Art|/la/|lah;panne(la)|breakdown|Noun|/pan/|pahn;dure|lasts|Verb|/dyʁ/|dew(r);longtemps|a long time|Adv|/lɔ̃.tɑ̃/|lon-tahn;et|and|Conj|/e/|ay;tout le monde|everyone|Pron|/tu lə mɔ̃d/|too luh mond;attend|waits|Verb|/a.tɑ̃/|ah-tahn

Sentence: La réparation coûte cher mais c'est nécessaire.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁe.pa.ʁa.sjɔ̃ kut ʃɛʁ mɛ sɛ ne.se.sɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ray-pah-rah-syon koot shair meh seh nay-say-sair
Sentence_Translation: The repair is expensive but it’s necessary.

Sentence: Le prix augmente vite et je compare les options.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pʁi oɡ.mɑ̃t vit e ʒə kɔ̃.paʁ le zɔp.sjɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh pree ohg-mahnt veet ay zhuh kon-par lay zop-syon
Sentence_Translation: The price rises quickly and I compare the options.

Sentence: Une option simple suffit pour ce problème.
Sentence_IPA: /yn ɔp.sjɔ̃ sɛ̃pl sy.fi puʁ sə pʁɔ.blɛm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: een op-syon sehnpl sew-fee poor suh proh-blem
Sentence_Translation: A simple option is enough for this problem.

Sentence: Je tiens ma promesse même quand c'est difficile.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə tjɛ̃ ma pʁɔ.mɛs mɛm kɑ̃ sɛ di.fi.sil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh tyehn mah proh-mess mem kahn seh dee-fee-seel
Sentence_Translation: I keep my promise even when it’s hard.

Sentence: Le choix est large donc je prends mon temps.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʃwa ɛ laʁʒ dɔ̃k ʒə pʁɑ̃ mɔ̃ tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh shwah eh larzh donk zhuh prahn mohn tahn
Sentence_Translation: The choice is wide so I take my time.

Sentence: La décision est prise et je n'hésite plus.
Sentence_IPA: /la de.si.zjɔ̃ ɛ pʁiz e ʒə ne.zit ply/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah day-see-zyon eh preez ay zhuh nay-zeet plew
Sentence_Translation: The decision is made and I no longer hesitate.

Sentence: La réunion finit tard et je rentre épuisé.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁe.y.njɔ̃ fi.ni taʁ e ʒə ʁɑ̃tʁ e.pɥi.ze/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ray-ew-nyon fee-nee tar ay zhuh rahntr ay-pwee-zay
Sentence_Translation: The meeting ends late and I go home exhausted.

Sentence: Mon collègue explique bien et tout le monde écoute.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ kɔ.lɛɡ ɛks.plik bjɛ̃ e tu lə mɔ̃d e.kut/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn koh-leg eks-pleek byehn ay too luh mond ay-koo(t)
Sentence_Translation: My colleague explains well and everyone listens.

Sentence: Le patron arrive tôt et demande des résultats.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pa.tʁɔ̃ a.ʁiv to e də.mɑ̃d de ʁe.zyl.ta/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh pah-tron ah-reev toh ay duh-mahnd day ray-zewl-tah
Sentence_Translation: The boss arrives early and asks for results.

Sentence: Mon objectif est clair et je reste motivé.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ nɔb.ʒɛk.tif ɛ klɛʁ e ʒə ʁɛst mɔ.ti.ve/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn nob-zhek-teef eh klair ay zhuh rest moh-tee-vay
Sentence_Translation: My goal is clear and I stay motivated.

Sentence: Le résultat est bon donc je suis content.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʁe.zyl.ta ɛ bɔ̃ dɔ̃k ʒə sɥi kɔ̃.tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh ray-zewl-tah eh bon donk zhuh swee kon-tahn
Sentence_Translation: The result is good so I’m happy.

Sentence: Je suis en retard donc je cours un peu.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə sɥi ɑ̃ ʁə.taʁ dɔ̃k ʒə kuʁ œ̃ pø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh swee ahn ruh-tar donk zhuh koor uhn puh
Sentence_Translation: I’m late so I run a little.

Sentence: L'horloge avance vite et je m'inquiète.
Sentence_IPA: /lɔʁ.lɔʒ a.vɑ̃s vit e ʒə mɛ̃.kjɛt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lor-lozh ah-vahns veet ay zhuh meh(n)-kyet
Sentence_Translation: The clock runs fast and I worry.

Sentence: Attends une minute et je reviens tout de suite.
Sentence_IPA: /a.tɑ̃z yn mi.nyt e ʒə ʁə.vjɛ̃ tu də sɥit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah-tahnz een mee-newt ay zhuh ruh-vyehn too duh sweet
Sentence_Translation: Wait a minute and I’ll be right back.
Sentence_Breakdown: Attends|wait|Verb|/a.tɑ̃/|ah-tahn;une(Art)|a|Art|/yn/|een;minute(la)|minute|Noun|/mi.nyt/|mee-newt;et|and|Conj|/e/|ay;je(Pron)|I|Pron|/ʒə/|zhuh;reviens|come back|Verb|/ʁə.vjɛ̃/|ruh-vyehn;tout de suite|right away|Adv|/tu də sɥit/|too duh sweet

Sentence: Donne-moi une seconde et je termine ça.
Sentence_IPA: /dɔn mwa yn sə.ɡɔ̃d e ʒə tɛʁ.min sa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: don mwah een suh-gond ay zhuh tair-meen sah
Sentence_Translation: Give me a second and I’ll finish this.

Sentence: Il est une heure et je dois partir.
Sentence_IPA: /il ɛ yn œʁ e ʒə dwa paʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel eh een ur ay zhuh dwah par-teer
Sentence_Translation: It’s one o’clock and I have to leave.

Sentence: Le matin je bois du thé avant de sortir.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ma.tɛ̃ ʒə bwa dy te a.vɑ̃ də sɔʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh mah-tehn zhuh bwah dew tay ah-vahn duh sor-teer
Sentence_Translation: In the morning I drink tea before going out.

Sentence: Le soir je ferme tout et je me repose.
Sentence_IPA: /lə swaʁ ʒə fɛʁm tu e ʒə mə ʁə.po/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh swar zhuh fairm too ay zhuh muh ruh-poh
Sentence_Translation: In the evening I close everything and rest.

Sentence: L'après-midi passe vite quand je suis occupé.
Sentence_IPA: /la.pʁɛ mi.di pas vit kɑ̃ ʒə sɥi ɔ.ky.pe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-preh mee-dee pass veet kahn zhuh swee oh-kew-pay
Sentence_Translation: The afternoon goes quickly when I’m busy.

Sentence: Le week-end je dors plus et je cuisine.
Sentence_IPA: /lə wi.kɛnd ʒə dɔʁ ply e ʒə kɥi.zin/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh wee-kend zhuh dor plew ay zhuh kwee-zeen
Sentence_Translation: At the weekend I sleep more and I cook.

Sentence: Le quotidien est lourd mais je m'organise bien.
Sentence_IPA: /lə kɔ.ti.djɛ̃ ɛ luʁ mɛ ʒə mɔʁ.ɡa.niz bjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh koh-tee-dyehn eh loo(r) meh zhuh mor-gah-neez byehn
Sentence_Translation: Daily life is heavy but I organise myself well.

Sentence: J'ai une habitude simple pour rester efficace.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe yn a.bi.tyd sɛ̃pl puʁ ʁɛs.te e.fi.kas/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay een ah-bee-tewd sehnpl poor res-tay ay-fee-kass
Sentence_Translation: I have a simple habit to stay efficient.

Sentence: Je fais un plan clair avant de commencer.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛ œ̃ plɑ̃ klɛʁ a.vɑ̃ də kɔ.mɑ̃.se/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh feh uhn plahn klair ah-vahn duh koh-mahn-say
Sentence_Translation: I make a clear plan before starting.

Sentence: Je prends une étape à la fois sans paniquer.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ yn e.tap a la fwa sɑ̃ pa.ni.ke/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn een ay-tahp ah lah fwah sahn pah-nee-kay
Sentence_Translation: I take one step at a time without panicking.

Sentence: Mon projet avance bien et je garde le cap.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ pʁɔ.ʒɛ a.vɑ̃s bjɛ̃ e ʒə ɡaʁd lə kap/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn proh-zhay ah-vahns byehn ay zhuh gard luh kap
Sentence_Translation: My project moves along well and I stay on course.

Sentence: Le cap est bon et on continue ensemble.
Sentence_IPA: /lə kap ɛ bɔ̃ e ɔ̃ kɔ̃.ti.ny ɑ̃.sɑ̃bl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh kap eh bon ay on kon-tee-new ahn-sahmbl
Sentence_Translation: The direction is good and we keep going together.

Sentence: Un détail change tout et je le remarque.
Sentence_IPA: /œ̃ de.taj ʃɑ̃ʒ tu e ʒə lə ʁə.maʁk/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: uhn day-tie shahnzh too ay zhuh luh ruh-mark
Sentence_Translation: A detail changes everything and I notice it.

Sentence: Une erreur arrive vite si je me presse.
Sentence_IPA: /yn e.ʁœʁ a.ʁiv vit si ʒə mə pʁɛs/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: een ay-rur ah-reev veet see zhuh muh press
Sentence_Translation: A mistake happens quickly if I rush.

Sentence: La solution est simple et elle fonctionne bien.
Sentence_IPA: /la sɔ.ly.sjɔ̃ ɛ sɛ̃pl e ɛl fɔ̃k.sjɔn bjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah soh-lew-syon eh sehnpl ay el fonk-syon byehn
Sentence_Translation: The solution is simple and it works well.

Sentence: J'ai une idée nouvelle et je la note.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe yn i.de nu.vɛl e ʒə la nɔt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay een ee-day noo-vel ay zhuh lah not
Sentence_Translation: I have a new idea and I write it down.

Sentence: Mon conseil est simple et tu peux l'essayer.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ kɔ̃.sɛj ɛ sɛ̃pl e ty pø lɛ.se.je/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn kon-say eh sehnpl ay tew puh less-ay-yay
Sentence_Translation: My advice is simple and you can try it.

Sentence: Je n'ai plus d'argent pour ce billet.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə n‿e ply daʁ.ʒɑ̃ puʁ sə bi.jɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nay plew dar-zhahn poor suh bee-yeh
Sentence_Translation: I have no money left for this ticket.
Elision_Note: ne + ai -> n'ai; de + argent -> d'argent

Sentence: Je vais à la banque pour retirer de l'argent.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ a la bɑ̃k puʁ ʁə.ti.ʁe də laʁ.ʒɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ah lah bahnk poor ruh-tee-ray duh lar-zhahn
Sentence_Translation: I go to the bank to withdraw money.

Sentence: Mon compte est vide alors je fais attention.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ kɔ̃t ɛ vid a.lɔʁ ʒə fɛ a.tɑ̃.sjɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn kont eh veed ah-lor zhuh feh ah-tahn-syon
Sentence_Translation: My account is empty so I’m careful.

Sentence: Je dois payer la facture avant lundi matin.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dwa pe.je la fak.tyʁ a.vɑ̃ lœ̃.di ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh dwah pay-yay lah fak-tewr ah-vahn lun-dee mah-tehn
Sentence_Translation: I must pay the bill before Monday morning.

Sentence: La facture est élevée mais je comprends pourquoi.
Sentence_IPA: /la fak.tyʁ ɛ e.lə.ve mɛ ʒə kɔ̃.pʁɑ̃ puʁ.kwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah fak-tewr eh ay-luh-vay meh zhuh kon-prahn poor-kwah
Sentence_Translation: The bill is high but I understand why.

Sentence: Garde le ticket car on en aura besoin demain.
Sentence_IPA: /ɡaʁd lə ti.kɛ kaʁ ɔ̃ n‿o.ʁa bə.zwɛ̃ də.mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: gard luh tee-kay kar on no-rah buh-zwehn duh-mehn
Sentence_Translation: Keep the receipt because we will need it tomorrow.

Sentence: Le magasin est fermé donc je rentre tôt.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ma.ɡa.zɛ̃ ɛ fɛʁ.me dɔ̃k ʒə ʁɑ̃tʁ to/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh mah-gah-zehn eh fair-may donk zhuh rahntr toh
Sentence_Translation: The shop is closed so I go home early.

Sentence: Je vais acheter du pain et du fromage.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ aʃ.te dy pɛ̃ e dy fʁɔ.maʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ash-tay dew pehn ay dew froh-mazh
Sentence_Translation: I am going to buy bread and cheese.

Sentence: Ma commande arrive demain et j'attends avec impatience.
Sentence_IPA: /ma kɔ.mɑ̃d a.ʁiv də.mɛ̃ e ʒa.tɑ̃ a.vɛk ɛ̃.pa.sjɑ̃s/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah koh-mahnd ah-reev duh-mehn ay zha-tahn ah-vek eh(n)-pah-syahns
Sentence_Translation: My order arrives tomorrow and I’m waiting impatiently.

Sentence: La livraison est en retard mais le chauffeur appelle.
Sentence_IPA: /la li.vʁɛ.zɔ̃ ɛ ɑ̃ ʁə.taʁ mɛ lə ʃo.fœʁ a.pɛl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah lee-vreh-zon eh ahn ruh-tar meh luh shoh-fer ah-pel
Sentence_Translation: The delivery is late but the driver calls.

Sentence: Le chauffeur arrive vite et sonne à la porte.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʃo.fœʁ a.ʁiv vit e sɔn a la pɔʁt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh shoh-fer ah-reev veet ay son ah lah port
Sentence_Translation: The driver arrives quickly and rings the doorbell.

Sentence: Je porte le paquet lourd jusqu'à l'étage.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pɔʁt lə pa.kɛ luʁ ʒys.ka le.taʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh port luh pah-kay loo(r) zhuess-kah lay-tazh
Sentence_Translation: I carry the heavy parcel up to the floor.

Sentence: À l'étage il fait chaud et je ouvre la fenêtre.
Sentence_IPA: /a le.taʒ il fɛ ʃo e ʒə uvʁ la fə.nɛtʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah lay-tazh eel feh shoh ay zhuh oovr lah fuh-netr
Sentence_Translation: Upstairs it is hot and I open the window.

Sentence: L'entrée est simple mais elle plaît à tous.
Sentence_IPA: /lɑ̃.tʁe ɛ sɛ̃pl mɛ ɛl plɛ a tus/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lahn-tray eh sehnpl meh el pleh ah tooss
Sentence_Translation: The starter is simple but everyone likes it.

Sentence: Le plat est prêt et la table est mise.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pla ɛ pʁɛ e la tabl ɛ miz/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh plah eh preh ay lah tabl eh meez
Sentence_Translation: The main dish is ready and the table is set.

Sentence: Le dessert est sucré et je me sers encore.
Sentence_IPA: /lə de.sɛʁ ɛ sy.kʁe e ʒə mə sɛʁ ɑ̃.kɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh day-sair eh sew-kray ay zhuh muh sair ahn-kor
Sentence_Translation: The dessert is sweet and I help myself again.

Sentence: Je lave l'assiette puis je range la cuisine.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə lav la.sjɛt pɥi ʒə ʁɑ̃ʒ la kɥi.zin/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh lav lah-syet pwee zhuh rahnzh lah kwee-zeen
Sentence_Translation: I wash the plate then I tidy the kitchen.

Sentence: Le verre tombe par terre mais il ne casse pas.
Sentence_IPA: /lə vɛʁ tɔ̃b paʁ tɛʁ mɛ il nə kas pa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh vair tomb par tair meh eel nuh kass pah
Sentence_Translation: The glass falls on the floor but it doesn’t break.

Sentence: Je cherche une cuillère propre dans le tiroir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ yn kɥi.jɛʁ pʁɔp dɑ̃ lə ti.ʁwaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh een kwee-yehr prop dahn luh tee-rwar
Sentence_Translation: I look for a clean spoon in the drawer.

Sentence: Le couteau est émoussé donc je fais attention.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ku.to ɛ e.mu.se dɔ̃k ʒə fɛ a.tɑ̃.sjɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh koo-toh eh ay-moo-say donk zhuh feh ah-tahn-syon
Sentence_Translation: The knife is blunt so I’m careful.

Sentence: Je pose la fourchette et je goûte la sauce.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə poz la fuʁ.ʃɛt e ʒə ɡut la sos/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh pohz lah foor-shet ay zhuh goot lah soss
Sentence_Translation: I put down the fork and taste the sauce.

Sentence: Le tiroir coince parfois et ça m'énerve.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ti.ʁwaʁ kwɛ̃s paʁ.fwa e sa me.nɛʁv/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh tee-rwar kwehns par-fwah ay sah may-nairv
Sentence_Translation: The drawer sticks sometimes and it annoys me.

Sentence: Je prends une serviette propre pour essuyer mes mains.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ yn sɛʁ.vjɛt pʁɔp puʁ e.sɥi.je me mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn een sair-vyet prop poor ess-wee-yay may mehn
Sentence_Translation: I take a clean towel to dry my hands.

Sentence: Le savon sent bon et mousse beaucoup.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sa.vɔ̃ sɑ̃ bɔ̃ e mus bo.ku/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sah-von sahn bon ay mooss boh-koo
Sentence_Translation: The soap smells nice and foams a lot.

Sentence: Je n'ai plus de shampooing dans la salle de bain.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə n‿e ply də ʃɑ̃.pwɛ̃ dɑ̃ la sal də bɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh nay plew duh shahn-pwehn dahn lah sahl duh behn
Sentence_Translation: I’ve run out of shampoo in the bathroom.

Sentence: La douche est trop froide alors j'attends un peu.
Sentence_IPA: /la duʃ ɛ tʁo fʁwad a.lɔʁ ʒa.tɑ̃ œ̃ pø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah doosh eh troh frwad ah-lor zhah-tahn uhn puh
Sentence_Translation: The shower is too cold so I wait a bit.

Sentence: Je prends un bain chaud pour me détendre.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃z œ̃ bɛ̃ ʃo puʁ mə de.tɑ̃dʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahnz uhn behn shoh poor muh day-tahn-druh
Sentence_Translation: I take a hot bath to relax.

Sentence: Je vais servir le café après le repas.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ sɛʁ.viʁ lə ka.fe a.pʁɛ lə ʁə.pa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh sair-veer luh kah-fay ah-preh luh ruh-pah
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to serve coffee after the meal.

Sentence: Le repas est terminé et on discute encore.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʁə.pa ɛ tɛʁ.mi.ne e ɔ̃ dis.kyt ɑ̃.kɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh ruh-pah eh tair-mee-nay ay on dees-kewt ahn-kor
Sentence_Translation: The meal is finished and we’re still chatting.

Sentence: La discussion dure longtemps et personne ne part.
Sentence_IPA: /la dis.ky.sjɔ̃ dyʁ lɔ̃.tɑ̃ e pɛʁ.sɔn nə paʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah dees-kew-syon dew(r) lon-tahn ay pair-son nuh par
Sentence_Translation: The discussion lasts a long time and nobody leaves.

Sentence: Sa voix est faible mais je l'entends bien.
Sentence_IPA: /sa vwa ɛ fɛbl mɛ ʒə lɑ̃.tɑ̃ bjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: sah vwah eh febl meh zhuh lahn-tahn byehn
Sentence_Translation: His/her voice is weak but I hear it well.

Sentence: Le bruit continue et je ferme la porte.
Sentence_IPA: /lə bʁɥi kɔ̃.ti.ny e ʒə fɛʁm la pɔʁt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh bwee kon-tee-new ay zhuh fairm lah port
Sentence_Translation: The noise continues and I close the door.

Sentence: Le silence revient enfin et je me détends.
Sentence_IPA: /lə si.lɑ̃s ʁə.vjɛ̃ ɑ̃.fɛ̃ e ʒə mə de.tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh see-lahnss ruh-vyehn ahn-fehn ay zhuh muh day-tahn
Sentence_Translation: Silence finally returns and I relax.

Sentence: Cette phrase est courte mais elle est claire.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt fʁaz ɛ kuʁt mɛ ɛl ɛ klɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set fraz eh koort meh el eh klair
Sentence_Translation: This sentence is short but it’s clear.

Sentence: J'ai une question simple et tu peux répondre.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe yn kɛs.tjɔ̃ sɛ̃pl e ty pø ʁe.pɔ̃dʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay een kess-tyon sehnpl ay tew puh ray-pond-ruh
Sentence_Translation: I have a simple question and you can answer.

Sentence: La réponse est juste et tout le monde sourit.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁe.pɔ̃s ɛ ʒyst e tu lə mɔ̃d su.ʁi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ray-pons eh zhuest ay too luh mond soo-ree
Sentence_Translation: The answer is correct and everyone smiles.

Sentence: Je donne un exemple simple pour expliquer mieux.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dɔn œ̃ nɛɡ.zɑ̃pl sɛ̃pl puʁ ɛks.pli.ke mjø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh don uhn neg-zahmpl sehnpl poor eks-plee-kay myuh
Sentence_Translation: I give a simple example to explain better.

Sentence: La règle est claire mais je la vérifie.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁɛɡl ɛ klɛʁ mɛ ʒə la ve.ʁi.fi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah regl eh klair meh zhuh lah vay-ree-fee
Sentence_Translation: The rule is clear but I check it.

Sentence: Je fais ça de cette façon depuis longtemps.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛ sa də sɛt fa.sɔ̃ də.pɥi lɔ̃.tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh feh sah duh set fah-son duh-pwee lon-tahn
Sentence_Translation: I do it this way for a long time.

Sentence: Tu as raison et je change d'avis maintenant.
Sentence_IPA: /ty a ʁɛ.zɔ̃ e ʒə ʃɑ̃ʒ da.vi mɛ̃.tə.nɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: tew ah ray-zon ay zhuh shahnzh dah-vee mehn-tuh-nahn
Sentence_Translation: You’re right and I change my mind now.

Sentence: Mon avis est différent mais je respecte le tien.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ n‿a.vi ɛ di.fe.ʁɑ̃ mɛ ʒə ʁɛs.pɛkt lə tjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn nah-vee eh dee-fay-rahn meh zhuh res-pekt luh tyehn
Sentence_Translation: My opinion is different but I respect yours.

Sentence: Ce mot a un sens précis dans ce contexte.
Sentence_IPA: /sə mo a œ̃ sɑ̃ pʁe.si dɑ̃ sə kɔ̃.tɛkst/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh moh ah uhn sahnss pray-see dahn suh kon-tekst
Sentence_Translation: This word has a precise meaning in this context.

Sentence: Le contexte est important pour comprendre la phrase.
Sentence_IPA: /lə kɔ̃.tɛkst ɛ ɛ̃.pɔʁ.tɑ̃ puʁ kɔ̃.pʁɑ̃dʁ la fʁaz/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh kon-tekst eh eh(n)-por-tahn poor kon-prahn-druh lah fraz
Sentence_Translation: Context is important to understand the sentence.

Sentence: La vérité est simple mais elle fait mal.
Sentence_IPA: /la ve.ʁi.te ɛ sɛ̃pl mɛ ɛl fɛ mal/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah vay-ree-tay eh sehnpl meh el feh mal
Sentence_Translation: The truth is simple but it hurts.

Sentence: Il garde un secret et il ne dit rien.
Sentence_IPA: /il ɡaʁd œ̃ sə.kʁɛ e il nə di ʁjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel gard uhn suh-kreh ay eel nuh dee ryehn
Sentence_Translation: He keeps a secret and says nothing.

Sentence: Le risque est réel donc je reste prudent.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʁisk ɛ ʁe.ɛl dɔ̃k ʒə ʁɛst pʁy.dɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh reesk eh ray-el donk zhuh rest prew-dahn
Sentence_Translation: The risk is real so I stay cautious.

Sentence: Avec prudence je traverse la rue sans courir.
Sentence_IPA: /a.vɛk pʁy.dɑ̃s ʒə tʁa.vɛʁs la ʁy sɑ̃ ku.ʁiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah-vek prew-dahnss zhuh trah-vers lah rew sahn koo-reer
Sentence_Translation: With caution I cross the street without running.

Sentence: La rue est calme et les voitures passent lentement.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁy ɛ kalm e le vwa.tyʁ pas lɑ̃t.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah rew eh kahlm ay lay vwah-tewr pass lahnt-mahn
Sentence_Translation: The street is quiet and the cars pass slowly.

Sentence: Je marche sur le trottoir et je regarde devant.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə maʁʃ syʁ lə tʁɔ.twaʁ e ʒə ʁə.ɡaʁd də.vɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh marsh sewr luh troh-twar ay zhuh ruh-gard duh-vahn
Sentence_Translation: I walk on the pavement and look ahead.

Sentence: Au carrefour je m'arrête et je laisse passer.
Sentence_IPA: /o kaʁ.fuʁ ʒə ma.ʁɛt e ʒə lɛs pa.se/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: oh kar-foor zhuh mah-ret ay zhuh less pah-say
Sentence_Translation: At the junction I stop and let people pass.
Elision_Note: à + le -> au; je + arrête -> m'arrête

Sentence: Le feu passe au vert et je traverse.
Sentence_IPA: /lə fø pas o vɛʁ e ʒə tʁa.vɛʁs/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh fuh pass oh vair ay zhuh trah-vers
Sentence_Translation: The light turns green and I cross.

Sentence: Le piéton regarde des deux côtés avant.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pje.tɔ̃ ʁə.ɡaʁd de dø ko.te a.vɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh pyeh-ton ruh-gard day duh koh-tay ah-vahn
Sentence_Translation: The pedestrian looks both ways first.

Sentence: Je cherche le passage piéton près d'ici.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ lə pa.saʒ pje.tɔ̃ pʁɛ di.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh luh pah-sazh pyeh-ton preh dee-see
Sentence_Translation: I’m looking for the pedestrian crossing nearby.

Sentence: Le panneau indique la sortie vers le centre.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pa.no ɛ̃.dik la sɔʁ.ti vɛʁ lə sɑ̃tʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh pah-noh an-deek lah sor-tee vair luh sahntr
Sentence_Translation: The sign shows the exit towards the centre.

Sentence: Je prends la direction du nord sans hésiter.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ la di.ʁɛk.sjɔ̃ dy nɔʁ sɑ̃ e.zi.te/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn lah dee-rek-syon dew nor sahn ay-zee-tay
Sentence_Translation: I head north without hesitating.

Sentence: À l'arrêt je consulte l'horaire sur mon téléphone.
Sentence_IPA: /a la.ʁɛ ʒə kɔ̃.sylt lɔ.ʁɛʁ syʁ mɔ̃ te.le.fɔn/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah lah-reh zhuh kon-sewlt loh-rair sewr mohn tay-lay-fon
Sentence_Translation: At the stop I check the timetable on my phone.
Elision_Note: à + l' -> à l'; le + horaire -> l'

Sentence: La station est proche mais je marche encore.
Sentence_IPA: /la sta.sjɔ̃ ɛ pʁɔʃ mɛ ʒə maʁʃ ɑ̃.kɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah stah-syon eh prosh meh zhuh marsh ahn-kor
Sentence_Translation: The station is near but I keep walking.

Sentence: Sur le quai,les gens attendent en silence.
Sentence_IPA: /syʁ lə kɛ le ʒɑ̃ a.tɑ̃t ɑ̃ si.lɑ̃s/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: sewr luh keh lay zhahn ah-tahnt ahn see-lahnss
Sentence_Translation: On the platform,people wait in silence.

Sentence: Je prends le métro quand il pleut dehors.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ lə me.tʁo kɑ̃ il plø də.ɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn luh may-troh kahn eel pluh duh-or
Sentence_Translation: I take the underground when it rains outside.

Sentence: Je fais une correspondance rapide pour aller au travail.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛ yn kɔ.ʁɛs.pɔ̃.dɑ̃s ʁa.pid puʁ a.le o tʁa.vaj/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh feh een koh-res-pon-dahnss rah-peed poor ah-lay oh trah-vye
Sentence_Translation: I make a quick transfer to get to work.

Sentence: Le retour est long mais je lis un livre.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʁə.tuʁ ɛ lɔ̃ mɛ ʒə li zœ̃ livʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh ruh-toor eh lon meh zhuh lee zun leevr
Sentence_Translation: The journey back is long but I read a book.

Sentence: Ce livre est intéressant et je le finis vite.
Sentence_IPA: /sə livʁ ɛ ɛ̃.te.ʁe.sɑ̃ e ʒə lə fi.ni vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh leevr eh an-tay-ray-sahn ay zhuh luh fee-nee veet
Sentence_Translation: This book is interesting and I finish it quickly.

Sentence: Je tourne la page et je continue sans pause.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə tuʁn la paʒ e ʒə kɔ̃.ti.ny sɑ̃ poz/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh toorn lah pazh ay zhuh kon-tee-new sahn pohz
Sentence_Translation: I turn the page and keep going without a break.

Sentence: Le titre est drôle et attire mon attention.
Sentence_IPA: /lə titʁ ɛ dʁol e a.tiʁ mɔ̃ na.tɑ̃.sjɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh teetr eh drol ay ah-teer mohn ah-tahn-syon
Sentence_Translation: The title is funny and catches my attention.

Sentence: Je connais l'auteur et j'aime son style.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə kɔ.nɛ lo.tœʁ e ʒɛm sɔ̃ stil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh koh-neh loh-ter ay zhem son steel
Sentence_Translation: I know the author and I like his style.

Sentence: Son style est simple mais très efficace.
Sentence_IPA: /sɔ̃ stil ɛ sɛ̃pl mɛ tʁɛ z‿e.fi.kas/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: son steel eh sehnpl meh treh zay-fee-kass
Sentence_Translation: très + efficace (liaison z),His style is simple but very effective.

Sentence: Ce film est trop long mais la fin surprend.
Sentence_IPA: /sə film ɛ tʁo lɔ̃ mɛ la fɛ̃ syʁ.pʁɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh feelm eh troh lon meh lah fehn sewr-prahn
Sentence_Translation: This film is too long but the ending surprises.

Sentence: L'actrice parle doucement et le public écoute bien.
Sentence_IPA: /lak.tʁis paʁl dus.mɑ̃ e lə py.blik e.kut bjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lahk-trees parl doos-mahn ay luh pew-bleek ay-koo(t) byehn
Sentence_Translation: The actress speaks softly and the audience listens well.

Sentence: Le public applaudit fort après la dernière scène.
Sentence_IPA: /lə py.blik a.plo.di fɔʁ a.pʁɛ la dɛʁ.njɛʁ sɛn/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh pew-bleek ah-ploh-dee for ah-preh lah dair-nyehr sen
Sentence_Translation: The audience applauds loudly after the last scene.

Sentence: Cette scène est émouvante et je reste silencieux.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt sɛn ɛ e.mu.vɑ̃t e ʒə ʁɛst si.lɑ̃.sjø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set sen eh ay-moo-vahnt ay zhuh rest see-lahn-syuh
Sentence_Translation: This scene is moving and I stay silent.

Sentence: Je lis le journal dans le train chaque matin.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə li lə ʒuʁ.nal dɑ̃ lə tʁɛ̃ ʃak ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh lee luh zhoor-nal dahn luh trehn shak mah-tehn
Sentence_Translation: I read the newspaper on the train every morning.

Sentence: Les nouvelles sont mauvaises mais on garde espoir.
Sentence_IPA: /le nu.vɛl sɔ̃ mo.vɛz mɛ ɔ̃ ɡaʁd ɛs.pwaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay noo-vel sohn moh-vez meh on gard ess-pwar
Sentence_Translation: The news is bad but we keep hope.

Sentence: J'allume la radio quand je prépare le dîner.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒa.lym la ʁa.djo kɑ̃ ʒə pʁe.paʁ lə di.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhal-lewm lah rah-dyoh kahn zhuh pray-par luh dee-nay
Sentence_Translation: I turn on the radio when I make dinner.

Sentence: Cette chaîne passe des chansons anciennes le soir.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt ʃɛn pas de ʃɑ̃.sɔ̃ zɑ̃.sjɛn lə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set shen pass day shahn-son zahn-syen luh swar
Sentence_Translation: This channel plays old songs in the evening.

Sentence: L'émission commence à huit heures et finit tard.
Sentence_IPA: /le.mi.sjɔ̃ kɔ.mɑ̃s a ɥit‿œʁ e fi.ni taʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay-mee-syon koh-mahns ah weet ur ay fee-nee tar
Sentence_Translation: The programme starts at eight and ends late.

Sentence: Je reçois ton message et je réponds plus tard.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʁə.swa tɔ̃ me.saʒ e ʒə ʁe.pɔ̃ ply taʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh ruh-swah ton may-sazh ay zhuh ray-pon plew tar
Sentence_Translation: I get your message and I reply later.

Sentence: La notification apparaît et je regarde mon téléphone.
Sentence_IPA: /la nɔ.ti.fi.ka.sjɔ̃ a.pa.ʁɛ e ʒə ʁə.ɡaʁd mɔ̃ te.le.fɔn/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah no-tee-fee-kah-syon ah-pah-reh ay zhuh ruh-gard mohn tay-lay-fon
Sentence_Translation: The notification appears and I check my phone.

Sentence: La batterie est presque vide et je cherche une prise.
Sentence_IPA: /la ba.tʁi ɛ pʁɛsk vid e ʒə ʃɛʁʃ yn pʁiz/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah bah-tree eh presk veed ay zhuh shairsh een preez
Sentence_Translation: The battery is nearly empty and I look for a socket.

Sentence: J'ai oublié le chargeur donc je partage le mien.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe u.bli.je lə ʃaʁ.ʒœʁ dɔ̃k ʒə paʁ.taʒ lə mjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay oo-blee-yay luh shar-zhur donk zhuh par-tazh luh myehn
Sentence_Translation: I forgot the charger so I share mine.

Sentence: L'écran est trop lumineux et je baisse la luminosité.
Sentence_IPA: /le.kʁɑ̃ ɛ tʁo ly.mi.nø e ʒə bɛs la ly.mi.no.zi.te/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay-krahn eh troh lew-mee-nuh ay zhuh bess lah lew-mee-noh-zee-tay
Sentence_Translation: The screen is too bright and I lower the brightness.

Sentence: La luminosité change et mes yeux se reposent.
Sentence_IPA: /la ly.mi.no.zi.te ʃɑ̃ʒ e me zjø sə ʁə.poz/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah lew-mee-noh-zee-tay shahnzh ay may zyuh suh ruh-pohz
Sentence_Translation: The brightness changes and my eyes rest.

Sentence: Mes yeux piquent un peu après l'écran.
Sentence_IPA: /me zjø pik œ̃ pø a.pʁɛ le.kʁɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: may zyuh peek uhn puh ah-preh lay-krahn
Sentence_Translation: My eyes sting a bit after the screen.

Sentence: Je cherche mes lunettes car je vois mal.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ me ly.nɛt kaʁ ʒə vwa mal/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh may lew-net kar zhuh vwah mahl
Sentence_Translation: I look for my glasses because I see badly.

Sentence: Mon oreille me fait mal quand je bâille.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ nɔ.ʁɛj mə fɛ mal kɑ̃ ʒə baj/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn noh-ray muh feh mahl kahn zhuh bye
Sentence_Translation: My ear hurts when I yawn.

Sentence: J'ai le nez bouché et je parle bizarrement.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe lə ne bu.ʃe e ʒə paʁl bi.zaʁ.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay luh nay boo-shay ay zhuh parl bee-zar-mahn
Sentence_Translation: I have a blocked nose and I speak oddly.

Sentence: Je ferme la bouche pour écouter mieux.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛʁm la buʃ puʁ e.ku.te mjø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh fairm lah boosh poor ay-koo-tay myuh
Sentence_Translation: I close my mouth to listen better.

Sentence: J'ai mal à une dent depuis hier soir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe mal a yn dɑ̃ də.pɥi jɛʁ swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay mahl ah een dahn duh-pwee yair swar
Sentence_Translation: I have toothache since last night.

Sentence: Je me coupe le doigt en faisant la cuisine.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə mə kup lə dwa ɑ̃ fɛ.zɑ̃ la kɥi.zin/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh muh koop luh dwah ahn feh-zahn lah kwee-zeen
Sentence_Translation: I cut my finger while cooking.

Sentence: Je me lave les mains avant de manger.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə mə lav le mɛ̃ a.vɑ̃ də mɑ̃.ʒe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh muh lav lay mehn ah-vahn duh mahn-zhay
Sentence_Translation: I wash my hands before eating.

Sentence: Mon pied glisse et je tombe presque.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ pje ɡlis e ʒə tɔ̃b pʁɛsk/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn pyeh gleess ay zhuh tomb presk
Sentence_Translation: My foot slips and I almost fall.

Sentence: Mon genou craque parfois quand je monte l'escalier.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ ʒə.nu kʁak paʁ.fwa kɑ̃ ʒə mɔ̃t le.ska.lje/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn zhuh-noo krak par-fwah kahn zhuh mont lay-skah-lyay
Sentence_Translation: My knee clicks sometimes when I go upstairs.

Sentence: Mon épaule est raide après une longue journée.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ n‿e.pol ɛ ʁɛd a.pʁɛ yn lɔ̃ɡ ʒuʁ.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn nay-pohl eh red ah-preh een long zhoor-nay
Sentence_Translation: My shoulder is stiff after a long day.

Sentence: J'ai mal au dos et je m'étire doucement.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe mal o do e ʒə me.tiʁ dus.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay mahl oh doh ay zhuh may-teer doos-mahn
Sentence_Translation: I have back pain and I stretch gently.
Elision_Note: à + le -> au; je + étire -> m'étire

Sentence: Mon cou est tendu alors je bouge lentement.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ ku ɛ tɑ̃.dy a.lɔʁ ʒə buʒ lɑ̃t.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn koo eh tahn-dew ah-lor zhuh boozh lahnt-mahn
Sentence_Translation: My neck is tense so I move slowly.

Sentence: Ma peau est sèche donc je mets de la crème.
Sentence_IPA: /ma po ɛ sɛʃ dɔ̃k ʒə mɛ də la kʁɛm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah poh eh sesh donk zhuh meh duh lah krem
Sentence_Translation: My skin is dry so I put on some cream.

Sentence: Cette crème sent bon et pénètre vite.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt kʁɛm sɑ̃ bɔ̃ e pe.nɛtʁ vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set krem sahn bon ay pay-netr veet
Sentence_Translation: This cream smells nice and absorbs quickly.

Sentence: J'ai un cheveu sur la veste,c'est agaçant.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe œ̃ ʃə.vø syʁ la vɛst sɛ ta.ɡa.sɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay uhn shuh-vuh sewr lah vest seh tah-gah-sahn
Sentence_Translation: I’ve got a hair on my jacket,it’s annoying.

Sentence: Je mets ma veste car il fait frais dehors.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə mɛ ma vɛst kaʁ il fɛ fʁɛ də.ɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh meh mah vest kar eel feh freh duh-or
Sentence_Translation: I put on my jacket because it’s cool outside.

Sentence: Mon manteau est lourd mais il tient chaud.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ mɑ̃.to ɛ luʁ mɛ il tjɛ̃ ʃo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn mahn-toh eh loo(r) meh eel tyehn shoh
Sentence_Translation: My coat is heavy but it keeps me warm.

Sentence: Je prends une écharpe car le vent souffle fort.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ yn e.ʃaʁp kaʁ lə vɑ̃ sufl fɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn een ay-sharp kar luh vahn soofl for
Sentence_Translation: I take a scarf because the wind blows hard.

Sentence: Le vent se lève et la pluie arrive.
Sentence_IPA: /lə vɑ̃ sə lɛv e la plɥi a.ʁiv/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh vahn suh lev ay lah plwee ah-reev
Sentence_Translation: The wind picks up and the rain arrives.

Sentence: La pluie tombe fort et je prends un parapluie.
Sentence_IPA: /la plɥi tɔ̃b fɔʁ e ʒə pʁɑ̃z œ̃ pa.ʁa.plɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah plwee tomb for ay zhuh prahnz uhn pah-rah-plwee
Sentence_Translation: The rain falls hard and I take an umbrella.

Sentence: Mon parapluie se retourne avec ce vent.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ pa.ʁa.plɥi sə ʁə.tuʁn a.vɛk sə vɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn pah-rah-plwee suh ruh-toorn ah-vek suh vahn
Sentence_Translation: My umbrella turns inside out with this wind.

Sentence: Les nuages sont gris et le ciel change.
Sentence_IPA: /le nɥaʒ sɔ̃ ɡʁi e lə sjɛl ʃɑ̃ʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay new-azh sohn gree ay luh syel shahnzh
Sentence_Translation: The clouds are grey and the sky changes.

Sentence: La température baisse et je ferme les fenêtres.
Sentence_IPA: /la tɑ̃.pe.ʁa.tyʁ bɛs e ʒə fɛʁm le fə.nɛtʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah tahn-pay-rah-tewr bess ay zhuh fairm lay fuh-netr
Sentence_Translation: The temperature drops and I close the windows.

Sentence: Le soleil revient et tout le monde sort.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɔ.lɛj ʁə.vjɛ̃ e tu lə mɔ̃d sɔʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh soh-lay ruh-vyehn ay too luh mond sor
Sentence_Translation: The sun comes back and everyone goes out.

Sentence: Je cherche l'ombre car il fait trop chaud.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ lɔ̃bʁ kaʁ il fɛ tʁo ʃo/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh lohm-bruh kar eel feh troh shoh
Sentence_Translation: I look for shade because it’s too hot.

Sentence: Je mange une glace et je me sens mieux.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə mɑ̃ʒ yn ɡlas e ʒə mə sɑ̃ mjø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh mahnzh een glass ay zhuh muh sahn myuh
Sentence_Translation: I eat an ice cream and I feel better.

Sentence: La neige tombe doucement et la rue devient blanche.
Sentence_IPA: /la nɛʒ tɔ̃b dus.mɑ̃ e la ʁy də.vjɛ̃ blɑ̃ʃ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah nezh tomb doos-mahn ay lah rew duh-vyehn blahnsh
Sentence_Translation: Snow falls softly and the street turns white.

Sentence: Un orage éclate et j'éteins la lumière.
Sentence_IPA: /œ̃ nɔ.ʁaʒ e.klat e ʒe.tɛ̃ la ly.mjɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: uhn noh-razh ay-klat ay zhay-tehn lah lew-myehr
Sentence_Translation: A storm breaks out and I switch off the light.
Elision_Note: un + orage (liaison n); je + éteins -> j'éteins

Sentence: Un éclair illumine la rue et tout le monde sursaute.
Sentence_IPA: /œ̃ n‿e.klɛʁ i.ly.min la ʁy e tu lə mɔ̃d syʁ.sot/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: uhn nay-klair ee-lew-meen lah rew ay too luh mond sewr-soht
Sentence_Translation: A flash of lightning lights the street and everyone jumps.

Sentence: Le tonnerre gronde loin et je ferme les volets.
Sentence_IPA: /lə tɔ.nɛʁ ɡʁɔ̃d lwɛ̃ e ʒə fɛʁm le vɔ.lɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh toh-nairv grond lwehn ay zhuh fairm lay voh-lay
Sentence_Translation: Thunder rumbles far away and I shut the shutters.

Sentence: Le volet claque et je le bloque bien.
Sentence_IPA: /lə vɔ.lɛ klak e ʒə lə blɔk bjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh voh-lay klak ay zhuh luh blok byehn
Sentence_Translation: The shutter bangs and I secure it well.

Sentence: Je garde la clé dans ma poche toute la journée.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ɡaʁd la kle dɑ̃ ma pɔʃ tut la ʒuʁ.ne/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh gard lah klay dahn mah posh toot lah zhoor-nay
Sentence_Translation: I keep the key in my pocket all day.

Sentence: La serrure bloque et je cherche une autre clé.
Sentence_IPA: /la sɛ.ʁyʁ blɔk e ʒə ʃɛʁʃ yn otʁ kle/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah seh-rewr blok ay zhuh shairsh een oh-truh klay
Sentence_Translation: The lock jams and I look for another key.

Sentence: Je descends l'escalier doucement pour ne pas tomber.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə de.sɑ̃ le.ska.lje dus.mɑ̃ puʁ nə pa tɔ̃.be/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh day-sahn lay-skah-lyay doos-mahn poor nuh pah tom-bay
Sentence_Translation: I go down the stairs carefully so I don’t fall.

Sentence: L'ascenseur est en panne donc je prends l'escalier.
Sentence_IPA: /la.sɑ̃.sœʁ ɛ ɑ̃ pan dɔ̃k ʒə pʁɑ̃ le.ska.lje/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-sahn-seur eh ahn pahn donk zhuh prahn lay-skah-lyay
Sentence_Translation: The lift is broken so I take the stairs.

Sentence: Il y a une panne et personne ne sait pourquoi.
Sentence_IPA: /il j a yn pan e pɛʁ.sɔn nə sɛ puʁ.kwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel y ah een pahn ay pair-son nuh seh poor-kwah
Sentence_Translation: There is a breakdown and nobody knows why.

Sentence: Mon quartier est tranquille et les voisins se saluent.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ kaʁ.tje ɛ tʁɑ̃.kil e le vwa.zɛ̃ sə sa.ly/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn kar-tyay eh trahn-keel ay lay vwah-zehn suh sah-lew
Sentence_Translation: My neighbourhood is quiet and neighbours greet each other.

Sentence: Mon voisin aide souvent et il est très poli.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ vwa.zɛ̃ ɛd su.vɑ̃ e il ɛ tʁɛ pɔ.li/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn vwah-zehn ed soo-vahn ay eel eh treh poh-lee
Sentence_Translation: My neighbour often helps and he is very polite.

Sentence: Ma voisine cuisine bien et elle partage des gâteaux.
Sentence_IPA: /ma vwa.zin kɥi.zin bjɛ̃ e ɛl paʁ.taʒ de ɡa.to/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah vwah-zeen kwee-zeen byehn ay el par-tazh day gah-toh
Sentence_Translation: My neighbour cooks well and shares cakes.

Sentence: L'immeuble est ancien mais l'entrée est propre.
Sentence_IPA: /li.mœbl ɛ ɑ̃.sjɛ̃ mɛ lɑ̃.tʁe ɛ pʁɔp/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lee-muhbl eh ahn-syen meh lahn-tray eh prop
Sentence_Translation: The block is old but the entrance is clean.

Sentence: Mon appartement est petit mais très lumineux le matin.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ n‿a.paʁ.tə.mɑ̃ ɛ pə.ti mɛ tʁɛ ly.mi.nø lə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn nah-par-tuh-mahn eh puh-tee meh treh lew-mee-nuh luh mah-tehn
Sentence_Translation: My flat is small but very bright in the morning.

Sentence: Le propriétaire répond rarement aux messages importants.
Sentence_IPA: /lə pʁɔ.pʁi.je.tɛʁ ʁe.pɔ̃ ʁaʁ.mɑ̃ o me.saʒ ɛ̃.pɔʁ.tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh proh-pree-yay-tair ray-pon rahr-mahn oh may-sazh eh(n)-por-tahn
Sentence_Translation: The landlord rarely answers important messages.

Sentence: Le loyer augmente encore et ça m'inquiète.
Sentence_IPA: /lə lwa.je oɡ.mɑ̃t ɑ̃.kɔʁ e sa m‿ɛ̃.kjɛt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh lwah-yay ohg-mahnt ahn-kor ay sah mehn-kyeht
Sentence_Translation: Rent goes up again and it worries me.

Sentence: Je relis le contrat avant de signer demain.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʁə.li lə kɔ̃.tʁa a.vɑ̃ də si.ɲe də.mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh ruh-lee luh kon-trah ah-vahn duh seen-yeh duh-mehn
Sentence_Translation: I reread the contract before signing tomorrow.

Sentence: Ma signature est la même sur tous les documents.
Sentence_IPA: /ma si.ɲa.tyʁ ɛ la mɛm syʁ tus le dɔ.ky.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah seen-yah-tewr eh lah mem sewr tooss lay doh-kew-mahn
Sentence_Translation: My signature is the same on all documents.

Sentence: Ce document manque d'informations et je dois appeler.
Sentence_IPA: /sə dɔ.ky.mɑ̃ mɑ̃k d‿ɛ̃.fɔʁ.ma.sjɔ̃ e ʒə dwa a.pə.le/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh doh-kew-mahn mah(n)k dahn-for-ma-syon ay zhuh dwah ah-puh-lay
Sentence_Translation: This document lacks information and I have to call.

Sentence: Je range le dossier dans un tiroir fermé.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʁɑ̃ʒ lə dɔ.sje dɑ̃z œ̃ ti.ʁwaʁ fɛʁ.me/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh rahnzh luh doh-syay dahnz uhn tee-rwar fair-may
Sentence_Translation: I put the file away in a closed drawer.

Sentence: La réunion commence bientôt et j'arrive en avance.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁe.y.njɔ̃ kɔ.mɑ̃s bjɛ̃.to e ʒa.ʁiv ɑ̃ na.vɑ̃s/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ray-ew-nyon koh-mahns byehn-toh ay zhah-reev ahn nah-vahnss
Sentence_Translation: The meeting starts soon and I arrive early.

Sentence: Je note tout dans l'agenda pour ne rien oublier.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə nɔt tu dɑ̃ la.ʒɑ̃.da puʁ nə ʁjɛ̃ u.bli.je/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh not too dahn lah-zhahn-dah poor nuh ryehn oo-blee-yay
Sentence_Translation: I write everything in my diary so I forget nothing.

Sentence: Mon objectif est simple et je travaille chaque jour.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ n‿ɔb.ʒɛk.tif ɛ sɛ̃pl e ʒə tʁa.vaj ʃak ʒuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mohn nob-zhek-teef eh sehnpl ay zhuh trah-vye shak zhoor
Sentence_Translation: My goal is simple and I work every day.

Sentence: Je vois du progrès et ça me motive beaucoup.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vwa dy pʁɔ.ɡʁɛ e sa mə mɔ.tiv bo.ku/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh vwah dew proh-grey ay sah muh moh-teev boh-koo
Sentence_Translation: I see progress and it motivates me a lot.

Sentence: L'effort est dur au début mais ça paie.
Sentence_IPA: /le.fɔʁ ɛ dyʁ o de.by mɛ sa pɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay-for eh dew(r) oh day-bew meh sah peh
Sentence_Translation: Effort is hard at first but it pays.

Sentence: Je fais une erreur et je la corrige vite.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛ yn e.ʁœʁ e ʒə la kɔ.ʁiʒ vit/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh feh een ay-reur ay zhuh lah koh-reezh veet
Sentence_Translation: I make a mistake and correct it quickly.

Sentence: Le succès arrive parfois quand on persévère longtemps.
Sentence_IPA: /lə syk.sɛ a.ʁiv paʁ.fwa kɑ̃ ɔ̃ pɛʁ.se.vɛʁ lɔ̃.tɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sewk-seh ah-reev par-fwah kahn on pair-say-vair lon-tahn
Sentence_Translation: Success sometimes comes when you persevere for a long time.

Sentence: Après un échec,je recommence avec plus de calme.
Sentence_IPA: /a.pʁɛ œ̃ n‿e.ʃɛk ʒə ʁə.kɔ.mɑ̃s a.vɛk ply də kalm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: ah-preh uhn nay-shek zhuh ruh-koh-mahns ah-vek plew duh kahlm
Sentence_Translation: After a failure,I start again more calmly.

Sentence: Le calme revient et je pense plus clairement.
Sentence_IPA: /lə kalm ʁə.vjɛ̃ e ʒə pɑ̃s ply klɛʁ.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh kahlm ruh-vyehn ay zhuh pahnss plew klair-mahn
Sentence_Translation: Calm returns and I think more clearly.

Sentence: J'ai confiance en toi et je te suis.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe kɔ̃.fjɑ̃s ɑ̃ twa e ʒə tə sɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay kon-fyahnss ahn twah ay zhuh tuh swee
Sentence_Translation: I trust you and I follow you.

Sentence: J'ai peur du noir mais je continue.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe pœʁ dy nwaʁ mɛ ʒə kɔ̃.ti.ny/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay pur dew nwar meh zhuh kon-tee-new
Sentence_Translation: I’m afraid of the dark but I carry on.

Sentence: La joie est simple quand on partage un repas.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʒwa ɛ sɛ̃pl kɑ̃ ɔ̃ paʁ.taʒ œ̃ ʁə.pa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah zhwa eh sehnpl kahn on par-tazh uhn ruh-pah
Sentence_Translation: Joy is simple when you share a meal.

Sentence: La tristesse passe parfois après une bonne nuit.
Sentence_IPA: /la tʁis.tɛs pas paʁ.fwa a.pʁɛ yn bɔn nɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah trees-tess pass par-fwah ah-preh een bon nwee
Sentence_Translation: Sadness sometimes passes after a good night.

Sentence: Le bonheur dépend souvent des petites choses du quotidien.
Sentence_IPA: /lə bɔ.nœʁ de.pɑ̃ su.vɑ̃ de pə.tit ʃoz dy kɔ.ti.djɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh bon-ur day-pahn soo-vahn day puh-teet shoz dew koh-tee-dyehn
Sentence_Translation: Happiness often depends on the small everyday things.

Sentence: Le quotidien est chargé mais je garde une routine.
Sentence_IPA: /lə kɔ.ti.djɛ̃ ɛ ʃaʁ.ʒe mɛ ʒə ɡaʁd yn ʁu.tin/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh koh-tee-dyehn eh shar-zhay meh zhuh gard een roo-teen
Sentence_Translation: Daily life is busy but I keep a routine.

Sentence: Ma routine du matin m'aide à rester calme.
Sentence_IPA: /ma ʁu.tin dy ma.tɛ̃ m‿ɛd a ʁɛs.te kalm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah roo-teen dew mah-tehn med ah res-tay kahlm
Sentence_Translation: My morning routine helps me stay calm.

Sentence: J'ai une habitude étrange mais elle me rassure.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe yn a.bi.tyd etʁɑ̃ʒ mɛ ɛl mə ʁa.syʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay een ah-bee-tewd ay-trahnzh meh el muh rah-sewr
Sentence_Translation: I have a strange habit but it reassures me.

Sentence: Donne-moi une minute et je termine ce message.
Sentence_IPA: /dɔn mwa yn mi.nyt e ʒə tɛʁ.min sə me.saʒ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: don mwah een mee-newt ay zhuh tair-meen suh may-sazh

Sentence: J'ai besoin d'air frais après cette journée.

Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah tash par ahn-fehn ah-preh duh lah-vazh

Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh shahn-pwehn mooss boh-koo ay sah peek uhn puh

Sentence: Je prends une serviette et je sèche mes cheveux.

Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh prahn lah bross ay zhuh kwaf may shuh-vuh

Sentence: Mon objectif est simple.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ n‿ɔb.ʒɛk.tif ɛ sɛ̃.pl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mon nob-zhek-teef ay san-pl
Sentence_Translation: My goal is simple.

Sentence: Le délai est trop court.
Sentence_IPA: /lə de.lɛ ɛ tʁo kuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh day-lay ay troh koor
Sentence_Translation: The deadline is too short.

Sentence: C'est une priorité pour moi.
Sentence_IPA: /s‿ɛt yn pʁi.jɔ.ʁi.te puʁ mwa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set oon pree-yoh-ree-tay poor mwah
Sentence_Translation: It’s a priority for me.

Sentence: Ma disponibilité change chaque semaine.
Sentence_IPA: /ma dis.pɔ.ni.bi.li.te ʃɑ̃ʒ ʃak sə.mɛn/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah dees-poh-nee-bee-lee-tay shanzh shak suh-men
Sentence_Translation: My availability changes each week.

Sentence: J'ai un rendez-vous à midi.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe ɛ̃ ʁɑ̃.de.vu a mi.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay an rahn-day-voo ah mee-dee
Sentence_Translation: I have an appointment at noon.

Sentence: Le médecin m'a donné une ordonnance.
Sentence_IPA: /lə med.sɛ̃ m‿a dɔ.ne yn ɔʁ.dɔ.nɑ̃s/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh med-san mah doh-nay oon or-doh-nans
Sentence_Translation: The doctor gave me a prescription.

Sentence: La pharmacie ferme à vingt heures.
Sentence_IPA: /la faʁ.ma.si fɛʁm a vɛ̃t œʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah far-ma-see ferm ah van tur
Sentence_Translation: The pharmacy closes at eight pm.

Sentence: Ce médicament me fatigue.
Sentence_IPA: /sə me.di.ka.mɑ̃ mə fa.tig/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: suh may-dee-kah-man muh fah-teeg
Sentence_Translation: This medicine makes me tired.

Sentence: J'ai une allergie au pollen.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe yn a.lɛʁ.ʒi o pɔ.lɛn/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay oon ah-lair-zhee oh poh-len
Sentence_Translation: I have an allergy to pollen.

Sentence: Il a de la fièvre depuis hier.
Sentence_IPA: /il a də la fjɛvʁ də.pɥi jɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel ah duh lah fyayv depwee yair
Sentence_Translation: He has had a fever since yesterday.

Sentence: Cette toux ne passe pas.
Sentence_IPA: /sɛt tu nə pas pa/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set too nu pass pah
Sentence_Translation: This cough won’t go away.

Sentence: J'ai attrapé un rhume.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe a.tʁa.pe ɛ̃ ʁym/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay ah-trah-pay an rym
Sentence_Translation: I caught a cold.

Sentence: La douleur revient le soir.
Sentence_IPA: /la du.lœʁ ʁə.vjɛ̃ lə swaʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah doo-ler ruh-vyan luh swahr
Sentence_Translation: The pain comes back in the evening.

Sentence: Ma blessure guérit lentement.
Sentence_IPA: /ma blɛ.syʁ ge.ʁi lɑ̃.tə.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mah bleh-syur gay-ree lahn-tuh-man
Sentence_Translation: My injury is healing slowly.

Sentence: Je change le pansement tous les jours.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɑ̃ʒ lə pɑ̃s.mɑ̃ tu le ʒuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shanzh luh pans-man too lay zhoor
Sentence_Translation: I change the dressing every day.

Sentence: C'est une urgence médicale.
Sentence_IPA: /s‿ɛt yn yʁ.ʒɑ̃s me.di.kal/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set oon ur-zhans may-dee-kal
Sentence_Translation: It’s a medical emergency.

Sentence: J'appelle l'assistance technique.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒ‿a.pɛl l‿a.sis.tɑ̃s tɛk.nik/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhah-pell lah-sees-tans tek-neek
Sentence_Translation: I’m calling technical support.
Elision_Note: je + appelle -> j'appelle; la + assistance -> l'assistance

Sentence: Le service client répond rapidement.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɛʁ.vis kljɑ̃ ʁe.pɔ̃ ʁa.pid.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sair-veess klee-an ray-pon rah-peed-man
Sentence_Translation: Customer service responds quickly.

Sentence: Mon dossier médical est à jour.
Sentence_IPA: /mɔ̃ dɔ.sje me.di.kal ɛ a ʒuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mon doh-syay may-dee-kal ay ah zhoor
Sentence_Translation: My medical record is up to date.

Sentence: Je fais la démarche en ligne.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛ la de.maʁʃ ɑ̃ liɲ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh feh lah day-marsh an leen
Sentence_Translation: I do the procedure online.

Sentence: Je joins le document au courriel.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʒwɛ̃ lə dɔ.ky.mɑ̃ o ku.ʁjɛl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh zhwan luh doh-kyu-man oh koo-ryel
Sentence_Translation: I attach the document to the email.

Sentence: Je présente une pièce d'identité.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁe.zɑ̃t yn pjɛs d‿i.dɑ̃.ti.te/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh pray-zan-t oon pyess deed-an-tee-tay
Sentence_Translation: I show an ID document.

Sentence: Il faut un justificatif de domicile.
Sentence_IPA: /il fo ɛ̃ ʒys.ti.fi.ka.tif də dɔ.mi.sil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel foh an zhus-tee-fee-kah-teef duh doh-mee-seel
Sentence_Translation: You need proof of address.

Sentence: Je travaille depuis mon domicile.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə tʁa.vaj də.pɥi mɔ̃ dɔ.mi.sil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh trah-vy depwee mon doh-mee-seel
Sentence_Translation: I work from home.

Sentence: Je remplis la déclaration en janvier.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʁɑ̃.pli la de.kla.ʁa.sjɔ̃ ɑ̃ ʒɑ̃.vje/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh ron-plee lah day-klah-rah-syon an zhan-vyay
Sentence_Translation: I fill in the declaration in January.

Sentence: Je vais payer par carte.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ pe.je paʁ kaʁt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh pay-yay par kart
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to pay by card.

Sentence: Je dois annuler ma réservation.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dwa a.ny.le ma ʁe.zɛʁ.va.sjɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh dwah ah-nu-lay mah ray-zair-vah-syon
Sentence_Translation: I need to cancel my booking.

Sentence: Merci de confirmer votre présence.
Sentence_IPA: /mɛʁ.si də kɔ̃.fiʁ.me vɔtʁə pʁe.zɑ̃s/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: mehr-see duh kon-feer-may votr prays-ons
Sentence_Translation: Please confirm your attendance.

Sentence: Je vais réserver une table.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ ʁe.zɛʁ.ve yn tabl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ray-zair-vay oon tabl
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to book a table.

Sentence: Je vais contacter le service client.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ kɔ̃.tak.te lə sɛʁ.vis kljɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh kon-tak-tay luh sair-veess klee-an
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to contact customer service.

Sentence: Je prends un billet pour demain.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ ɛ̃ bi.jɛ puʁ də.mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh pran an bee-yeh poor duh-man
Sentence_Translation: I’m getting a ticket for tomorrow.

Sentence: J'ai un abonnement mensuel.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe ɛ̃n a.bɔ.nə.mɑ̃ mɑ̃.sɥɛl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay an ah-bohn-uh-man mon-swell
Sentence_Translation: I have a monthly subscription.

Sentence: Les horaires ont changé.
Sentence_IPA: /le zɔ.ʁɛʁ ɔ̃ ʃɑ̃.ʒe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay zor-air on shan-zhay
Sentence_Translation: The timetables have changed.

Sentence: Le train part du quai 4.
Sentence_IPA: /lə tʁɛ̃ paʁ dy kɛ katʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh tran par du keh katr
Sentence_Translation: The train leaves from platform 4.

Sentence: Le train est en retard.
Sentence_IPA: /lə tʁɛ̃ ɛ ɑ̃ ʁə.taʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh tran ay an ruh-tar
Sentence_Translation: The train is late.

Sentence: Je prends le métro tous les jours.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə pʁɑ̃ lə me.tʁo tus le ʒuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh pran luh may-troh toos lay zhoor
Sentence_Translation: I take the underground every day.

Sentence: Le bus passe dans cinq minutes.
Sentence_IPA: /lə bys pas dɑ̃ sɛ̃k mi.nyt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh bus pass dahn sank mee-nut
Sentence_Translation: The bus comes in five minutes.

Sentence: Le tram est plus rapide.
Sentence_IPA: /lə tʁam ɛ ply ʁa.pid/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh tram ay plu rah-peed
Sentence_Translation: The tram is faster.

Sentence: Je descends à l'arrêt suivant.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə de.sɑ̃ a la.ʁɛ sɥi.vɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh day-san ah lah-reh swee-van
Sentence_Translation: I get off at the next stop.

Sentence: J'ai une correspondance à faire.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe yn kɔ.ʁɛs.pɔ̃.dɑ̃s a fɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay oon kor-ess-pon-dans ah fair
Sentence_Translation: I have a connection to make.

Sentence: Le retard est annoncé.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʁə.taʁ ɛ a.nɔ̃.se/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh ruh-tar ay ah-non-say
Sentence_Translation: The delay has been announced.

Sentence: Il y a une grève demain.
Sentence_IPA: /il j‿a yn gʁɛv də.mɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel yah oon grev duh-man
Sentence_Translation: There is a strike tomorrow.

Sentence: Je vérifie l'itinéraire.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ve.ʁi.fi li.ti.ne.ʁɛʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh vay-ree-fee lee-tee-nay-rair
Sentence_Translation: I check the route.

Sentence: J'ouvre le plan de la ville.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒu.vʁə lə plɑ̃ də la vil/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhoovr luh plan duh lah veel
Sentence_Translation: I open the city map.

Sentence: La carte est sur le frigo.
Sentence_IPA: /la kaʁt ɛ syʁ lə fʁi.go/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah kart ay sur luh free-goh
Sentence_Translation: The map is on the fridge.

Sentence: Le centre-ville est piéton.
Sentence_IPA: /lə sɑ̃tʁə.vil ɛ pje.tɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh sahn-truh-veel ay pyay-ton
Sentence_Translation: The city centre is pedestrianised.

Sentence: Il habite en banlieue.
Sentence_IPA: /il a.bit ɑ̃ bɑ̃.ljø/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel ah-bit an bon-lyuh
Sentence_Translation: He lives in the suburbs.

Sentence: C'est un quartier calme.
Sentence_IPA: /s‿ɛt ɛ̃ kaʁ.tje kalm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: set an kar-tyay kahm
Sentence_Translation: It’s a quiet neighbourhood.

Sentence: La rue est très étroite.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁy ɛ tʁɛ e.tʁwat/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ryu ay tray ay-troat
Sentence_Translation: The street is very narrow.

Sentence: L'avenue est éclairée la nuit.
Sentence_IPA: /la.və.ny ɛ e.klɛ.ʁe la nɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-vuh-nyu ay ay-klay-ray lah nwee
Sentence_Translation: The avenue is lit at night.

Sentence: Au carrefour
Sentence_IPA: tourne à gauche.
Sentence_Eng_Approx: /o kaʁ.fuʁ tuʁn a goʃ/
Sentence_Translation: oh kar-foor toorn ah gosh

Sentence: Le feu rouge est long ici.
Sentence_IPA: /lə fø ʁuʒ ɛ lɔ̃ i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh fuh roozh ay lon ee-see
Sentence_Translation: The red light is long here.

Sentence: Je lis le panneau trop tard.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə li lə pa.no tʁo taʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh lee luh pah-noh troh tar
Sentence_Translation: I read the sign too late.

Sentence: Le trottoir est glissant.
Sentence_IPA: /lə tʁɔ.twaʁ ɛ gli.sɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh trot-wahr ay glee-san
Sentence_Translation: The pavement is slippery.

Sentence: Traverse au passage piéton.
Sentence_IPA: /tʁa.vɛʁs o pa.saʒ pje.tɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: trah-vers oh pah-sazh pyay-ton
Sentence_Translation: Cross at the pedestrian crossing.

Sentence: Le parking est complet.
Sentence_IPA: /lə paʁ.kiŋ ɛ kɔ̃.plɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh par-king ay kon-pleh
Sentence_Translation: The car park is full.

Sentence: Je m'arrête à la station-service.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ma.ʁɛt a la sta.sjɔ̃ sɛʁ.vis/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh mar-et ah lah stah-syon sair-veess
Sentence_Translation: I stop at the petrol station.

Sentence: Il n'y a plus d'essence.
Sentence_IPA: /il nj‿a ply d‿e.sɑ̃s/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel nyah plu dess-ans
Sentence_Translation: There’s no petrol left.
Elision_Note: ne + y a -> n’y a; de + essence -> d’essence

Sentence: Je fais le plein avant de partir.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə fɛ lə plɛ̃ a.vɑ̃ də paʁ.tiʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh feh luh plan ah-van duh par-teer
Sentence_Translation: I fill up before leaving.

Sentence: J'ai oublié mon permis.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe u.bli.je mɔ̃ pɛʁ.mi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay oo-blee-yay mon pair-mee
Sentence_Translation: I forgot my licence.

Sentence: Il y a eu un accident sur la route.
Sentence_IPA: /il j‿a y ɛ̃n ak.si.dɑ̃ syʁ la ʁut/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel yah yu an ak-see-dan sur lah root
Sentence_Translation: There was an accident on the road.

Sentence: On est dans les bouchons.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ n‿ɛ dɑ̃ le bu.ʃɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: on nay dahn lay boo-shon
Sentence_Translation: We’re stuck in traffic.

Sentence: La vitesse est limitée ici.
Sentence_IPA: /la vi.tɛs ɛ li.mi.te i.si/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah vee-tess ay lee-mee-tay ee-see
Sentence_Translation: The speed is limited here.

Sentence: La route est fermée.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁut ɛ fɛʁ.me/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah root ay fair-may
Sentence_Translation: The road is closed.

Sentence: On prend l'autoroute à midi.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ pʁɑ̃ lo.tɔ.ʁut a mi.di/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: on pran loh-toh-root ah mee-dee
Sentence_Translation: We take the motorway at noon.

Sentence: La sortie est à droite.
Sentence_IPA: /la sɔʁ.ti ɛ a dʁwat/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah sor-tee ay ah drwat
Sentence_Translation: The exit is on the right.

Sentence: L'entrée est gratuite aujourd'hui.
Sentence_IPA: /lɑ̃.tʁe ɛ gʁa.tɥit o.ʒuʁ.dɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lan-tray ay grah-tweet oh-zhoor-dwee
Sentence_Translation: Entry is free today.

Sentence: L'accès est réservé au personnel.
Sentence_IPA: /lak.sɛ ɛ ʁe.zɛʁ.ve o pɛʁ.sɔ.nɛl/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lak-sess ay ray-zair-vay oh pair-soh-nel
Sentence_Translation: Access is restricted to staff.

Sentence: Il y a un contrôle de billets.
Sentence_IPA: /il j‿a ɛ̃ kɔ̃.tʁol də bi.jɛ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel yah an kon-trol duh bee-yeh
Sentence_Translation: There is a ticket inspection.

Sentence: J'ai reçu une amende.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe ʁə.sy yn a.mɑ̃d/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay ruh-sy oon ah-mand
Sentence_Translation: I received a fine.

Sentence: La police arrive rapidement.
Sentence_IPA: /la pɔ.lis a.ʁiv ʁa.pid.mɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah poh-leess ah-reev rah-peed-man
Sentence_Translation: The police arrive quickly.

Sentence: L'ambulance est déjà là.
Sentence_IPA: /lɑ̃.by.lɑ̃s ɛ de.ʒa la/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lan-byu-lans ay day-zhah lah
Sentence_Translation: The ambulance is already there.

Sentence: Les pompiers sont sur place.
Sentence_IPA: /le pɔ̃.pje sɔ̃ syʁ plas/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lay pon-pyay son sur plass
Sentence_Translation: The firefighters are on site.

Sentence: L'incendie est maîtrisé.
Sentence_IPA: /lɛ̃.sɑ̃.di ɛ mɛ.tʁi.ze/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lan-san-dee ay may-tree-zay
Sentence_Translation: The fire is under control.

Sentence: L'alarme sonne pour rien.
Sentence_IPA: /la.laʁm sɔn puʁ ʁjɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-larm son poor ryan
Sentence_Translation: The alarm goes off for no reason.

Sentence: Je lis les consignes de sécurité.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə li le kɔ̃.siɲ də se.ky.ʁi.te/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh lee lay kon-seen duh say-kyu-ree-tay
Sentence_Translation: I read the safety instructions.

Sentence: La sécurité est renforcée.
Sentence_IPA: /la se.ky.ʁi.te ɛ ʁɑ̃.fɔʁ.se/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah say-kyu-ree-tay ay rahn-for-say
Sentence_Translation: Security has been tightened.

Sentence: Il y a un risque de pluie.
Sentence_IPA: /il j‿a ɛ̃ ʁisk də plɥi/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel yah an reesk duh plwee
Sentence_Translation: There’s a risk of rain.

Sentence: J'ai un problème avec la commande.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe ɛ̃ pʁɔ.blɛm a.vɛk la kɔ.mɑ̃d/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay an proh-blem ah-vek lah koh-mand
Sentence_Translation: I have a problem with the order.

Sentence: On a trouvé une solution.
Sentence_IPA: /ɔ̃ n‿a tʁu.ve yn sɔ.ly.sjɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: on nah troo-vay oon soh-lyu-syon
Sentence_Translation: We found a solution.

Sentence: J'ai fait une erreur.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒe fɛ yn e.ʁœʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhay feh oon ay-ruhr
Sentence_Translation: I made an error.

Sentence: Il y a un bug après la mise à jour.
Sentence_IPA: /il j‿a ɛ̃ bœg a.pʁɛ la miz a ʒuʁ/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: eel yah an bug ah-preh lah meez ah zhoor
Sentence_Translation: There’s a bug after the update.

Sentence: L'ascenseur est en panne.
Sentence_IPA: /la.sɑ̃.sœʁ ɛ ɑ̃ pan/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah-san-sur ay an pan
Sentence_Translation: The lift is out of order.

Sentence: Le réseau est saturé.
Sentence_IPA: /lə ʁe.zo ɛ sa.ty.ʁe/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: luh ray-zoh ay sah-tyu-ray
Sentence_Translation: The network is overloaded.

Sentence: Un redémarrage résout souvent le problème.
Sentence_IPA: /ɛ̃ ʁə.de.ma.ʁaʒ ʁe.zu su.vɑ̃ lə pʁɔ.blɛm/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: an ruh-day-ma-razh ray-zoo soo-van luh proh-blem
Sentence_Translation: A restart often solves the problem.

Sentence: La réinitialisation efface tout.
Sentence_IPA: /la ʁe.i.ni.sja.li.za.sjɔ̃ e.fas tu/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: lah ray-ee-nee-syah-lee-zah-syon eh-fass too
Sentence_Translation: The reset wipes everything.

Sentence: Je dois mettre à jour l'application.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə dwa mɛtʁ a ʒuʁ la.pli.ka.sjɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh dwah mett-r ah zhoor lah-plee-kah-syon
Sentence_Translation: I need to update the app.

Sentence: Je vais téléphoner au service client.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ te.le.fɔ.ne o sɛʁ.vis kljɑ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh tay-lay-foh-nay oh sair-veess klee-an
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to phone customer service.

Sentence: Personne ne répond ce matin.
Sentence_IPA: /pɛʁ.sɔn nə ʁe.pɔ̃ sə ma.tɛ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: pair-son nu ray-pon suh mah-tan
Sentence_Translation: Nobody is answering this morning.
Elision_Note: ne ... pas omitted (negative without pas is possible but marked); better: ne répond pas

Sentence: Je vais attendre cinq minutes.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə vɛ a.tɑ̃dʁ sɛ̃k mi.nyt/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh veh ah-tan-dr sank mee-nut
Sentence_Translation: I’m going to wait five minutes.

Sentence: Je cherche mes clés.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒə ʃɛʁʃ me kle/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhuh shairsh may klay
Sentence_Translation: I’m looking for my keys.

Sentence: J'espère trouver une solution.
Sentence_IPA: /ʒ‿ɛs.pɛʁ tʁu.ve yn sɔ.ly.sjɔ̃/
Sentence_Eng_Approx: zhes-pair troo-vay oon soh-lyu-syon
